ZS9INdFibPSBIm769qgFNw.text: The restaurant is on the top level at Planet Hollywood and not the most well marked location.   When we entered it took thirty minutes to get a cocktail while waiting for a table. The restaurant was not that busy.  The food: Steaks were average. The lobster was dry. The sides were all overcooked. Sadly my wifes food even had to be sent back.   overall very disappointing. Would not recommend or return.

3QUselDLDc2JDPHNwXlVmQ.text: We chose The Strip House for our "night before the wedding" dinner a couple of months ago. What an amazing experience! Franchesca helped me plan the event from our customized menu to a centerpiece for the table. David, our main server, was fantastic. The entire staff made the event the highlight of our two-day event. The food was incredible (as always at this restaurant) and the ambiance was perfect. We will remember that night for the rest of our lives. Thank you Strip House!

YPx2fHwqL1thdlUOjfwfdw.text: I have been to the Strip House twice and found it to be exceptional both times.  The portions are quite sizable, so both times we shared meals. The Potatoes Romanoff are to die for!

JMHa6_QD_XK8L5IzMbmqvA.text: Sincerre was top, had ripped potatoes. Seabass delicious. Penalolen cabernet. Almost in heaven :-) sauteed spinach too salty. Brian was a great host. 4.5 stars

7KQqfgpZJ4dJBVIBJ-8oEg.text: This place is hard to find and the menu is a little too simple, BUT the service was out of the world.  Our waiter was amazing and the hostess had communicated the food allergy and the fact that we were going to a show in advance.  The manager made his rounds checking on tables and regulars without being disruptive or unwelcome.  Great experience!

N9nGZrMO9jvIdjYNshGrxg.text: I was super excited to try this restaurant based on the reviews.  Unfortunately the service staff ruined the experience.  The hostess refused to give us silverware for our dessert that we got to go.  I asked if I could have a fork and she rudely told me to call room service...  I had to ask for a manager and he came out in a huff and handed me a fork. I let him know I would make sure I would leave it in the room... He replied the hotel (planet Hollywood) would steal it..   Make sure you come prepared with your own silverware..  3/29/2015 Las Vegas

jNNVPHVdAF-v89rA1IOgTg.text: LOVED IT.  22oz ribeye was amazing, creamed corned with pancetta was to DIE FOR, and the staff was very very very nice!!! I was a very happy person leaving this restaurant, I am definitely coming back! the red velvet walls are pretttttttyyyyyyy sweet too.   i didn't have room for dessert, that is what i regret, but hey, i FINISHED my steak!

CWlnUG-lq-ObsgVfAuII8A.text: During my most recent Girls-Night-Out weekend in Vegas, I wanted to take my friends to Strip House because I had fell in love with the one in NYC. I now have mixed feelings. I am a steak lover. I have pretty much checked out the most popular steak restaurants and thought the steak at NYC Strip House was by far, top 3. The steak in LV was a bit tough for me (I ordered medium rare). The mac and cheese was too cheesy and a bit bland. The cream spinach side was way too salty. My pinot noir was great. My gf loved her lobster pasta (it was pretty good). The overall ambiance is nice, but our waiter lacked personality. He was so serious! Unfortunately, I'd rather go to S&W because the sides there are way better and the people are more down to Earth.

MuO81lFWoRX1VuPihRWbOg.text: The New York cut is amazing. Cooked perfectly. The server was very attentive with whom provided great service.  A revisit for sure.

2HNbv87I1X0yuV-1UuK8rQ.text: This steakhouse is a hidden gem in Vegas! The seafood platter was fresh and awesome.  I loved the lobster bisque and they gave a few chunks of lobster tail in it.  I had the bone in ribeye and she had filet mignon.  No complaints from either one of us.  Been here a few times, never disappointed.  Just never had room for dessert.

HIN1yToOoPyjVMuZHfodMA.text: If you're going to the Strip House for steak . . . the steak was good . . . perfectly cooked . . . and the chef did a great job on the Lobster Bisque.  The oysters were fresh.  The room itself had a great, traditional steak house look.  That's where the compliments end.  Here's the rest of the story : First, I'm not an old codger, but I have to say that dining in a formal dining room with rap music blaring over the speakers ruins the whole experience, even in Las Vegas.  Service?  It was very good . . . nothing to complain about . . . but our wait staff had absolutely no personality.  In fact, there was no personal interaction whatsoever.   Courses arrived so quickly that we felt rushed and were made to wonder if everything was pre-cooked and just waiting for an order to come in.  Aside from the steak, the food was not good.  The chicken, while perfectly cooked, was coated in some kind of horrible-tasting crust.  Most of the sauces and sides ranged from mediocre, (Potatoes Romanoff), to downright disgusting, (oyster sauces with rotten fish smell, sickeningly sweet steak sauce).  In sum, the Strip House was ADAQUATE but nothing really special.  On top of that, it was horribly over-priced.  (We skipped ordering a bottle of wine, because the wine list was laughingly ridiculous).   If I'm going to spend $250 for 2, there are so many very exceptional venues in Las Vegas that I can't think of a single reason to dine here.

kFTBw0LwT-zoNiYmvR0Pfg.text: My husband and I went for valentines day and we were promptly seated. Our server was very friendly but seemed to be confused on our order and brought us the wrong appetizer. We eventually got the crab cake we ordered but the server failed to ever ask how our meal was (which was probably a good thing)   Appetizer: crab cake was just average, unless of course you were going to compare it to the steak- then it would be great  Main course: We ordered a filet with a scallop and blue cheese topping with a side of mushrooms. We'll start with the good, the scallops were delicious, our medium rare steak was over cooked and dry with far less quality beef you would expect for the price. The mushrooms were so salty we each took one bite and spit them out.   Dessert: even though neither one of us are chocolate lovers we took servers suggestion for the 20 something layer cake and to our surprise it was actually very good. If you enjoy chocolate that is not overly sweet this would be a good choice.

Wgh6ojgg3h9wubRFWFT3-Q.text: Strip House was fantastic.  Having been to Morton's last night and Bouchon the week before I was expecting hotel-steak.  No no no this was exceptional.  We were immediately led to our table.  Our server Amanda was right there to tell us the specials.  I could have thought there were 17 of them but she recited them all without note cards or anything, keeping good eye contact while telling us about appetizer specials, entree specials, and dessert specials.  She even mentioned the per-pound cost of the market-cost lobster.  We're two guys on a conference trip so steaks were the thing.  We got a NY Strip steak and a surf & turf (6oz filet + lobster tail).  EVERYTHING was delicious, perfectly cooked, right temperature, great presentation, wonderful.  We started with oysters app and after 6 went and got 6 more...    We ordered a zin, and Amanda delivered that perfectly, like a master somm, kept it off the table, opened it expertly, didn't suggest anyone sniff or do any other weirdness with the cork, and poured it for tasting and consumption.  It was great.  Her service of it was great.  At the end we were offered dessert.  Nagh.  Great service. Great food.  Kitchen did 100% and Amanda did 100%.  Kenny the manager came out when we asked for him so we could let him know we were impressed.  This is a cut above an an order of magnitude better than Elements....  Good job to PH, Strip House, Kenny, and Amanda.  I will come back here again in a heartbeat.  Ehud Homebase: Tucson AZ

CGkJADotu4N9YLn7IkTzig.text: Excellent dinner at Strip House.  Burrata appetizer  was excellent. Large rib eye cooked perfectly rare. Well seasoned with a great black pepper crust. Very tender, great beef flavor.  Excellent creamed spinach. Twice baked potato side was a disappointment.  Prices are expensive but reasonable for a Vegas steak house.   Wine list is steakhouse standard at expected prices.  Favorite of Vegas steak houses thus far.

UYSx93lONN0F9h4UWlGqLQ.text: Best steak house ever! Really, they have the most flavorful and delicious steaks imaginable!. Just about every time we are in town we eat here. You will not be disappointed.... Enjoy!

OICPWaGoEpb5eXNCnou2Eg.text: NY Strip was so delicious.  The food was worth the money.  Service was fine until the food came.  My son had ordered the 20 oz NY Strip and noticed it was the same size as the rest.  He asked the peron who delivered the food who promptly told him it was the big one.  When waiter who took the order arrived he asked again if it was the 20 oz that he ordered.  No, it was the smaller one.  After that service went down hill.  The waiter took a very long time to come back, check how it was going, if we'd like something else, and even the check.

a0ubEDe4f-P_NNGTKhtthA.text: Came here for my wife's birthday and it was a great experience. Food was perfectly cooked. Amanda was our waitress and she was great, very attentive and did everything to ensure we were taken care of!

HbQ5OLPHraGPWDWmgI_TKQ.text: I was extremely impressed with the service, atmosphere and quality of food for the price! My husband and I are BIG steak connoisseur's.  We've been to many upscale steakhouses across the country.  We love a great steak and don't mind paying for it! My husband and I ordered 4 cocktails from the bar and shared an appetizer, salad, entree, 2 sides, 2 desserts and our bill was around $150!  I was shocked at what a great price it was for everything... Other comparable steakhouses on the strip would be much more than that.  The steak was cooked perfectly, well marbled and juicy! Everything we ordered was very tasty!  I will be back for sure!

5QeN-7z2q26jlRcpuJw44A.text: Keeping this on short:  Super yummy seared scallops + delicious steak + creamed spinach with bacon.  5 stars.  'Nuf said.

X9wzuLfHxmDx2EDR-Wv4uA.text: I had a better steak at Sizzlers.  I first saw this restaurant on a show on the Food Network so on our next trip to Vegas, my wife and I had to go and check it out.  The decor was as expected and the service started out good.  We ordered a rib-eye and filet.  We got our steaks and it was like eating something that had no taste and took forever to chew.  The waiter asked how our food was.  I responded with not very good and explained that I have had great steaks at many steak houses across the country and this wouldn't even come close.  The manager came over and asked me again what was wrong.  I explained that our steaks had very little taste and they were like eating cardboard.  He just went on and on about how they heavily season the meat and they are of high quality.  He didn't care.  I will never again step foot in that restaurant and I encourage all try steak lovers find somewhere else when in Vegas.

ArukC8gxUx67hEXurInD4Q.text: We had reservations and was sat property but we did wait 5+ minutes to even see our waiter the porterhouse for 2 was amazing and I had the best cream spinach I ever had the 24 layer cake was awesome just didn't like having to wait for a server to come to us and especially since it was a Monday night

GKC6gRHKJjrQyf2fkcZFJw.text: I'll keep this short and sweet.  WOW! WOW! WOW! 1 of the best Steak restaurants on the strip.  Great Service.  Incredible desserts. Tough location, due to an empty 2nd floor.  Maybe that's why I've never seen it full.  But, don't let open tables fool you, awesome experience every time.

6fVLwNMkIIDmhd4K5XipRQ.text: We called ahead for seating and when arrived they sat the walk in before us. We waited over 15min while for menues while they got drinks for the table that was seated before us. Never assume because I didn't clean my plate that I don't want   Dessert. If my $17 during is gone before you take my order let's assume I'll have another, but if you never ask me I won't buy one.

rNE_c9z_gDnlLFMqyvlNYg.text: Great service, pretty prompt with our reservation time, the food was great! My knife slid through the filet mignon like butter. Asparagus was a delicious side dish. Short wait time for our food. I will definitely dine there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and salmon

j1JdVSCDCRfr25mBPr58iw.text: Best steak house experience ever! Our waiter, John was very attentive and detail oriented. He took the time to explain many house offerings without rushing. We ordered some of the items that he presented, and were absolutely delighted! My compliments to the chef, but mostly I'd like to extend my deepest thanks to John for making this a dining experience to remember!  I'd recommend The Strip to everyone looking for the consummate steakhouse dining experience in Las Vegas! We will most definitely look forward to returning on our next visit! Thanks again!

HrdpHBs2pql7JUfugfgZHQ.text: Our meal was great but the best part of the evening was our waiter, Scott!  He made the evening enjoyable and we have already booked a table for 9/7 when we go to see Jennifer Lopez.

nSREL3GlTVpGTbej2uy4xw.text: I was surprised by how much I enjoyed my dinner at Strip House.  To begin, it's got a cool vibe.  It is dark, which I usually don't care for, but here I was cool with it.  There are also pictures of pin ups around which added to the vibe.    We were immediately approached by our server and ordered a bottle of wine.  Strip House has a decent selection, certainly not the best when compared to some steakhouses on the strip, but I've seen much worse.  The prices were what you would expect to pay on the strip.  We split the crab cake to start.  This was a solid dish, the cake was crispy and came with plenty of tangy remoulade.  I also liked the corn salsa.  It was also a good size, so each of us had several bites.    To eat, I had one of the specials, the dry aged 14 ounce ribeye.  To begin, all steaks are served with a bulb of roasted garlic, which I love.  The steak was excellent.  Cooked to a perfect medium rare, it had excellent crust on the exterior.  To be able to achieve such a crust without any burning is an impressive feat.  It added to the flavor without adding a charcoal quality.  The steak was juicy and the dry aging was noticeable.  I'm glad I ordered it as opposed to the bone in ribeye on the menu.  The dry aged steak may be smaller, but the flavor more than makes up for what you lose in ounces.  On the side, we had the mac and cheese and the potatoes romanoff, or twice baked potatoes au gratin.  The mac and cheese was solid, it was very cheesy and had the requisite string of cheese when you spooned it out of the dish.  Also, a serving contains more than enough for 2 people.  But, the real star was the potatoes.  The parmesan in this dish was fantastic.  It had a nice crusty top and was smooth throughout.  I wish I could create this dish at home.  It's a must order if you are a cheese and/or potato fan.  We had a great evening and were well taken care of by our server.  Strip House may not get the pub of some of the other more famous steakhouses on the strip, but it can more than hold its own.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14 once dry aged ribeye, served with roasted garlic.

T72c5XFRnfTcoK-u5Yi__Q.text: We had an executive private dinner here because it was recommended. We had picked out 1 white wine and 2 red wines (Pinot noir and a Cabernet).  They poured our wine and didn't ask which wine we had before. So my Pinot and cab were mixed, which is a big deal at an "upscale" restaurant. Then we got our steaks and all but one was cooked correctly. The executive next to me ordered a medium rare and got a well done steak. They didn't ask for how I liked my salmon and it was delivered just seared. I was not impressed with the service or the food especially with how much we paid.

wED6l3mXGcOkks1PlZDcZw.text: Yes it's a little pricey. Yes you should more than likely make reservations. Yes you should plan on spending at least two hours here. But oh boy... so worth it. Get the steak. Get the steak. Get the steak. You really don't need a side to go with it but if you do, try the potatoes raminade something. I'm not fancy but I know food. I also know good service and as I'm watching the room and listening to other servers, it's clear -that because it was my birthday -they sat me in the area with the best waiter. His name is John. Please make sure you sit in John's area. And make sure you listen to him.  He knows what he's doing. And tip him well. He makes this restaurant run...  that's all I got to say about that !  Happy eating !

mWKyhj580iQ0eKmRBjabyw.text: Chocolate Cake was phenomenal! We picked up a piece to go. The bartender bagged the cake and put silverware in bag. The cake is worth the money. I would highly recommend stopping in for a slice of heaven.

M6AW7ktDmJ7x1DAS5gfrwQ.text: Enjoyed a our steak dinner here around 6:30 pm, pretty much before other guests arrived. Our waiter Ricky was very attentive and kind. Bread had cranberries and was good. Their steaks have a salt and pepper crust which I found to be delicious. I rated my NY strip 5/5, my husband his filet a 4/5. The kale salad was excellent, so large that I couldn't finish my steak! The kitchen kindly wrapped my steak to-go and provided me plastic utensils. Good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak options. Other specials were available.
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent NY strip cooked to a perfect medium.

XEiqI9bQY9ejG1aHBlYKqQ.text: Our plane had a 9 hour delay because of mechanical issues and we slept in the airport waiting for our flight, so we were tired and hungry when we arrived at Strip.  Though we were underdressed it was no problem.  The service was excellent!  So friendly and attentive!  Husband had dry-aged Ribeye, I had lamb chops, daughter had salmon, and son also had Ribeye.  We also have a 1.5 year old toddler and the restaurant, while not kid-friendly (restaurant is for adults, no kids menus or items) was very accommodating.  Food was great!  Husband said his steak was a little on the salty side, but he still enjoyed it.  Wine was really good, the sides were amazing--potatoes romanoff, goose fat potatoes, and sauteed mushrooms were all equally great!  Even bread basket was good--pretzel bread was so delicious!  Our toddler only wanted to eat the bread!  Oh and the dessert!  Daughter had the multi-layer chocolate cake--it was huge and soooooo good!    The only thing I didn't understand was my husband had what looked like a head of roasted garlic on his plate with a rosemary sprig in it (you can see it in other reviewers photos) I think it was for decoration because the garlic wasn't roasted enough and I am not sure what he was supposed to do with a sprig of rosemary...so decoration i think, but not edible one.   We would definitely come back again!  Thank you Strip for taking in these weary travelers!

KXg8W5WU8ImOdUXNY_xJCg.text: The best experience on the strip- Adrain was outstanding. We were celebrating a birthday- she made us feel beyond special. Her service was hands down attention to detail and she is so professional and personable. We will be back!!!  What an amazing experience.

fw7hTioUt8i9agFhwGl0Jw.text: We went here expecting good service and good food. Our server, John, was VERY good and extremely personable. We ordered filets and added a side of Black Truffle Creamed Spinach.  I don't usually like vegetables but this sounded interesting. It was AWESOME! Very flavorful.  I told John, after paying the bill, that I usually dtip for wine but that I thought so pleased with his service that I tipped on the total bill.  Ask for John!

Z3IQtg8NG6Xq9xVN_-PprA.text: It's delicious. Cool vibe, great service and delicious food. The oysters app is a must. Can't go wrong with steak or seafood. All sides were tasty. Great spot for a large group.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0ITaSX_ovnQfez9CT6hAjQ.text: So what's a nice gal like me doing in a Strip House like this?   Eating anything but red meat lol  Strip House Steak House (it's like a children's rhyme! One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish...) is inside of Planet Hollywood casino--with parent location(s) in NY. All have the similar red walls, sharp, black contrasting decor, low lighting, and backlit picture frames of old-time celebrities/public figures from way back. If you squint your eyes, you can picture cigarette smoke hanging in the air and imagine Bogie coming around the corner with Lauren. There aren't any strongly-themed steakhouses around me (except maybe the chain El Gaucho in Seattle) and I enjoyed being transported to another time. It didn't feel hokey at all.   Steakhouses are not my thing since I don't eat steak, and I never seem to get the quality of food that my beef-eating crew eat when we do go to one. I find something vegetarian/poultry/fish, pay an arm and a leg, and end up feeling dissatisfed.   Strip House changed all that for me. We started off with bread: cranberry, pretzel, and sourdough. The butter was room temperature WOOT! and in a giant ramekin. I do love butter!  I then had the tuna tartare special app: Spiced raw tuna over avocado (FML) with a cucumber wrap, over cucumber (?)-scented water topped with two different kinds of caviar. HEAVENLY. And BIG! I'm a very expressive person, especially when eating, and it must have been weird to listen to me from another table. My only critique is that the spice was not evenly mixed through the tartare, but all is forgiven :D  For my main dish, I had the Scottish salmon over red quinoa with cream sauce and it may have been the best salmon I have ever eaten outside of me making it at home. I live in Seattle, with amazing seafood, and I eat a TON of fish. BOOM. Some of the top salmon in Vegas? I would never had guessed. It was a thick slab of salmon, and was the perfect doneness where the line between cooked and raw is as small as a splinter on a flea's foot. Flawless. Marvelous.  And though I could reflect on all the great salmon I've had in my life for a while, I know for a fact that the black truffle creamed spinach was the best creamed spinach I ever had. It was a shame that I couldn't take the leftovers back to the hotel with me.   No room for dessert, my bill (alone) was $64, which was almost $10 less than my friend who had the steak and mac and cheese. I cannot believe I had all of that, with the quality it was, and excellent service on top of it.   So on my next trip, I'll save some room in my tummy so I can eat MORE!   #100/100 for Yelp Challenge 2013! *wiping brow*

6dSGa1UKblwJnc_06JKLQA.text: The service at this restaurant was outstanding. Daniel was our server and he was spot on in all of his recommendations from the wine list all the way through the desert menu.  My wife and I were both very impressed with the presentation and taste of the food.

XQrqJgvK16QWmbrdF4SXWQ.text: I didn't think this place is anything special. The restaurant wasn't even busy and the server seem disoriented.  The food was just less then good, not worth paying $40-60 for it.   The only nice dish was the spicy tuna tartar.  I would recommend Gordon Ramsey Steak, or Stack if you're looking for a nice steak dinner in the area.

Bn6L3jxZ5cUR4TrQ4uBOXQ.text: Came here for NYE dinner 2013; This was our second go-round from the previous NYE. Strip House was a good choice because it is centrally located on the strip where all the NYE action goes down.  The service was absolutely awesome. They waited on us hand and food. Loved the complimentary bread basket. That bad boy is as endless as you want it to be. Unfortunately, I think I ate one too many pretzel rolls. Oh well...the heck with it! The jury is still out on the food. The bone in rib-eye was ok. There are definitely much better renditions in Vegas, which is steak house mania. Personally, I think N9NE and even THE Steak House in Circus Circus are better. Surprisingly, the lobster bisque was bland. This was disheartening to me as I love a good lobster bisque. We also order the Caesar salad which was delicious.   Unfortunately, something we at here left us with a bad case of food poisoning. We know because this was the ONLY thing we ate all day. No bueno.  Sorry Strip House, you're officially off my Vegas "A" list. For now, N9NE steals the show. We'll have to see if Crafsteak or STRIPSTEAK take the crown.

-HPlLx_PzX_Bgmv82FkwHQ.text: Good, not great.  Price was a bit high vs. food quality.  A cricket (yes the insect) showed up on our table right after we finished eating.  (Posting a photo.)  3 stars is being generous.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A cricket visits Strip.  Not appetizing.

d6_QsVmC1494MTQ3QWHJPw.text: Came in the other night to have a nice expensive steak dinner in Vegas. Gotta have expensive steak in Vegas, right? First thing you notice about the decor when you walk in: Reddddddddd. It's not terrible though. Also, cool vintage/pinup portraits on the wall, and as a photographer, I enjoyed that.  We were greeted by our server Ryan, who proceeded to take care of us perfectly the whole night, without coming by too often. Doesn't that get annoying sometimes? Thank you, Ryan.  The assorted breads came out hot and fresh, and were tasty. The butter was spreadable, unlike other places with cold, hard butter. This is a pet peeve of mine, so I'm glad they do butter right.  Bone-in Ribeye - yes! Good flavor, not hidden by sauce. Sea bass - yes! Nicely cooked, not over-seasoned.  Seared scallops - yes! Wish there were more of them!   Truffle creamed spinach with bacon - almost. Nice idea, but execution was very salty, perhaps too much parmesian cheese? Couldn't eat more than a couple of bites.  Too bad. This ruined their perfect score for me.    It was still a good experience here, particularly because of the great service.

7j8A_3361urZ7WXfr6wm7Q.text: FIance and I had an amazing experience.  We ordered the following:  -Bottle of Anaba Pinot Noir  -Spicy tuna tar-tar to begin -20oz Rib eye for myself (Best rib eye I've ever had, hands down) -8 oz filet mignon for fiance -Sauteed wild mushrooms (AMAZING) -Garlic green beans (Also great)  Brian was our server.  Hope you are lucky enough to get him.  He was awesome!  Great ambiance in the restaurant.  Love the red velvet type setting.  After dinner, we went over to the bar for a little nightcap.  Ordered a glass of 18 year old scotch for myself and some special pomegranate martini for my fiance.  Marc was our bartender, and he was also great.  It was a perfect night for us.  We are definitely coming back!

szPPknqcgjRqCJzXcu829Q.text: The service here was excellent.  Our waiter timed everything perfectly.  The drinks were good and most of the food was good.  The steaks were cooked perfectly but in my opinion they could have used more seasoning.  Our waiter recommended the garlic fries which were only okay.  Actually, not even okay... they were a bit overcooked and dry.  I make myself some better garlic fries from the frozen section at Trader Joe's!  We ate here several years ago so can't remember exactly what else was ordered, but if it isn't memorable, than it wasn't that good.  At any rate, the bill came to around $180 and while cheaper than Craftsteak, wasn't nearly as good.  We probably won't return here, but I do have to say again that the service here was great and maybe it was just a bad night for us to try this place out.  I'd say go ahead and take a chance.

2ekk7mKKADqj3F4edmLxCg.text: Wait staff was amazing. Best service I've ever had. My date and I ate here before the Britney show and had a great time. I had the calamari and filet mignon. Delicious. Tried the Moscow mule for the first time ever. Enjoyed it. Would definitely come back if I visit Vegas again.

YMf6Y4XxFPNdNafYrnwXrg.text: Looking for great service and food on the strip? This place really shines. I've eaten at many of the nicest place in Vegas and was pleasantly surprised.  Service was outstanding.   Decor was nice. We came on a Tuesday night so it wasn't loud or overly full.  We had a party of 2 and ordered the seafood plateau. It was a nice portion of seafood from the raw bar and worth ordering if you plan on ordering two+ seafood options as appetizers. The ribeye was fantastic with a nice pepper crust. They provide plenty of sauces for dishes but you do not need sauces on this food!  Our server, Chris, was very attentive and made great recommendations. He was also a very social server which we appreciated. He made pleasant small talk while he cleaned up our plates and delivered items. We felt right at home.  Overall wonderful experience and we will be back.

oskC59-6pxFMJ7FtkpPifg.text: Unfortunately this steakhouse leaves much to be desired.  After two previous nights of simply divine dining at two other high dollar steakhouses, this one really pales in comparison.  I had the petite filet mignon and lobster tail.  As soon as I bit into it, I thought...wow...I have had better surf-n-turf at Outback!  I expect much better from a high dollar steakhouse.    It also should have been a clear sign when the server brought out steak sauce.  I am a big fan of Mastro's, Morton's, StripSteak, Fleming's....now that being said, these other places NEVER bring out steak sauce unrequested.  They apparently stand behind the flavor and quality of their steaks without the need for "doctoring" it.  Strip House obviously knows their steaks need some "help".  I do want to point out that the service was excellent.  Unfortunately, I don't go to restaurants for their service alone.  A girl's gotta eat and this girl has champagne taste.  I won't be going here anymore.  If you want to spend the money, forget this place and go to one of the other steakhouses that I mentioned earlier.

IJ5F6rTBJi7m4F4jHsOATg.text: This place was amazing, totally on point with EVERYTHING! The decor was so very cool; very dim light, red wallpaper with raised velvety designs (with silhouettes of posing ladies), different sizes and shapes of nude and semi-nude  pin-ups from the 20's and such, back-lit frames, all just very cool.  Our cocktails were all interesting and delicious    I can't say enough about how delicious our food was; we all shared steaks, spicy potatoes, asparagus, and creamed spinach. Everything was "eyes-rolling-back-in-your-head" good!  The most impressive part was our server, I believe his name was John. To begin he smoothly explained all of the specials in intricate detail and made everything sound so appealing. Throughout the meal he checked on us consistently and was consistently easy to find. He seemed to have everything flawlessly under control.  The only snafu ( a very tiny one) was that one of the food runners brought out my friend's steak very, VERY rare (they had ordered medium). John was there within maybe less than a minute (so on point) to check on our meals and once informed of the issue immediately took it away to have it fixed. He returned with it quickly along with a different side dish (as he had taken away the plate my friend had with her sides on it).   At the end of our meal, we were treated to the most delicious and enormous piece of chocolate cake I've ever seen, along with vanilla ice cream and berries. We also enjoyed the caramelized banana tart. We were too full to finish them but OH MY GOD they were amazing.  Definitely not something I could afford all the time, but definitely a place I would save up to splurge on. I was so impressed with everything.

Bm6-3K9HMN6-2aLMln5fYg.text: Outstanding steak House.  Not only was the steak cooked to perfection, the truffle creamed spinach, twice baked potatoes, and 27 layer chocolate cake was to die for.  The only reason I am giving it a four star rating was the wait time after appetizer was way too long at 40 minutes, even though it was a large group.  Highly recommend. Better than Mortons and many of the other Steak Houses I've eaten

AvykMMe6FO5DpjkiZdN8vg.text: This is one of the best steakhouses in the country. Every time I come to Vegas, I make sure to book a table.

a6hgzrrm6bybKZJdiMCIEg.text: We were attending a concert at the PH and wanted to enjoy a relaxed dinner before our concert.  The place has a modern "Mad Men" feel to it.  I could totally imagine Don Draper sitting in a corner table drinking an old fashioned! The food was really good, but the service was outstanding!!! I hope to be back on our next visit to Vegas!

gMODNn8oun-9EM2TlT2FPg.text: Great food here.   Came here with a large party of all hungry guys for my bachelor weekend. Service was very good and the food was great. We ordered everything from onion strings, to their spinach, mac & cheese, duck fat fried potato, sauteed mushrooms, a nice wine, lamb, and of course steaks galore. Everything was good.  They even had us in our own little corner of the restaurant where we were really allowed to enjoy ourselves. Got a little bit pricey at the end of the night, but the quality and service of this joint was worth it for our Vegas trip. It was a nice way to start off the evenings adventures.

PBcVwPClsDDTNFNNERYKXw.text: Really surprised at all the five stars on here. It was OK, but much better to be had for the $$; prices are in line with every other high-end steak joint on the strip. Everything is a la carte, no surprises. Caeser salad for $11 was tasteless; bone-in veal chop for $45 was a very nice cut of meat, but not properly cooked (ordered medium and it was very rare). Server was none to happy about bringing it back to throw on for another few minutes. Great peiece of homemade cheesecake.

QCbCLz3bBWZJOrAW9k_jeg.text: I met up with my sister, her husband, and their friends here for dinner before getting ready to go out for the night.  We were afraid that there would be a wait since it looked crowded but we were seated right away.    They served us complimentary bread and butter while we waited for our entrees.  The bread was a little dry so they tasted as if they weren't fresh.  My sister ordered the filet mignon while I ordered the salmon so we could share.  Both dishes were very good, but I couldn't finish mine because I got so full!  We also ordered the creme brulee and brownie with a scoop of ice cream for dessert and those were very good too!

im0Q0hBwNSCDIAJXqSEAFQ.text: I make it a point to visit a nice steakhouse when I go to Vegas. This place is not worth the money. Yes it's nice, but for the price they charge I expect to be blown away. The filet mignon was amazing! However I found the bone marrow and the tuna poppers appy too rich and oily. The potato puree trio side was decent, but not amazing. The ambiance is nothing special. In my opinion skip over this place and head to the Paris to Gordon Ramsey's STK. it's worth the money. I was there with a party of 5 and we all agreed. Amazing cuts of steak, but nothing else is impressive here.

-SuG9hl_EKS3KruWk6lYCA.text: I loved this place.   Absolutely amazing food. When they bring out your steak, they have roasted garlic with a sprig of rosemary in it. The smell is amazing. I can't describe it.    I would recommend for sides you get the mashed potatoes (I don't remember what they were called) and the green beans in garlic. Absolutely amazing.   For entree we ordered a caprese salad which was nice, but once again Vegas tomatoes let us down.   I never remember the names of the wines I have with dinner, but in any event, this place was amazing quality food. You really do pay for it though.

AdqKZCoET7HHUARjSLjxkw.text: This was our last resort for a nice dinner after trying to get reservations at other restaurants.   We made reservations here and it was kind of sad to see that it was not busy once we walked down from our room in Planet Hollywood. The service was great and our waiter was very patient with us while explaining all of the dinner specials that night.   We ordered fried calamari, rack of lamb, steak and crab and scalloped potatoes. The rack of lamb was crusted with dijon bread crumbs. I didn't like the flavor of the dijon with my lamb though. The lamb was cooked perfectly though and I dipped it with my bf's house steak sauce that he received with his steak. The calamari was perfectly cooked. It was very soft and tasted like it wasn't even fried.

44KWj9ugwv0wDYo7c85Xow.text: It was a better than average steak restaurant. There was a lack of staff which caused our night to be not so good. 20 minutes to get a second round of drinks is unacceptable. My steak was ordered medium and came out well, but the staff would not do anything to correct that issue.  I will not be going back to this restaurant on my next trip to Vegas.

U4sv2tDOPQXiqhNMkiFljQ.text: My daughter and I made a reservation on Christmas Eve for Christmas Day and it was not a problem; I also received a call on Christmas Day to confirm our reservations. Staff was so personable and kind. Carlos was our waiter and he gets 10 stars by himself for delivering great customer service. Carlos is so attentive. I enjoyed the bone in filet mignon which was full of flavor with potatoes twice baked; I think they call it Potato Ramonoff. My daughter had a Caesar salad which was so fresh with calamari which was great as well. The flavor of the food made me eat slowly and enjoy every moment. I was so satisfied but did not have room for dessert. Our bill was a little over $100 and well worth it.

BofWXFWy18muiHsMUi6_dQ.text: If you choose a restaurant based on service alone, this is your place. But I don't know too many that do that. Our server, Amanda, was attentive and wonderful. I've never met a macaroni and cheese I didn't like until now. The cheese was more like the queso we had at Yolos the day before and had no more than 10 small macaroni noodles in it. My husband likes the creamed spinach. The Caesar salad lacked some flavor. The steak was kind of mealy tasting and the Parmesan crust is a waste. The crust just falls off when you cut the steak and it's too thick a slab of cheese. The lobster was also kind of chewy and lacked some flavor. Disappointed in this especially considering the prices you pay at steak restaurants. The grapefruit Moscow mules are delicious.

iv5c2ieQ7R98ziTfC7S_pg.text: Crab legs are insanely expensive. Didn't realize until the bill came. Look - crab legs come out of a box from the north and they are warmed slightly. The menu said market price. But 79 dollars for 4 chunks of the upper legs. For a pound (two full big ones) they are 20 bucks. For that kind of money I could have had a decent something. I never expected that! Good place though.

hfm-eDn3Sr869OrXfDDf7Q.text: Great steak.. a little high but no crowd and intimate setting. Don't forget your wife..

07i0fr8hcSurwnoxFJELRg.text: for the 24-layer chocolate cake and coffee  service is also excellent. friendly and attentive.

GZUtK_gqsJYcfd2oPe6ipw.text: Incredibly disappointed with the service tonight. This restaurant had been one of my go-to spots when in Las Vegas. Not anymore. Bartender Mallory was unengaged and indifferent. I ordered my Bone-in ribeye medium and it was hammered. Brought this to Mallory's attention and she informed the manager, Chris, who came over and apologized.  He offered to redo the steak; however, I declined.

NlzZfNXgPmNGfg7cR42qOQ.text: My boo and I decided to come here for a date night not too long ago and loved it. When you walk in the ambiance is sort of an old school mob type feel. The seats are spread a nice distance from each other and the lighting was very dim and romantic.   Once seated our waiter came by to express the restaurant concept and specials. Throughout the meal he was very nice and helpful. After hearing some of his recommendations we decided to start with the prosciutto appetizer special of the night. It was absolutely delicious. The meat was cut very thin and stuffed with cheese then topped with arugula and balsamic. Very unique and not too heavy of a first dish.  For my entree I choose the lamb chops while my boo stuck with steak. Both dishes were cooked perfectly and didn't even require any additional sauce or seasoning. For a side we shared the spicy potatoes which was the only thing I wasn't a huge fan of. The taste was somewhat bland to me and not enough spice.   Can't forget the best for last, the dessert. We shared the brownie topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. So good!!! Three exclamation points worthy for sure. If you're a chocolate fan, do not pass this up!   Overall we both really enjoyed this place and would come back again soon. It's perfect for a romantic date night and they also have private rooms for group events too.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brownie dessert
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak entree
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy potatoes special

2Gk9WHhBfBTyl1y4G7_Dow.text: Not what we expected from a restaurant with such a great reputation. We were seated around the same time as a few other diners around us but received SOME of our food about an hour and fifteen minutes later. Other parties were served and finished eating before any of our food arrived. When you buy a steak for $100 +, one would expect their sides to accompany their steak to the table. 10 minutes and 2 manager trips later when the confusion settled, the sides were finally brought out. We received an insincere apology. The manager comped the one round of drinks for our table after we declined to stay in his restaurant for another round. We definitely left unsatisfied and don't plan to return. Plenty of steakhouses in Vegas.

Yog3ICNBHfvElzYc3g4-3Q.text: Best 12 oz filet I have ever had! Wow!  Service was great, ambience was perfect, had a great night. It's not cheap but worth it.

J0UbZYE5q47WK8HMsgyhRg.text: Where do I start... This is my second time to Strip House, my wife's first. It was absolutely phenomenal. The atmosphere, service, and food were spot on.  Steak - It is the best charred steak around. The salt/pepper char is what makes the steak. Yes, it is a bit pricey but worth every dollar. My wife called it the best steak she has ever had. I agree.  Sides: we had the strip house potatoes and the crisp goose fat potatoes. I guess we were in the mood for potatoes. Both were excellent. The goose fat are crispy on the outside, soft on inside. Yum.  Atmosphere: you gotta like red because there is a lot of it. The decor and music were perfect.   Service: Ricky is the man. Best service I have had in a long time. He was on top of everything. Very friendly but not in your face. Very attentive!! I am sure the rest of the staff is solid but try and get Ricky as your server.   I am saying I would come to Vegas because of this restaurant but I will not make another trip to Vegas without going to Strip House. Shout out to my brother who recommended it.

AEBjjiSHgVhBS9QJcRozLw.text: The bartenders and servers were so unfriendly and not helpful! Food was good, but I'm all about hospitality along with an experience. If you agree, then you'd probably skip this place

pkqzVYNtq51h8OxrHT9nNA.text: Came to Strip House with a medium sized group. Cuts of steak were terrific and plentiful. The highlight of the meal, however, was the crisp goose fat potatoes. A combination of incredible flavor and decadent texture. Finishing off the meal with the 24-layer cake was a move not to be missed.  Wait staff was professional and adequately responsive. Definitely returning!

UrTxyt1QoUKYIBaKEiMung.text: Hey Tilman,  Question:   How do you go from having one of the BEST steaks - to having the WORST night in 30 minutes?  Answer:  Order the 20 OZ bone in Rib Eye, cooked to perfection, where the next bite is better then the last and you even pick up the bone to savor the flavor - and order the cream truffle spinach.  My wife and I are guests at Planet Hollywood this weekend and made reservations at Strip House, looking forward to a fabulous meal.  As our reservation time approached, we were gambling (and winning) but we stopped so we would not be too late. (Mistake #1)  We were seated and the ambiance, music, wait staff, etc could not have been better! The bread plate consisted of a variety of breads, all which were excellent.  We ordered 2 of the $52 Bone in Rib Eyes and since everything is a-la-cart, we ordered the spinach.   The Rib Eyes (I wont call them steaks as that would be insulting) arrived and were cooked to PERFECTION....the first bite AMAZING. As we worked on them, we also took bites of the spinach.  As we were finishing our meal, I started to feel a little queasy,so I excused myself to the bathroom. When I got back to the table, I asked my wife if she wouldn't mind taking care of the bill as I wanted to go up to the room.  When I got to the room, I barely made it to the toilet before (sorry for the graphic) barfed my guts out.  When you throw up, you can usually taste what the cause was and all I could taste was the truffle spinach.  My wife arrived a few minutes later and immediately did the same thing I did, afterwards telling me she had the same taste.  After we regained our composure, we debated what the cause of our puking (and ruining an otherwise good night) and both agreed it was the spinach.  I called the restaurant and spoke with a manager. I identified myself and told him what happened. He apologized and indicated that he understands that the spinach can be a little rich at times and that he heard of a similar problem happening with the spinach in the past.  He then asked what did I want him to do about it?  I answered I did not know (wanting to see what he said) and he offered us to have us back. That was a nice jester, but at that moment the LAST place I wanted to go back to. (Maybe on another trip as we frequently stay at PH, but certainly not back to back) I was a little surprised that the offer was not to remove it from our room charge, but I don't know if he had the authority to do that.  Rather then going out and having fun gambling, we spent the night in the room.  .  In hindsight, perhaps we should have stayed where we were winning earlier rather then leaving a hot streak for dinner here.  I guess you can say we did gamble....on the spinach.....and lost.  We are at the hotel until Sunday, If anyone wants to contact me.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone In Rib Eye - cooked to perfection at Strip House

FsBwfjc92G8nnATLupuP8Q.text: Ok, we popped in for an early dinner. There were only about 4 tables filled in the entire restaurant. We get seated next to the table of four loud, obnoxious drunks. Great. I was set up to dislike the restaurant already just because of the seating. What saved my opinion of the restaurant was our waiter. He was fantastic. Smart, slyly sarcastic and incredibly proficient at his job. He knew the menu and had great ideas for wine pairings. He absolutely saved our dinner. I had the filet medium rare with grilled foie gras as a topping and my husband had the filet with grilled shrimp. Both were perfectly cooked and delicious. We had the wild mushrooms and Mac and cheese as sides. The wild mushrooms were ok, not very flavorful but ok. The heirloom tomato appetizer was light, fresh and incredibly flavorful. We will go back and pray for a better table and hope for the same great service.

7mhGVs7xhSsws5thR1KdQA.text: Their 24 layer cake is the one for me. I want to marry it in a nearby las vegas chapel if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lN4lbi4Nau7tK6GXk3qk3w.text: This was by far the best restaurant in Vegas.  Our drinks were delicious, the food was excellent.  Our server, Daniel, was very knowledgeable.  We will definitely be enjoying this place again next time we are in Vegas.    We ordered ribeye, filet mignon/lobster combo, the goose fat potatoes, brussel sprouts, crab cake, calamari and the delicious 24 layer chocolate cake.  Everything was delectable!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tnjdiX0tHUncAuYz5j5x3g.text: Excellent steakhouse, if what you're in the mood for is a great steak this place checks all the boxes. It's much nicer lookin in person than the pics online, although it's in a bit of an odd location and was pretty empty on the evening we were there. Nice and quiet surroundings for my wife and I to have a nice meal and celebrate our anniversary.  I had the dry aged rib eye and it was excellent and at only 14 ounces not overwhelming like so many other steakhouses. They do use a pretty aggressive char and the meat is well-seasoned which I enjoyed but if that's not your thing keep it in mind. We had charred broccoli as our side and my wife had a salad and lobster bisque, both of which were great. I won't say anything here blew us away but a steakhouse is expensive comfort food and this place surely provides that. Enjoy!

UTJmAJnZuH1is2V5UODWyA.text: Two of us: 24oz filet for two. Not bad, a little tough. Expected better. Was not tender as expected.    3.0/5  Au gratin potatoes. Very good 4.6/5 Garlic string beans. Very good. Buttery and garlic. 4.6/5 Chocolate cake. Must try.  Rich, but not too much so. 4.6/5 2 glasses wine  -----$200  Overall: solid 3.7/5  Everything was a hit but the meat. This could be a deal breaker for many, and at paying $200 it's understandable.  They will get another chance with me. Would recommend for someone to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Choc cake. Yum!

6Yo8IG2ekyadcRQxXADMXQ.text: Perfect char as if they painted it on. Perfect temperature of the steak. Reasonably priced compared to other steak places in Vegas.

4CS2DKpqZWJeCDxzVtXPCg.text: The service was great really appreciated that. Ordered the bacon and lobster bisque appetizers. Didn't like the lobster bisque, I've had this plenty of times from many different places and this one just wasn't for me. Ordered the surf and turf and the rib eye with Mac and cheese and the potato puree. The sides we're great but our plates were not hot because we misunderstood our server who was just waiting for us to finish our appetizer to bring our food out but we had finished and were waiting for our food. I was put off by this because they brought out lukewarm  steak and lobster that's not ok. I would not return to this steakhouse , I recommend SW at the Wynn.

PeLR-8jodqRBTb9q8znKFw.text: I shall call this post, a "hairy" situation.   I was in Vegas for the last week working at AVN. I felt pretty victorious and wanted to celebrate the occasion at Strip House since I had dined there the last time I was in town and thoroughly enjoyed it.   Was seated at 9pm (my reservation time) in a nice booth and things were going great in the beginning. Our server was attentive and friendly and I was excited for the food. I tried to hold on to this moment later in the evening when I was pissed, but sigh, more on that in a bit.   The food comes and I'm excited, and also starving because I basically worked all damn day without a proper meal. I ordered the 8oz filet mignon and a side of the duck fat potatoes. I was about 1/4 into my meal when I cut into the potato stack (which is crispy on the outside, soft and mashed potato-y on the inside) and I was treated to a rather disgusting surprise.   A hair. AND NOT MY HAIR.   Now, I was at AVN all week. I am not easily scared off by hair. But this hair was long, curly, and COOKED INTO THE BATTER.  I tried not to alarm the person I was with because I didn't want to ruin her meal, but I couldn't hide my facial expression as I figured out what had happened.   I flagged over our server and quietly told him, "hey look, I don't want to draw extra attention to the situation (since there were parties around us), but I found a hair in my food. Cooked into my food."   He was...not as apologetic or surprised as I thought he'd be. He was, oddly, flat in his apology, which irked me since I was purposely trying to tell him quietly to avoid ruining other people's experiences. He asked if I wanted another one (uh no, also it's like 10pm now) and asked about my steak, to which I told him that I didn't think I could finish my meal. Mind you, while this is happening, the pube is staring at me from my plate in front of me. His demeanor wouldn't have bothered me if it wasn't a big contrast to his friendly and attentive demeanor in the beginning of the evening. At his point, I offered to pay for the food I ate before-said incident.    He took the plate away and I waited for a good 15-20 minutes for I don't know what. Finally a manager came, he apologized (which also seemed a bit flat) and offered us a complimentary dessert. He said our server would bring us a menu.  Here I wait another 15-20 minutes, at which point I see our server walk past us, and I also see him give a dessert menu to a nearby table. Our server doesn't come and at this point, I'd rather eat fast food then stay any longer. I flag down the manager and let him know that no one came by and that I'd actually just like the check.   When our server comes by finally, I explain that the manager said he was meant to bring by a dessert menu, but we were going to pass on the offer and just wanted to go and pay our bill. The server then tells us he didn't bring a menu yet because they had to clear the table. I'm not sure if that's actually the policy or he was trying to cover up for the fact that he had forgotten, but either way, he could have updated us on what was going on. And honestly, there's no reason for us to be waiting so damn long.  As you can read in my other reviews, I can forgive a lot when it comes to restaurant service. Wrong orders, being mischarged, etc. as long as you are polite. But if I'm polite enough to tell you I found a fucking hair COOKED into my food and you are apathetic (at best), uhhh. No. Not okay at all. There is no reason why I was waiting for nearly another 45 minutes to get this shit resolved.    Then the bill comes. At this point, I'm thinking the meal will be comped because this was ridiculous. NOPE. It's nearly $100 with tip. Most expensive fucking hair I ever had. And trust me, I was working at AVN ALL WEEK.  NEVER FUCKING AGAIN.

fsKNLRPXixTr7hX_bERDPA.text: Didn't know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Rather than having steak I have the crispy chicken which was half a chicken on a bed of couscous which was outstanding!  Had the potato in duck fat and greatly enjoyed that as well.    Their wine list seemed very shallow but found the Chardonnay from France - Chablis to be delicious but expensive at $18 per glass   Also began with Lobster bisque which was extremely tasty with a dollop of cream   The service was good as well. Next time I'll try a steak.

Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck fat potato

YvbknjJxmxzg0OJv2rac-A.text: Great service, awesome steak, even better 24 layer chocolate cake! Well done Strip House! If in Vegas, must visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow! Superb steak (Bone in New York strip) with the finishing touch, 24 layer chocolate cake.  Well done Strip House!

wKTh_TkLxd9brPIuhfOW5w.text: The atmosphere here is very mature, adult themed and boudoir-like (think red and black, nude photos mounted everywhere). I liked the overall feel and decor. The service throughout the night was very good. Not excellent but very good. High class, pricy but most steak houses are. We had a table of 5 so after we chose all our cuts of meat, all steak of course, we all chose a side. We managed to eat them all or most on the plates so keep in mind, they are of a decent portion size. Steamed Asparagus - waste of money. They had no seasoning and were super thick and woody. They should have been thinner with some flavor - not everyone likes the Bearnaise sauce that comes with it. Onion rings - Massive and cool presentation. They must be good as Arnie (Terminator) and company were a few tables from us and it looked like he was eating them too! That man can eat!  My friend felt though that the onion rings were fried in the same oil in the kitchen as the fish and was turned off by this. Mushrooms - for some reason one of our party asked for them well done and they came out blackened and charred as in ash burnt. So burnt that it was almost a joke. We said nothing and I think our friend felt bad for not just letting the chef do his thing. Twice baked mashed potatoes - divine. I would have been happy with just a bowl of those! There was another side but it was forgettable as it escapes me now...  Bread and butter does come in baskets before the meal. 3 of us had filets - 2 of us were a tad let down. They do come out blackened which is fine but they are not seasoned properly. Of course, no seasonings on the table... for sure not the best steak I have ever had in my life. It did not melt in my mouth and tasted just OK. The men were happy with their NY strip and rib eye. All cooked to our liking which is important. Our other friend with the filet who is normally quite picky was very happy - so I think the idea of an amazing steak is subjective for sure. She also had room for the baked Alaska and wow, they do a great job on that if you are a dessert person. The chocolate ice cream is rich and decadent. Figure that with your meal and a side dish plus 1 alcoholic drink - it is about $100 per person. OK for a splurge but this is Vegas and you just have to be better than the next steak house down the block which it wasn't. Still had a good time here and thankfully our male server was down to earth, cute as a button with the best hair and was quite witty.  3 stars. (but in Vegas you should aim to be a 5)

YMZj_x90OjcMu2mdB919rA.text: Went on a thursday night so it was on the quiet side. Ordered a bottle of wine of their extensive wine list. Apparently they have a sommelier who wasn't in house at the time. Got the scallop appetizer, cooked perfectly and was delicious, but flavors weren't unique. Got the filet mignon medium rare. Again, cooked perfectly! Was a beautiful specimen! They pepper their steaks, which I normally don't like, but it was balanced and not overwhelming and didn't obstruct the flavor.  Service was outstanding, never had an empty glass or cluttered table.

sQrXrIRgKEiFo3PRae0Zvg.text: Best steak I have ever eaten. Table side carved NY strip for 2. This place isn't cheap but worth it. Plan on spending 2 hours as this is leisurely diner. 24 layer chocolate cake is big enough for 4 people. It is gigantic. Scott was outstanding as our server.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xjki5vEiW7GwslU3Bx_lDQ.text: I use Yelp all the time to find new places to eat, especially when I am out of town. But this is the first time I felt motivated to post a review of my own. My wife and I went to Strip House for our 30th anniversary dinner. We left there feeling like it was one of the best meals we had ever experienced.  First, ask for John to be your waiter. As good as the meal was, John put it over the top. He took time to explain multiple dishes to us, and he went out of his way to make our night very special. My wife even hugged him after dinner, he was that good. Thanks John!  My wife had a basic meal of fillet and baked potato. Both were amazing. The steak was as soft as butter. I had the featured bone-in fillet that had cheese crusted on the top and a balsamic reduction below - amazing! I also took John's recommendation of the gnocchi as a side dish. It had a delicious creamy sauce and shaved truffles on top - awesome!  To top it off, John brought us a slice of 20? layer chocolate cake for dessert (complimentary). It was on a beautiful plate that had "Happy 30th Anniversary" painted in chocolate. It also had a scoop of vanilla gelato. We were stuffed, but we ate about 2/3 of it. It was a delicious end to our meal.  We have been to lots of very fine steak houses. I would put this up against any of them. Pair the great food with the great service and this was one our best dining experiences ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful 30th Anniversary Plate!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake &amp; Gelato - Yum!

5FNuPCxBdJrOLF23NVcrKw.text: Amazing! We just spent five days in vegas and had many steaks and my strip here was my favorite steak all week! And that potato dish with green chilies and bacon...to die for. It's a huge side, it's definitely shareable for two or three people. I was so impressed with the steak! They have a huge chocolate cake that our friends swear by, but we were all stuffed! Our server was fantastic.   My only knock...we had eight people around a round table and every single one of us complained that our backs and bottoms hurt from the chairs. They are awful!!! Get a booth because you will be hurting from the nightmare of chairs you have to sit in for the duration of your dinner. but I'll still give it 5 stars.

Ax-HVLDMcKHc2SROCRWaTQ.text: WTF? Am I missing something? The meal started out well with a pretty decent caesar salad but not in the mood for beef I ordered the tuna entree which seems to be a pretty standard fair for a "steak house." When the orders came to the table it seemed like I was sitting in the dunce corner with what looked like an appetizer at best in size and the presentation did not match anything else either. Was the tuna so amazing to justify the small proportioning and odd presentation -- no. Am I going back to take a walk on the beef side for a better experience -- no.

bsmox-Op-BsB8PRXkXx5TA.text: I have to say this steakhouse is truly amazing. The Chateaubriand which can be shared was so juicy and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Alaska
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Beets
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chateaubriand

2NqELHZD3CIuW49Ta1dsWA.text: for a $100/person dinner (with 2 appetizers and a side - drinks excluded), pretty disappointing.   ordered the chef's special filet mignon (6oz) and lobster plate. asked that the steak be cooked medium rare, but it was weirdly dry. the color when i cut the steak was purplish pink, and there was no blood. i like a bloody steak for the moisture and taste. they may have grilled it correctly but drained the blood. the steak was way overseasoned and caked with whatever they powdered it with. i found myself scraping the burnt seasoning off the steak. furthermore, the meat itself had a weird processed taste to it. needless to say, i was not impressed.   the lobster was alright. it could've been served hotter though. they may have left the food sitting in the kitchen before serving it.   friends ordered the crabcake, calimari, and garlic mashed potatoes as well. standard fare. nothing shined through particularly.   if strip house were a stripper, it would be a stretch-marks-on-belly, and flabby 45-year-old who thinks she deserves kate upton money.   if you want an expensive, tasty steak dinner in a "sexy" and sleek environment in vegas, go across the street to the cosmo and hit up STK instead.
