Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip house thru scotch goggles
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and lobster (grilled garlic on side)

wU2pa9R2cd6Bs2ej2sYM8w.text: My boyfriend and I came here before the Britney concert. We were running so late and only had 20 minutes before the concert started. Terrible planning on our part. But the host and server were very understanding. They sat us pretty quickly and the server was helpful in picking things that would come out quickly. We knew we were going to be a little late to the concert, but we were pretty hungry so we accepted that. It actually turned out better than we thought. They had us in and out and we only ended up missing about 15mins of the show.   The food was great. We got the jumbo shrimp cocktail, calamari, 20 oz. bone-in rib eye, truffle spinach and a Caesar salad with a 14oz steak filet on the side. Everything was well seasoned and tasted perfect. Even though we were in a bit of a hurry the experience was great.

OEI9iS9ZbnEUId2rcwqUFQ.text: We tried Strip House on our trip to Vegas. The staff is very attentive.  Our waitress was really helpful and looked like a supermodel.  The food was great and the staff cared about my wife's food allergies.  The goose fat potatoes are truly amazing.  The crispness is out of this world.

1X9pIE4woYNjBDk_uDZvoQ.text: Extremely disappointed. I don't know whether I am more upset over the quality of the food or the fact that I felt ripped off by the cheap and stingy portions.  A group of four of us ate here on Sat 3/4/17. The menu is such that you pay for a main course and the sides separately. We ordered one surf and turf, and one 12 ounce filet, plus three sides: strip potatoes, mushrooms and charred broccoli. I ordered a glass of cab. I order wine every time I eat out and this was the stingiest pour I have ever seen. For $16/glass, I would expect closer to a 9 ounce pour. What I got felt like 4-5 ounces. I was done with my wine before my steak even came out but $16 for a pour that small there was no way I was ordering another.  I found myself eyeballing the couple next to us as they had a bottle on their table and I was longing for a little more.  When our steak arrived I was shocked at how small it was. I knew we had ordered the 12 ounce which would be about six ounces each. I've been on meal plans where I've weighed and measured my protein portions, typically in four ounce portions, and this did NOT look like a 12 ounce steak/6 ounce portion on my plate. I glanced at the steak across the table because it was the smaller filet on the surf and turf and it looked to be the same size as ours. I should mention I wouldn't normally be this focused on the steak size except that we hadn't eaten for a long time and we were starving, plus for $56 for the steak and no sides, one wants to get what they've paid for.  After tasting the steak I couldn't believe how dry it was, especially for filet. The internal temp looked proper for medium, but the steak itself was still dry. I literally found myself putting butter on it to add some fat which is something I would normally not do. The broccoli had the wrong texture to it, as though it had been cooked to al dente but perhaps had sat too long waiting to be served. The other sides- mushrooms and potatoes- were just ok, but really the overall feeling from the meal was that for a very expensive place, it was all just "ok."  No one in our group said anything at the time because it was our first night in Vegas and we all just wanted to have a good time. No one wanted to be complaining about anything and besides, it's hard to have any self respect when you tell them they didn't pour enough wine in your glass or can they come weigh your steak, but the customer should never have to feel they have been gypped when you're at a restaurant as pricey as this one was. We ate and then had a concert to go to but later on we started to talk about it and realized we all felt the same way, and that both steaks were dry, the sides were nothing special, the wine pour was stingy, etc. $200 for dinner with shared entrees and one alcoholic beverage gone down the drain. The next few times we ate out we felt even more annoyed because we were receiving better food, in bigger portions, for better pricing. Examples, Aria Cafe, Aria Buffett, grand Lux Cafe, Gordon Ramsey's pub and grill.  We decided to return the next evening and let the manager know how we felt but as it was after the fact, he did nothing to remedy the situation. Had he even offered us a couple of glasses of wine on the house or some chips to gamble with I would have felt like their intent was in good faith, but as it is, I would say you take your business elsewhere.

rn-GUI56Ca_BmOQoie7Utw.text: We decided to partake in some gentlemen's shenanigans during a bachelor party in Vegas.  After walking in with a stack full of ones, we were surprised to find out the full name of the place was Strip House...Steak House.  Wakka wakka.  Undeterred we decided to have prix fixe dinner in one of the private rooms.  Our event planner Gabe was awesome and we were able to have some tastefully Photoshop'd artwork affixed to the menus.  As for atmosphere, all I can think of is red.  TLC Red Light Special red, which I suppose goes well with medium rare steaks and red wine flowing.  It's more club chic than steakhouse really.  The private room itself was nice as it pretty much shut out all outside noise once the door was closed.  This proved vital as a fellow female patron was apparently 1 or 5 cocktails in, but who's counting.  If you're hungry you're going to love the prix fixe menu.  The 14oz Dry Aged Rib Eye is not bone-in.  So yes, that is 14oz of pure unadulterated bovine ready to make sweet love to your cheeks.  One of the salad selections was the Roasted Bacon salad.  The term "salad" being used very loosely.  Okay, it was essentially three big slabs of bacon with a small mound of greens because the chef thought "why not, yolo."  Simply brilliant.   I haven't even gotten to the desserts, which include a chocolate cake bigger than some household pets.  If you do a prix fixe menu here, there's is no way you will leave without a food baby gestating in your stomach.  So if you're planning to go to the club after, leave a couple hours buffer to drink some coffee and flush your system.  Otherwise that $1000 bottle minimum will be no bueno.  Trust.  The service itself is top notch.  Our waiter shared some war stories and everything came out fairly fast and on-point.  As for price, I'd say it's reasonable considering all the food, the private room, and the customized menus.    Overall, great place to have a bachelor party dinner.

kj5IJhyGHMRYVlLSu6aczw.text: This was our last night in vegas dinner. 4 of us had no plans and no reservations. We walked up to look at the menu and a very sweet hostess Invited us in and said we could take a table in the bar/lounge. It was very comfortable, fun decor. A nice homage to the New York steakhouses we all love. White dinner jackets on the bread boy etc.  The food was great. We all had steaks. All were perfectly seasoned and cooked. No salt or pepper was necessary. Even their own steak sauce wasn't needed, it was good, but not needed to drown a bad or poorly cooked steak.  The creamed spinach...well...let's just say I had to take a moment. It was a sort of religious experience. But seriously, it was really good. A great play on a classic steakhouse side.  Good food, good service, definitely a do again.

GRVs6vZt71ldSMvK8q14eg.text: Went with a friend for dinner. Had the lobster bisque which was presented very nicely but tasted just ok. Also had the 12 oz filet mignon and the broccoli for the side. The steak was cooked perfectly and the broccoli was in a tasty sauce. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a fancy dinner in Vegas. Can be on the pricey side so be prepared to pony up some cash.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The filet mignon is going to work out.

RY80oAhIaNWaqcpUJ0esFQ.text: Absolutely the slowest service we have ever experienced. There was a nice waitress that greeted us but then we never saw her again. An apology from anyone would have sufficed but they forgot about us although we were in plain sight. The steak was overcooked, the steak I made tonight that I bought from Smiths was so much better sadly. Horrible food, weak drinks and the absolute worst steakhouse I've been to. What waste of my hard earned money.

do7JDPPX0MZ8IMs-aTlw5w.text: Just about a carbon copy of their restaurant in lower Manhattan..that we have dined at a few times over the past few years. beautifully decorated....quiet and respectful.....delicious food...excellent service and very expensive. Its supposed to be designed like you are dining in a very high end bordello. Cannot say a bad word about our experience. I had the bone in rib eye($54)...juicy and full of flavor. My wife had her usual salmon....said it melted in her mouth. My son had the 16 oz. NY strip and declared it very very good. to start..our drinks were potent and made correctly. two us split a Caesar salad. we all shared the creamed spinach and the goose fat potatoes. No room left for dessert. Its a pretty standard steakhouse experience but I say that in a positive way. You get what you pay for..and what you get here are really good meals!!

M0IDDNEgaazhOuhQqt4YJg.text: Awesome place for a nice steak dinner. We had tuna tartare for an appetizer, which was very delicious and flavorful. For entrees we ordered New York strip which was out of this world amazing and rack of lamb, which was good, but not outstanding. For sides we had goose fat fried potato, it was just fine, but creamy spinach with truffle oil is a must,  Incredibly delicious!! Overall 5 stars for food and incredible service. Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lab chops
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Tuna tartare!

V66LUqyUDQDTCy3PmKQUVg.text: I had a wonderful experience at the Striphouse in Houston years ago and had received a gift card for the restaurant. I was excited to use it, but was unable to do so before the Striphouse in Houston closed down due to real estate negotiations that fell through (their lease was up, I believe). I looked them up online and saw they had locations in Manhattan and Vegas, so I figured I would be able to use the card at some point in the future. As it turns out, the Vegas and Manhattan locations had been bought out by BR Guest (from The Glazier Group).  Of course, as a patron, I was blissfully unaware of this when I went to use the gift card at the Striphouse in Las Vegas. My dining companion and I went to the Las Vegas location and had a pleasant time -- we had some great cocktails (the Seasonal Cosmo and the Manhattan), some delicious oysters on the half shell, a very nice baby iceberg salad (the stilton cheese vinaigrette was yummy), and then the entrees -- a great bone-in rib eye and a surf-and-turf. The meat was generally nicely done, although the outside of my filet seemed a bit overcooked (yes, they specialize in this -- but it seemed this wasn't their best effort). We also got the black truffle creamed spinach and a spicy potatoes romanoff. The potatoes were a little too heavy on the sour cream, but the spinach was delicious.  Our waitstaff was very responsive, although there was a misunderstanding at some point (may have been my fault -- I asked for horseradish for the oysters and I thought he hadn't heard the first time because he came back with spoons, so I asked again). He seemed like a seasoned server who had been doing this for a long time. It was, generally, a good experience -- although the food wasn't as delicious as I remember it (everything was a tad overcooked and the flavors weren't quite as distinct as my initial experience) and the weird misunderstanding (that again, may have been my bad). When we got our check, I slipped my gift card in excitedly. I had waited so long to come back to the Striphouse after the one in Houston had closed down and I was finally getting a wonderful meal!  Turns out, the gift card was not valid at the restaurant. We were told there was nothing they could do in the restaurant and that we needed to contact BR Guest, their parent company. I did, expecting a favorable, understanding response. After all, we had spent a good bit of money that night -- and were thinking we would be repeat customers since we are much more proximate to Vegas now. However, as it turns out, there was nothing BR Guest could do either. They were incredibly polite, but pointed out that BR Guest had not purchased the Houston location and therefore, there was nothing they could do for me. They suggested calling The Glazier Group (and even helped me out by trying to call for me), but as it turns out, they also said nothing could be done (The Glazier Group has yet to return my phone calls). I wish I could say I was still a huge fan of Striphouse and that I proselytized about their amazing steaks -- cooked so perfectly on the outside and still juicy on the inside -- but this experience with both the Striphouse Las Vegas and with BR Guest (and with The Glazier Group) has really disappointed me so very much.  Unfortunately, I would not recommend coming here, considering the other great dining options in Vegas -- and I would definitely advise against being a repeat customer, because I don't think that this restaurant (which is understandable, since there located in Vegas and it is mainly frequented by tourists) and their parent company are interested in retaining customers.

Ss69kEzyYCrMsp8DKBtdJA.text: It was my first trip to Strip House, but the food was phenomenal. Our table ordered two appetizers, both of which were delicious, and I personally ordered a 12oz filet mignon -- more than I could handle, but it was equally as delicious. To top it all off, our service was completely up to par with the food. Our waitress, Sarah, was highly attentive and attuned to our needs as customers.   My steak had come to the table burned, but after I told them, they immediately offered to rectify the problem. Sarah, their general manager Gabe, and a couple other staff members stopped by to apologize and ensure that everything would be taken care of. They even gave us an additional bottle and asparagus appetizer on the house!   I had a great experience at Strip House and, despite the snafu with my entree, I still highly recommend it.

rUs4E_PwisiUkv6ei6KfGw.text: My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. Where to start...   We had the porterhouse for two which was divine. It is rare that I eat steak but when I do, I look for top of the line. This cut was spectacular and was full of flavor. It comes with a house sauce and roast garlic but this steak did not need anything extra.   Our servers, John and Alexis were fabulous. They were very knowledge about the menu. They were friendly and made us feel like we were the only people in the place. When they hear it was my birthday, they hand wrote out Happy Birthday with my name and gave us the largest piece of chocolate cake. It was very nice. We had to take some back to our hotel and I was further impressed that they provided us utensils.  Thank you for making our night even more special.   The atmosphere was very nice. Classic old Vegas charm. Low light, red, romantic decor. Very classy Vegas.   I read several reviews that said it was too pricey. The price is a little expensive, but you are receiving quality. Come on, it is Vegas and it is a fine dining establishment, the prices reflect the quality and ambience of the food/place. Over all, I think it was reasonable for Vegas prices for fine dinning, in fact it was a little more on the reasonable side for a steakhouse.   In the future, we will make sure to come back here while visiting Vegas.

kKR1dOcdFncIlA-UM-CSBQ.text: WHO WANTS TO GET LUCKY TONIGHT?!?!?   VA VA VOOM...Sexy, Sultry and Sensual; Strip House Steak House are ALL of those things and more. If the food doesn't give you a FoodGASM, the ambiance will set the tone for something else later in the night. *wink wink*  On Saturday, 2/19/11, our party of 9 arrived 6:48 PM for our 6:30 PM reservations. We were promptly seated in our own private room.   F O O D:  *COMPLIMENTARY BREAD BASKET:  -Pretzel bread: warm, soft, chewy and salty  -Raisin bread crusted w/ sesame & poppy seeds: my fav; crusty on the outside and pillowy soft in the inside. A slather of the butter added a creamy rich decadence while the raisins a touch of sweetness and the seeds a savory nuttiness.   -Sourdough bread: I didn't try it.  *COLORADO LAMB RACK w/ Dijon Breadcrumbs & White Bean Stew ($43): AMAZING!!!  The two thick lamb chops were crusted w/ a Dijon bread crumb mixture and perfectly seared, then finished off in the oven to cook to a medium rare.   As I took the first bite, I got a nice crunch from the seared crust and then the soft tenderness from the lamb. The lamb was not overly seasoned and a small ring of fat was left which helped "dress" the lamb in its natural juices producing a piece of meat that was juicy and full of natural lamb flavor w/ a hint of gaminess. The Dijon brightened the lamb by giving it a punch of tang on the palette.   The white bean stew was the perfect accompaniment b/c of its neutrality which let the lamb shine in this dish. The al-dente beans were stewed in a rich and savory gravy which had a slight smokiness from the bits of bacon. I mopped each bite of lamb w/ the gravy and it was like a FoodGASM in my mouth!  *BLACK TRUFFLE CREAMED SPINACH w/ Bacon ($13):  OMFG! *Eyes Roll Back*  I was too consumed w/ scarfing down my lamb to even notice the sides until I started hearing a bunch of "Ohhhhhs" and "MmMmms". My friend said, "OMG, YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS!" and gave me a spoonful.  I took a bite and HOLY SH*T it was BOMB!!!  The creamed spinach was insanely rich and velvety. It was well-seasoned and savory w/ a subtle  woodiness from the black truffles that wasn't overpowering. And, the best part? THE BACON!!! The crisp bacon bits added yet another layer of richness w/ a hint of smokiness.  A DEFINITE MUST ORDER!!!  *MAC 'N CHEESE ($13): SINFULLY DELICIOUS!  The elbow noodles were smothered and intertwined w/ a thick and creamy oooeeegy gooeeey bechamel cheese sauce. As I scooped the mac 'n cheese from the bowl, the sauce was so thick and gooey that you can see the cheese stretch and pull from the bowl to the spoon.  *drools*  The noodles were perfectly cooked to an al-dente and bechamel cheese sauce was packed w/ bold flavors. You can taste the sharpness from the cheddar, nuttiness and creaminess from the gruyere, and you get a nice crisp texture contrast from the breadcrumbs. The ratio of butter, milk and cheese created one MOST mouth-watering Mac 'N Cheeses I've ever had! Every bite, I felt like I was committing a sin; well a Lo-Carb Dieter's Sin to be exact.  S E R V I C E:  IMPECCABLE and ACCOMODATING!  My friend informed SHSH that we were running late due to traffic on the Strip and also told them we were in a huge time crunch and would have to be done w/ dinner at 8 PM. They said, it would be very tight especially w/ such a big group but would try to get us out of SHSH by that time.   Our waiter and the other staff were very professional, friendly and attentive. They knew we were in a rush, so our waiter promptly took our order and everyone's apps, entrees and sides were out w/in 25 minutes! Keep in mind some of us had red meat which takes some time to cook and rest, so kudos to the kitchen staff!  We threw SHSH's staff a curve ball and they definitely went above and beyond the call of duty! They got a party of 9 fed top-notch fare and out of there w/in an hour!!! At fine dining establishments, I normally spend 1.5-3 hours for a party of 2-4, so this is definitely unheard of for me.  A M B I A N C E / D E C O R:  SightGASM for the eyes, SHSH is one of the MOST sexiest, yet classiest restaurants that I've ever been to!   Reminiscent of the SULTRY 1940s w/ dim lighting, scarlet red walls w/ gold decal, mahogany furnishings topped w/ crisp white linens, vintage black and white burlesque photos and LCDs w/ shadow box images of a woman's curves, SHSH will set the tone for one of the MOST sensual and romantic dinners you'll ever have!  FELLAS...*ahem ahem*.  If you're looking to tantalize every one of your senses, look no further, SHSH will satisfy ALL of them! The aroma and taste of the delectable food will please every taste bud and the ambiance will excite your eyes. As far as the other two senses: hearing and touch? Like I said, SHSH will set a tone for what will unfold the rest of the night, if not, I'm sure the alcohol will... ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorado Lamb Chops w/ Dijon Breadcrumb &amp; White Bean Stew! BOMB!

-aqTm2cyk8aNoE681-XEQw.text: Thank you Strip House...you were amazing for Restaurant Week! The service was excellent, glasses were always half full, and everyone had a smile. The server didn't have the restaurant week menu up front though, so I thought we were going to start off on a bad foot, but the rest of the night went smoothly. Starting off was the comp bread platter : yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... There were some good ones there, including pretzel bread, onion bread, and something mixed with cranberries. The bread came out lightening fast...within a minute or two of us sitting down. Then came the salads... yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... Caesar was a nice rendition of the classic.... It had Hearts of Romaine, Paprika Croutons, and Shaved Parmesan. You know it is good if you catch me eating lettuce...I hate lettuce! But this is when I knew the night was going to be amazing....check out the Strip House Roasted Bacon Salad : yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... More like pork belly salad! Look how thick those slices are....and great meat/fat ratio!!! Came with Baby Arugula and Russian Dressing. A MAN'S kind of salad...amazing! On to the entrees! Wife went with the Filet Mignon and added two Seared Scallops (+$12) : yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... The steak was cooked perfectly and had a beautiful char on the outside, but a little heavy to taste with the salt/pepper/mix and the char. Takes away a little from that yummy steak, but not enough to really complain about it. The scallops were amazing though and cooked well with great taste! I ordered the 28 day dry aged Ribeye : yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... It was also cooked perfectly cooked, but with that same char on the outside. The fat was pretty tender, and I ate a good bit of it on purpose lol...but overall it was a 4/5 for me! The sides, Crisp Goose Fat Potatoes and Black Truffle Creamed Spinach : yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... The potatoes were good, with the crust being almost hash brown like, but the Truffle spinach was out of this world! Amazing mix of creamy goodness, with a bite of truffle flavor that was outstanding. You HAVE to order these...blew my mind! They also gave us a side of their steak sauce, but it was WAY to sweet for me...almost BBQ sauce like. I wouldn't order a sauce for a good steak anyways! Dessert...Warm Chocolate Brownie... yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... Just like it sounds, a warm choco brownie. It was good, but not amazing...unlike the Cheesecake with Berry Sauce!! yelp.com/biz_photos/stri... Best cheesecake I've had! The consistency was like whipped butter....super tender and amazingly flavorful! This was the clear winner of the desserts, and an amazing way to end dinner! This is a great steakhouse in town, hiding inside PH! It won't be the best steak in town (unless you really love that salt/pepper char), but it will be a night to remember!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake with Berry Sauce....best I&#39;ve had! The consistency was like whipped butter....super tender and amazingly flavorful!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Chocolate Brownie...just like it sounds! It was good though!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crisp Goose Fat Potatoes and Black Truffle Creamed Spinach. The potatoes were good, but the Truffle spinach out of this world!

Tusj8fCn2Gw0By5ZSGtPfQ.text: Be careful when ordering a steak!  The bone in filet was so spicy I drank my $7 iced tea in two drinks.  Sides were solid except for the charred broccoli.  We ordered the mushrooms, potatoes special, and Mac n cheese.  All were good.  Last we had the chocolate cake.  It was fantastic.  All in all I wouldn't recommend this place for the price.  If you do come in, order your steak with light seasoning.

SaeEhNmGndWEb-fOfrmqgA.text: We lived down the street from the original in Manhattan and ate there many times, before and after the purchase by B.R. Guest. While the steaks remain fantastic, many of the little things that gave the restaurant its charm -- both in New York and Vegas -- have changed for the worse.  One obvious example is the Gorgonzola fondue. This was once the ultimate side item pleasure in the restaurant -- a cheap thrill, if you will, both on its own and as a decadent "dip" for your steak. (The servers and bartenders would ask if you wanted to keep it around, and recommend you do so.) You can still see the fondue mentioned prominently as a feature on the Yelp and TA reviews. Alas, it's a victim of corporate menu-engineering. Too cheap, even as it was a word of mouth item that gave Strip House its wry reputation.  Like the fondue, other minor things have changed that once gave Strip House its own unique charm. The lights? A little brighter. (You'll eat faster and order more.) The music? A little louder and BPMs a little higher. (You'll eat faster and order more.) The service? A little more... perfunctory, even while front-of-house staff remains on the whole talented, warm, and hard-working.  If these sound like nitpicks, they certainly are. But hunks of prime meat in a broiler are a commodity unless infused with some charm. And as Strip House is stripped of its own, it becomes just another very good steak house on par with many others -- that was once something great.

w97klGNbyysbnMU1z8skwg.text: Not an Epic Steak Experience ----------------------------------  MLK weekend.  One of the highlights of a Vegas trip is an epic steak meal.  I make it a point to go to a high end steakhouse as a personal treat.  I decided to try out the Strip House.  I did not have reservations, and my friend was still in bed.  So I decided to go solo exactly at 5:00 PM opening since I was starving.  Plus, I figure I beat the holiday rush.    One of my major pet peeves is when a restaurant is open at said time, and the staff don't  have their  sh*t together. I was seated near the bar and it was apparently obvious I was not welcome at that time.  Then the question begs "why the f*ck did you seat me then?"  The tattooed blonde at the bar was certainly not friendly as I seemed to have inconvenienced her at the opening hour.   But f*ck it.  I am here for steak  The decor was interesting.  It was quiet with lots of red/velvet furniture and old nude photos.  I imagine this is what a strip club in the early 20s would have been like.    Lets focus on the food.  I ordered the New York strip 16 ounce.  Mind you, this is not dry aged.  It was disappointing there was no dry aged option for the New York strip.   The steak was pretty tasty and the special bbq sauce was quite exceptional.  However, it certainly did not exceed the  basic bench mark from your typical chain restaurants like Ruth Chris or Flemings.   So did the Strip House satisfy my epic steak expectations?   The answer is NO.  It was good, but I will certainly not come back.  The steak did not exceed my expectations given the price point.  It was not below average nor above.  If I am paying $$$$,  you better believe the expectations will be that standard.   So in this regard it will get a 3 out of 5 stars.  And another bit of advice, don't come here at 5:00, one may get the stink eye.

21nJ2CX-3rckWIP4hFeouA.text: Since my dad loves steak, we had my dad's surprise birthday at Strip House. To say that the service was great is an understatement.  Franchesca, one of the managers I was in contact with, was extremely nice and accommodating. She helped organize the event from out of state and made sure we were well taken care of. Their staff is top notch! Food was excellent. My family flew in from multiple states and had a great time thanks to them! We had a private room and an awesome staff!  I cannot thank them enough for making my dad's surprise birthday a success! We will be back!

yNTDDN2nt_f3KWWFDOlD_Q.text: This is one of those fancy steak houses I wish I could afford to eat at all the time. However for a special occasion or date night, it is worth every penny.  Strip House, located near other fine dining inside Planet Hollywood, is an upscale, classy, yet modern and semi-sexual style restaurant. The lighting is dim, and after 8:00 PM the volume of the music increases. There are photographs from an earlier time frame of women in the nude, in a very presentable fashion. And the service is off the charts. There were literally people standing around, waiting for my plate to be empty so they could clear it, or my water to be anything less than full, so they could top it off. Impressive.   Between my other half and I, we shared shrimp and crab cocktail, thick bacon, a ribeye, a filet, a side dish full of potatoes, cheese, bacon, and chilies, I was literally in food heaven. I am not sure how I walked out of there, or how my dress still fit me after this. Truly one of the more memorable steak dinners I have had in Las Vegas.  The ribeye, and the potato side were my two favorite dishes. The ribeye has a seasoned rub on it that truly emphasizes the steaks already great flavors.  Overall our bill with a tip for two people, came to $260. As I said at the start of the review, worth every penny.  Live a little, step out of your comfort zone, and eat here! You will not be disappointed.

RHr9gLntLETsbmlaNnStfA.text: This place was incredible. Group of 4. We were all blown away with every bit of our meals. Went to Olives the next night. It was great but did not even compare to the Striphouse

TB7WLEdeeWHDTlXF2Lp6FQ.text: We came here because of the 24 layer chocolate cake which was amazing, but all of the food was amazing. The service was attentive.  The menu is al a carte and pricy.  The steak is seared with salt and pepper crust which was tasty. We ordered two sides. The strip house potato was cheesy goodness. We also ordered a side of sauteed truffle spinach which was delicious. The steaks were cooked perfectly to ordered. I would defiantly go back.

70yu1PZ-JEZXmgjjUgO8Ow.text: The Strip House in PH was our second stop for steak during a week long golf holiday. After a poor experience at Gordon Ramsay's Steak in the Paris we were a bit hesitant.   Our table decided on the Surf & Turf x 2 as well as the Porterhouse for 2. Sides were the mushrooms, mac and cheese and asparagus. Dessert - the 12 layer cake and Baked Alaska.   Service was excellent, prompt and attentive. Carlos, was also knowledgable in what we were looking for in a good wine. The food was delicious and not too overly priced (unfortunately most places in Vegas are). The Porterhouse was excellent as well as the sides with the exception of the asparagus which was quite bland. The lobster was cooked very well and proved to be deliciously tender.   Dessert was tasty and devoured by the table. Lastly, cocktails were well made and refreshing.  All in all, an excellent meal with excellent service. Definitely recommended.

SCCmKcJDDC9qoxb00pTFAg.text: What a place!  Good service and outstanding food.  The Parmesan crusted steak and potatoes Romanov with chili's were what I ordered and I was dumbstruck as to how good it was.    If you are looking for a fine dining experience in Vegas, then the Strip House should be on your short list of places to go.

C4aNWMoWElngmF6b9KuIng.text: Inconsistent seemed to be the theme.   Two  identical steaks ordered, one was half the thickness and the doneness varied, the second was perfect.  Two cocktails ordered, first was good the second looked and tasted like dish water.   2 espressos ordered, one was acceptable (quantity wise) the second was a film in the bottom of the cup.   The wait staff seemed to be amused by the disparity in the orders that came to our table. I would definitely never visit again.

jvVqtiU40EmKIAYDFlSJLA.text: Went here for my birthday on 7/9/15.  Wow!  Excellent, friendly service and the meal was fantastic.  The house Old Fashioned is perfect, actually worth the $20 and I'm typically frugal so that's tough to admit.  We had a prosciutto wrapped salad (daily special) to start that was delicious.  I ordered a 12oz parmesan crusted filet mignon medium rare (also daily special) that was certainly one of the best steaks I've ever had, likely the best.  The creamed spinach was wonderful too.  The duck fat potato dish was good but the least remarkable of the meal.  Our waitress actually recommended the potato romanoff instead and we should have listened. Total bill for two with tip $266, and actually worth it.  2 cocktails, soda water, one app, 2 steaks, 2 sides, no dessert.

-_rgYJpyobHJ8VxSvqwEiA.text: My visit to Vegas always has a high end steak place to try.  I hit some good ones and yet to give a 5 star until now.  In order to get that you have to cook the perfect steak, have a high quality rib eye and  have great service.  Perfect on all counts.  My brother taught me that the rib eye, not the filet migon is the best cut.  Sure the filet is tender, but a great quality rib eye has more fat, more flavor and is quite tender especially if the quality is top notched.  My rib eye hit on all marks.  If you want a Lexus, face it, you cannot pay for a price of a Chevy.  That goes with steaks too.  People's complaints about the expense is not warranted. Then, it must be medium rare, a hot red juicy center.  This was the quintessential rib eye.  The sides were equally tremendous as well.  Each good casino has a high end steak joint and this one belonged to Planet Hollywood.  If you don't look up from the casino floor, you could miss it.  And if you think the Strip House is a gentlemen's club (an oxymoron), you may ignore it.  Don't.  Take the escalator to the second deck and be prepared to be served the perfect rib eye.  I hope future repeat trips give me equal performance.  If they do, I may not try another place in town.  Chris was our server and he was friendly, attentive and provided great recommendations.  Ask for him and you'll likely get the same quality service.

2N_jQBoK4WiWObJK-RBvHg.text: This is my favorite please in all of Vegas!! Some of the best food in town thats for sure! the service is amazing as well. i would say come check this place out!

BEkvaoM1iTFlD_-9IlcTug.text: We hosted a dinner for a dozen people. Limited menu with pre-ordered appetizers and dessert.   It started off well, but it all went off the rails. The food was good but our waiter just disappeared. I don't know if the fact that some sports celebs came in and the entire staff suddenly seemed to be rushing around to make them happy had anything to do with the extremely poor service. We needed to have the dinner last a hour and a half, but when we reached the two and a half our mark, we were done. They never even got around to taking coffee and after dinner drink orders. We had to hunt the waiter down to get the check.   We host dinners often and never had an experience like this anywhere else. And the restaurant was only 2/3 full during our dinner, so it wasn't that they were overwhelmed in the kitchen.      We will not be going back

lzbbqC3qKBqMKmy4naIqlA.text: So I took the Mrs. out for her birthday to this place. Had no expectations, but I thought it might be crowded so I made reservations. It turned out they weren't needed since the place was mostly empty.  We were greeted warmly and at least three times on our way to the table. This was an indication of the quality of the service: warm, thoughtful, and attentive.  For drinks, I decided on a cocktail. From the specialty menu I ordered a whiskey fig concoction. It came with a thyme sprig. I found it alcoholicky and tart. I couldn't get much of the fig taste. I think I would give that a pass if I dined again there.  We ordered the wedge salad with Stilton cheese. Since we were splitting the appetizer, they helpfully cut it in the back for us. I found it nicely done and the cheese was flavorful. The only point for improvement was that I prefer a wedge a bit colder, but that really is a nitpick.   For dinner, I had the bone-in cheese encrusted filet and my wife had the lobster rigatoni. My filet al forno was perfectly cooked and cheese was nicely crusted and carmelized. My wife didn't find the rigatoni to her taste, it was a bit too fishy, although properly cooked and just the right amount of sauce.  For a side dish we decided on the asparagus with bearnaise, and it was great! Nicely prepared and tasty. Usually I hate asparagus but this one was fantastic.  For dessert we split a banana tart and it was very good as well. We were looking for something a little different and it did not disappoint.  Overall, a great dinner with great service. I'd go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana tart with vanilla ice cream
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in filet al forno style, on special.
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad

30KtKf7jRUc9xajnJ0DGpg.text: Imagine this - you're the greeter at a really nice steak house.  A guy walks up to you and asks if there's a table available...in what is clearly a very full restaurant.  you say "how many in your party?" and the reply is "thirteen".  That's exactly what happened a few weeks ago at Strip House.  In this case, however, rather than sneer at us, she called the manager, who opened up a private room for us, and sat us within 10 minutes.  STELLAR.  He gave us our own wait staff....STELLAR.  And all this, mind you, at the drop of a hat, and without reservations.  Then, to really test out how far we could take this, i let them know that we were in a relative hurry, and we wanted separate checks.  No problem...STELLAR.  We ordered our drinks, and after perusing the menu, most of us went the steak route.  The wife and I split one, and it was perfectly cooked.    In fact, this whole experience was about as superb as it could have been.  Kudos to Strip House (and double kudos for a great name, coupled with a great motif that plays on that in the restaurant).  A definite thumbs up.

Uiv0EW2MbxSvxt-qhT35YA.text: Took the wife here for our anniversary. Food and service were great. Wife said it was the best filet mignon she has ever had. Dry aged ribeye was cooked perfect.

7Ar2UV-lD7KfA-sRTNVsgA.text: WOW! We were disappointed that our choices of lobster and oysters were sold out after CES week but they sure made up for it. Food was spectacular, well portioned and beautifully cooked. Brett was our server and he was excellent and took time to speak about the pride he has in the restaurant. 2 of our party only eat fish and they said it was the best seafood they have ever tasted and ethically sourced! The smell of the mushrooms was divine and the whipped potatoes were heavenly. The bountiful crab and shrimp appetizer was the luscious and sinful. Awesome, homemade cocktail sauce. They stand by their product as they should because their distributor is top notch. I cannot wait to go here again and I would definitely recommend it as one of LV's hidden gems.

Qzrdq8fW2izwCDtQBL0aQg.text: This place was so delicious! I loved the ambience and the decor! Which totally added to the food! The staff was great! And I liked how everyone was helpful and wanted us to have a great time!  Had their Moscow mule and aged martini! Both cocktails were exactly what I wanted. And the bartender was great and gave my extra dirty on the side for my martini!  The bread they give you was yummy!  We ordered the steak for two, wild mushrooms and twice baked potatoes!!  We walked in super hungry and walked out beyond happily stuffed!! Everything was perfect! The steak was cooked exactly how we like it! And the blue cheese sauce was amazing!!! Sadly I was way to stuffed to try their layered chocolate cake. But I plan to make a visit back if I ever end up in Vegas again, and will totally save room for dessert!

bP6HKOdm4zdbXV5GPCpSpQ.text: We knew this place was going to be busy on a Saturday night so we made sure to make a reservation a couple of days ahead of time. We got there at 8. The restaurant was moderately busy... about 75% full when we arrived.  The waitress was very knowledgeable. She was able to recite the drink menu by memory while holding it towards us to look at and told us a bunch of the favorites and specials by memory too.   It took us around 20-30 minutes to actually order our food. They brought is different kinds of breads. The pretzel bread was the best and they did not have problem bringing us more since all six of us really enjoyed that kind. We got our food around 30 minutes after we ordered. A couple in our party got the filet and ordered it medium rare, one person got a New York strip cooked well done, and my husband and I shared a 16 oz New York strip cooked medium. All of the steaks were cooked perfectly. The steaks were excellent. I would have to say it's one of the best steaks I've ever had! It had a nice sear and the flavor was delicious. I got the Mac and cheese and it was so rich and decadent. My husband got the garlic fries and ate every single one of them. The server and the rest of the staff were so attentive. No one was without water for more than a few minutes.  The food is pricey but so worth it. I wasn't really excited about going there and spending that kind of money on dinner but it was so worth it and I would definitely go eat there again!!

MZV7k9R3y-5dCHQDDu9oHA.text: We went for the 24 layer cake, so that's all I can speak to. Dollar ratio to Calorie count it's the best deal in Vegas and darned tasty too.  So much of Vegas just doesn't live up to the hype... lines for $24 celebrity chef Hamburgers - Meh - why bother when you can a giant slab of 24 layer cake for $17.   We had eaten dinner a a celebrity chef's pub at Caesar's  for for between $50-100 per person... then the four of us couldn't polish off one slab of cake. Should have skipped the so-so dinner and headed to the Strip for cocktails and cake.

1ypeNWcEBiSUa0SthoYLdg.text: I came here about a week ago with one of my friends and was very impressed. It is a bit expensive but that is to be expected of a steak house, especially for vegas it is actually more reasonable than most. I ordered the Rack of Lamb cooked medium and it was delicious. I've had a lot of lamb I wasn't a huge fan of but it is great here. My friend who was with me hates lamb and I made her try it and even she was impressed. As far as sides we got the iceberg salad and realized the dressing was a blue cheese type of dressing so we asked for it to be switched with the aged sherry dressing which I didn't think I would like but I did. It was refreshing and a great way to start the meal. They had an off menu side available which was a loaded baked potato but it was mashed and all mixed together. Very glad we chose that. They made something that is pretty basic and elevated it. Overall I was very happy with the meal and I think our Servers name was Ricky (sorry if that's not it) he was great and enthusiastic and very attentive to us. He also recommended a blood orange cosmo to us which was very good just a little small for the $17 we spent. But we expected it would be a little smaller since it was a cosmo. Thank you for having us and I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iceberg Salad
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of Lamb
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded mashed Baked potato

ZgVAc54IdIODCnc8AazoNg.text: One of the best steaks I've had in awhile. The pepper and salt crust was delicious. The sides are portioned to share between two people. The only reason I didn't give this a 5 was because of the mellow music that almost made me lose my buzz lol.

GEy63lXnXIMzVlN5y2lpBQ.text: Overall the food is good. Not sure if they are unorganized or if they are under staff. Service could be better. The food is good

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Crisp Calamari*

gqgGJLIBBQww_rmbiR_K5Q.text: I'm so glad we chose to eat at a restaurant inside the hotel we're staying at! So many benefits- no spending on a taxi/Uber, walking distance, casino on the bottom floor, amazing food!  Their steak is phenomenal.. great portions. Ambience is intimate- it was our date night without kids so it served us well! Staff is very attentive and professional. I had one of their Hibiscus bourbon drinks and it was DELICIOUS-the perfect blend of bourbon and sweetness.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L9EssV5M4W59Zxwf8XjQLw.text: I was rooting for them because as we walked into the deep red and very sexy atmosphere I just loved it!  Service was outstanding. Everyone was very attentive and as a team busted their butts to serve a very busy restaurant on a Friday evening. The decor is like stepping back in time to an old Hollywood era and as I've already mentioned I just loved it.   The food wasn't great and we didn't finish anything other than the steak & potato puree. Let's begin with the bread service that was fresh out of the oven and we loved the room temperate butter which I always appreciate because so many restaurants miss that simple detail. Onto the Caesar salad, my least favorite item of the night. We asked for no anchovies which they did but that's all you could taste in the dressing and the fresh poached egg wasn't working with the salad for me. I LOVE poached eggs but not on a salad. As for the meat, decided to split a 20oz New York Strip and it was good. They're known for their method of salt & pepper char which wasn't my favorite. The quality of the meat itself was great but the salt & pepper were both overwhelming. We decided to add some balsamic glaze and parmesan cheese which helped. The whipped potatoes were great but the $29 side of lobster mac & cheese was incredibly fishy. I also found the cheese sauce to be far too dense.   Ended on a sweet note with their baked Alaska and once again didn't hit the spot with me. The bruleed meringue left me with an unusual aftertaste just after two bites.   So overall I didn't hate it but I also didn't love it. 5 stars in decor and service and a solid 2 - 3.5 on cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the decor and black &amp; white photos everywhere
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato purée was great but lobster mac &amp; cheese was very fishy
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York with melted parmesan cheese and balsamic glaze underneath it

J3_526Da5m7W5IVgPOFbgw.text: Had a great experience dining here.  My favorite was the mashed potatoes. So creamy. Will be going back for sure.

VFJO-TO4rHvlsQRaVGYjJg.text: It was high time we returned here, so we finally did, with friends in tow.  The dinner was almost as fine as before--but not quite.  Brown Bread with fruit inside it was excellent, and golden Calamari Fritti was great with a fine Remoulade Sauce.  And a Shrimp Cocktail with Horseradishy Cocktail Sauce featured 4 large and delectable shrimp.  But the Caesar Dressing on my Caesar Salad was far too weak--like a light oil that at best contained only a hint of traditional Caesar flavor.    Lobster Bisque with couscous and cream was velvety and excellent.  A medium-rare 6 oz. Filet as part of a Surf & Turf pairing was very good, although so laden with peppercorns that I knocked 2/3 of them off.  But Goose Fat Potatoes were perfectly crisp, and Potatoes Romanof were creamy and great.    There was one notable service error.  Our server initially brought 2 orders of mixed sauteed Wild Mushrooms to the table instead of 1 plus the Potatoes Romanof.  The error was fairly quickly resolved.  Both Bearnaise and Bordelaise Sauces were quite well prepared.  Overall, a fine 4-1/2 star meal!

GndXfYcirycDtmCPGvYuHA.text: Let's start with Buffy our waitress coming from NY I have seen all types of servers  .However Buffy is the Gold standard she has a great personality incredible energy and just a good person. It was my wife's birthday but the portions are huge and we could not have any desert.Buffy gave my wife a brownie with fruit and a candle so I could sing happy birthday. So she is just very special and my wife loved her.  The steaks were incredible my rib eye was cooked to perfection and my wife enjoyed her strip steak. All sides were delicious and one serving is good for two people. Definitely will return and hope Buffy is there.

Dw3aD7fF6azIOi8uGdF2Pw.text: I can't tell you how pleased we were with this establishment! The service was fantastic and Daniel the assistant general manager took very good care of us in the private wine cellar room! Couldn't be happier!  I've been to a lot of really great steakhouses and this one is definitely at the top! Well done Daniel!!  Thank you so much!  We really appreciate the fantastic evening!

8H3o92Am-4Wc45A9Sxt9Ig.text: Great atmosphere, dark light setting, decor is great.  Bar seating with TV.  Ordered the surf n turf.  The lobster was great (served with butter) however the steak (filet) was just ok.  Not much flavor and was not filling at all for $62.

c-DQcOOza4YKF_duURvvSg.text: When entering the restaurant it is like walking into an old Hollywood speakeasy. The room is very red and dark. It has a cool feel. The staff is very attentive and friendly. Our server was good, he helped choose items with us and answered all our questions. Now to the food, we started by sharing two Italian chopped salads. I would not say it was my favorite salad, it was a bit bland and didn't have many toppings in it. Next everyone at the table had steaks.  Two had the NY strip and I split a 12 ounce filet with another person at the table. The steaks came out and were cooked well. The meat melted in your mouth. The black pepper rub gets very spicy, it is great but if you don't prefer that much spice, the server said they are happy to make it without it. We shared a bottle of wine and one person had a martini. I will say the fact that he had to pay $1 per blue cheese olive after paying $17 for a martini was disappointing. I understand that the martinis will be high priced as this is a higher dollar restaurant, but paying per olive is a little cheap in my opinion.  Anyways, we then moved on to the 24 layer chocolate cake. It was very good and huge. The dessert is clearly enough for four to share. We weren't disappointed in the dessert!  This is a very nice restaurant and I suggest trying it, however, it didn't "wow" me enough that it will be my go to when craving a steak in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip House Signature 24-Layer Chocolate Cake
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip potatoes and Mac and Cheese
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip with blue cheese

QgsOPxe74sbJBItGuvDvvQ.text: For being a fairly large resort and touting some of the biggest headliners on the Strip, Planet Hollywood currently does not offer a real "big night out" dining option. Even though the happy hour at Koi is solid, sitting among those terrible fake plants in the main dining room make me feel like being on a movie set for a straight to video romcom. Pampas is horrendous, and pretty much every other spot is shorts and flip-flops crowd. But if something along the lines of a legit dinner (budget allowing) at PH is what must happen, Strip House is the only call. The ambient red and classic dark steakhouse wood make for a nice setting and an OK-ish meal with a few martinis or a bottle of wine. The chef really likes to season the living hell out of the meats. The salt and pepper crust on my 14 oz medium rare rib-eye almost looked like sweaty pavement upon arrival. yelp.com/user_local_phot... And while the steak was satisfactorily tender, I found the crust to be overpowering and opted to not finish the entree. It might also have had to do with those delicious crispy goose fat potatoes giving me that "devour the hell out of me" look from across the table. My wife didn't mind the seasoning on her rare filet, but that had more to do with it covering a lot less of the surface area of her steak than mine. I'm not sure if light or no seasoning is an option, but I will attempt to request it if I ever find myself here again. I was impressed with our server as he was very cordial, informative and even talked me into a fruity cocktail :P Maybe he's Marc Savard's understudy? He couldn't hypnotize us into one of those huge $15 slices of chocolate cake that kept passing by though. 2.799912643 stars

aVl2tDmib2uTAjWJcjnEvA.text: The food was pretty delicious! The only issue was that even with reservations, we still had to wait to be seated for almost half an hour. The service was also a little slow. The atmosphere was very cool with all the old Hollywood star pictures on the wall. It was just a little loud.

HkFbXmMR4tMaozIGM8001w.text: Love the ribeye. This steak is perfect. not the greatest service, but the meal made up for it. Everyone at the table got a steak and all were very happy. Its all about the ribeye.

DgPe2XNO_-GpSe1dW_bbhQ.text: I don't have enough superlatives for this review and my mother was an English teacher. Five stars to the max!! We went here for my birthday dinner, and were gob smacked. The steaks were absolutely fantastic, the service was impeccable, the general manager, Gabe, couldn't have been more accommodating or kind. Their lobster macaroni and cheese was not only the best that I've ever tasted, it was the best pasta dish I've ever had! The pasta itself is flown in from Italy and each delicious tube is filled with cheese and lobster goodness. It's not on the menu but if they offer it to you as a special, you should order it!! Our neighbors at the table next tonis were quite regretful they didn't get it. Ask for Carlos as your server. He's among the top 3 servers we've ever had in Las Vegas! He's so nice and full of knowledge about everything on the menu. A very kind man whom you'd be blessed to encounter. What a special and memorable night!!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 layer Strip House Signature 24-Layer Chocolate Cake
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grass fed filet

n6oIkahgsGdTf08N-D0FqQ.text: Very attentive staff, but the food took a long time. Granted it was a party of 15. But nonetheless. Overall... the food was delectable and the ambiance was most excellent excellent. I would revisit this place. Thanks for the excellent attentiveness and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak.
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon. Fresh, crisp skin and delicious purée.

Yyu8a-PnZKZsoclrUYdQOQ.text: This place was amazing!! Our waiter Scott was awesome with his knowledge of the menu and recommendations. The steak was the best I have ever had!!

wiauhHyb4aozYnmmZwRJrQ.text: Had a great dinner here.  Shared the surf and turf with my hubby - was fantastic.  Great service too.

Tx3gbOolSM4VIe_JJcjtRQ.text: When visiting Las Vegas one must have a at least ONE meal at a high end steakhouse! On this visit the Strip House at Planet Hollywood was the winner. My buddy had raved about this place, so we went with it. Since we didn't have reservations we just moseyed up to the bar. Excellent service by both bartenders throughout the dinner! Started with the Cocktail Combo, which features two jumbo shrimp and two oz. lump crab. Fresh and delicious! As for the main course, we both went with the 20oz. Bone-in Rib Eye. Cooked and seasoned to a perfect med-rare. Sauteed Green Beans and Garlic Herbed French Fries were the perfect Sides to this meal. No room for dessert after all that! Had to work off that great meal at the black jack tables!

C4VHITxQZVccOEV7ibOTrg.text: Very expensive, but it was delicious. My friend and I each ordered the 8oz. filet mignon which looks small but was just enough; so juicy and tender. The "ripped" potatoes had a parmesan seasoning that was incredible, and the whipped potato puree was so cheesy and delightful. my friend ordered a raspberry martini that she really liked. I ordered the strawberry mojito that was good, but a little hard to drink because of all the chunks of strawberries & mint leaves. The chocolate cake/brownie was VERY rich.

pn5C6zKCAhAhvk4ONyGLqQ.text: Service was amazing. Atmosphere was top notch. Our waitress was funny and very nice. That said, we arrived on time but couldn't be seated because everyone was in a staff meeting. The lobster tasted like rubber and the Baked Alaska was off.

ByUo076HPGoPjCL8Wt9HZQ.text: I came here for the famous 24-Layer Chocolate Cake and overall it was good.  The cake is dense and it's nice to have the layers of cake with the rich ganache.  It's tough for cakes to be moist, but this one did a pretty good job of that.  It also wasn't too sugary-sweet like a lot of other cakes are.  The issue I had with this cake was that it wasn't chocolaty enough.  I could taste the cocoa, but I was expecting a bit more with the decadence or richness of the cake, especially with all the ganache that was there.  I saw this featured on the Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" and I can't say this would go anywhere on my list of the best things I've ever eaten...it was good, but not great.  Many other reviewers mention the same thing and I should have listened because they were right.  The decor of this place is fantastic and also has great service.  We also tried a Caesar Salad, which was good and their Duck Fat Fried Potato, which was really good.  I would definitely come back here to try one of their steak options, but I don't think I'd come back for the cake since there are so many other options out there for incredible chocolate desserts.

EBf_-cnK9609_cGfukBcpA.text: Of all the places at which I dined in Vegas this week, Strip House was the one disappointment. Two stars is probably a bit low, but the "Meh. I've experienced better." is an accurate sentiment.  When I'm paying prices like those of Strip House, I do expect a higher level of food and service, and this place just did not deliver. Our server did his job, but the execution was perfunctory and seemed really rushed. It was laughable when he referred to my friend and I by our first names after cashing us out. I will give kudos to our hostess, who was lovely. Of her own accord, she suggested that we be seated away from a rather noisy table.   Regarding the food, my friend's steak was amazing. Mine was not. We both had the small filet, and while hers was gorgeous, mine was really done past medium and nothing special. I know perfectly well that any good Caesar salad dressing includes anchovies, but Strip House's version was WAY too heavy on the fish. Our sides of whipped potatoes and truffled creamed spinach, however, were outstanding.

qcut7FNLvb2a--oauzEhWg.text: Excellent food!!  Definitely pricey but it's worth it! We all got some sort of steak - I personally got the New York strip medium rare which was perfect- and scallops or crab meat. We slit calamari as an appetizer and ordered a few sides to split with our steaks and they were all fabulous!  I highly recommend:))

daWUUsQBPyJDQKY27a_3QQ.text: The atmosphere and food were great, the service was amazing. The sides are big enough to share and after an appetizer you could easily just split the main entree.

C-84hksqLwWQtU8T8LvtVg.text: Brian C. Was the best server. Handled our bachelor party very well. Outstanding service and the food was great as well but Brian made the experience.

84UQ-mHEpl-Ig8QbNZzKCA.text: While I was skeptical at first, I am very satisfied and impressed with my visit Strip House. The ambiance is very nice, semi-dark with a low-key feel away from a lot of noise.  The food was excellent, from the shrimp cocktail to the entree through dessert, everything hit the right mark. My girlfriend and I both had the filet (sans-bone) and the preparation was great.  Per recommendation from our very attentive waiter (John), we decided on the Caramelized Banana Tart for dessert and it was delicious.  I've dined at several Vegas steak houses and Strip House ranks at the same level of the greats!

KLWs9rvtwjOgmOCoLrlzYg.text: Amazing place!! Went here yesterday for my boyfriends birthday and starting from the very beginning they provided wonderful service and delicious food. Every single employee we encountered was friendly and ready to help us with anything. We both got the New York strip, lobster, and goose fat potatoes and it was all so delicious. Our server was awesome and attentive and when we were too full for dessert, he still went out of his way to bring my boyfriend a small piece of brownie with a candle. I would definitely come back here when I come back to Vegas again. 5 star experience! :)

mPLf9jOuMEp9YDZ271nEFg.text: The Skiiny: mid-level quality steakhouse (3) slow service at times which is not good for a place supposedly of this caliber (3) high prices for what it is, I'd skip this joint(2.5).  We decided to venture here for our anniversary dinner because we heard of the 24 layer chocolate cake. Seeing as how it would be a little bit odd to go to a steakhouse for chocolate cake (hee hee hee), we decided to eat dinner here too.  We ordered a Caesar salad ($14), a bone-in rib eye ($54), their roasted chicken ($29), truffled spinach $12 and their corn special $10. We then finished this off with their chocolate cake.   I love Caesar salads. I especially love it when they use real anchovies and hit it with a good dose of lemon like they do at really good quality steakhouse. Striphouse is not one of those places. Completely generic Caesar dressing flavored this dish which makes me wonder how they can justify charging $14 for this. Oh right - it's the Strip. Whatever... I would not order this here.   Their roasted chicken was definitely below par compared to other similarly priced steakhouses. The key thing is a nice crisp skin of the chicken. There was none of that happening here. As a matter of fact, I stripped off all of the skin because it just wasn't worth it. It was seasoned adequately however I expect a $29 chicken dish to be much better than this. It was just too ordinary to justify this expense.  Their bone-in rib eye was adequate but again, overrpriced for the quality. Perhaps I'm a stickler for what I like on a steak. I found they added too many spices to their steak. A good quality steak needs only very few  ingredients- salt/pepper and a nice oil to cook it in - otherwise you aren't going to taste the steak itself. On top of that, the crust wasn't quite up to par either with a slightly darker hue that what I would expect the perfect steak to be (gold brown). Plus the steak itself didn't have quite the marbling I would have expected for a $54 steak with lots of chunky pieces of fat around the meat. For me, a good quality steak is all about the integration.  To serve it with their house "steak sauce" - which was basically cocktail sauce (cocktail sauce = ketchup + horseradish) - kind of speaks to the level of what we are dealing with. People only add this crap to meat if it ain't that good...and it isn't.  Their corn special that day was roasted corn sauteed with bacon, red pepper baked with some parmesan breadcrumbs on top. I think the breadcrumbs was a little overkill and added an unpleasant grittiness to the dish. The corn itself was a little too tough for my liking and I wouldn't recommend this dish.  The truffled spinach was probably the highlight of our meal. Rich, umami-ish, it comes in a small pot which is brimming filled with this luxurious concoction. It doesn't look like much but once you've dug in, it's actually quite a large serving size because it is so heavy.  Finally, the long awaited chocolate cake. A rather large portion, it reminded me of the that scene from Ronald Dahl's Matilda - you know where that kid has to eat this massive chocolate cake all on his lonesome? Well, anyway, despite the size, the question is - is this the best chocolate cake ever? I would venture to say no. The cake itself was good - not too sweet with good quality cocoa flavor - but wasn't quite as moist as what I expected. The thin layers of chocolate cream in between helped a bit to counter this. Overall not a bad chocolate cake and for it's size, it isn't a bad bargain for $14. It just wasn't quite as awesome as what I'd imagined it would be.   Overall given the price range, this place is definitely not worth the money. Although the food was palatable, for the price you pay, it should be way more than that. Really I think it is more a 2.5 kind joint but I will bump it up to a 3 for the spinach and cake. So even though it rates a 3 star,  I'd give this one a pass.

Bv0IMKLiUe4yqmhAYxI-FA.text: Everyone that works at this establishment was amazing. From the sweet hostess who was willing to help with anything needed to our perfect waiter Scott, you can't go wrong coming here. The food is amazing, the service is immaculate, the drinks are wonderful. Go here and get what you paid for!!

Cq0kNdLn6yL11Xi-_M6_qg.text: Wow. Didn't even know about this place until a friend told me about it. I absolutely loved it. From the rolls at the beginning of the menu, to the dessert everything was excellent. One of the best filet mignons I've had. Very friendly staff. Very nice atmosphere. I'll definitely be back!

hkKaseDIjm9vDJiFkNCR8A.text: We celebrated my best friends birthday here tonight and it was absolutely amazing! Our server john was very attentive and helpful. He suggested items off the menu for us since it was our first time here and he even helped us with portion size. Everyone made sure we were taken care of and even made it a point to bring out a special birthday surprise for my friend. I highly suggest the tomahawk to share! Thank you so much to john and all the staff here. We had a great experience.

ZdoYXMwLU8ShIidIqBnmLg.text: Service was exceptional! Very sexy atmosphere. Worth checking out, and we loved the oysters!

Bt4aswRapr7RnqRnVrA3rQ.text: Great Steak House!!   The service is excellent. You have to make appointment.  The abience is quite upscale, a little bit dark, and well-decorated.  Great selections of wine and definitely delicious steak. The price can be very expensive, but definitely worth it!  I wil ldefinitely come back the next time I visit Vegas.

nLd6NRp3pB9E5wAoD1hnow.text: Wow, that defines the quality of not only the food but the service. Our waitress Adrian, defines what every hostess or waitress should inspire to be. Her beauty, both inside and out was so genuine. I'm a people person myself and I know how it is to be liked or disliked, it's always a great feeling when people appreciate YOU! Adrien was amazing, it's what brings people back, the attention and service they deserve. If you throw the combination of the quality of service plus delicious food with ambience, that leads to prosperity and wealth. It's not about advertising, the word of mouth is everything, it's what brings people back for return business. In any case I ordered the Lamb T-bone and it was amazing, all the side dishes the mushrooms and veggies were freshly cooked. The bar ambience was very impressive it's the first thing you see on the left as you walk in surrounded with great lighting and televisions. Enough said, come on in and enjoy a nice steak and a glass of red at Strip house...

LnqiTR69ouSxxyM7MHfm1w.text: This was a nice steak house that any man would Love! I took Mike for his birthday and lets just say he enjoy himself. I think any man would appreciate a good steak! The ambiance was so nice it was like being in a cool lounge with a great steak, lol! Its a Must Go!
