lcELGpddVQJCsDLdAXtNFg.text: I really wanted to like Strip House. They've got a great looking room, and a good reputation.  But the wine selection wasn't that great and the food was just kind of blah. It wasn't a bad meal, but it wasn't an exceptional meal either, and at the price they charge for a hunk of cow, I want my food and wine to blow me away.  Vegas has some exceptional steak houses. Strip House needs to up its game.

VKucQ6le0gPxniJW-Nc1UQ.text: Food was amazing, waitress was awesome have great recommendations and we loved every bite! Will recommend and even return. Definitely worth a visit try appetizer bacon and scallops.  Respect to the chef as well the lamb was perfect.

O-VI6VRjOI0mVIWgYAVx-Q.text: We had a large party that had a reservation at 6:30pm. We left at 10:40pm. The service was slow and lacking, food was good, but only got one drink in 4 hours.   The server told us the specials and then disappeared for 20min for us discuss it.   Drink order-delivered 15min later.  Dinner was hot and delicious.  Checks were delivered, then they were collected 25min later.   Super expensive, service non existent and the place was empty. Save your time and money.

uxXOhHnhzxJC8nsfgtLMgQ.text: Went with friends. High points and low points.  High point: scallop appetizer was excellent. Low point: beefsteak tomato and bufala mozzarella was just average.  High point: filet topped with crab was excellent. Everyone enjoyed their steaks. The tuna was also good. Garlic green beans were also a winner, as were the loaded gratin potatoes (on special) and the mac n cheese. Low point: asparagus was bland.  High point: brownie sundae and the torte were favorites. Cheesecake was very smooth and yummy as well, but needed extra sauce. Low point: creme brulee ...ick for me.  Service was great on a Sunday night. Atmosphere is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm brownie....wasn&#39;t quite warm, but very good.
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake...very smooth and creamy.

JFGAA_ckNt664QLLn8MAyA.text: Absolutely amazing! Wish I could give 10 stars. The BEST steak I've ever had. Our waiter was Carlos and he was awesome! Everything we ordered was delicious and the atmosphere was so nice and romantic. An absolute must when you're in Vegas! We will definitely be back!

51s-kDdpLWCEFQLpv-cBAA.text: $50 corkage fee!!?? Ownership increase the corkage and raised the wine prices by 3x and 4x. Being a club member does nothing for your experience except 'rewards points'. After the outlandish prices of the food & wine there are other places that are markedly better.   ATTN Mgnt: not everybody is made of excess money.

CZfnaqc8AvuvZdO06i1wIA.text: Super fun, super sexy date night.  5 star food, 5 star prices.

C5l4an-RKOHw365CNZWTtw.text: I responded back to the strip steak house and gave them a copy of the bill with the date and everything she ask for, and that's about as far as it went. I guess it was my fault I didn't ask for a refund so it is a lesson learned for me.  On my next visit in a few months I will be skipping the strip steak house and going to the buffet at Caesars Palace 5 yum!

O1b971TQG5nhXi9am1STuA.text: One of the best steaks I have ever had! Headed her before the brittney show a few months back. With all the steak houses on the strip, it's hard to decide which one to chose! Strip won't upset you!

VHjDcjvOIArD0xnoRo6nhw.text: By far one of the best steakhouses in the country.  Don't pass up the truffled cream spinach.  Came here two years ago when in Vegas and couldn't wait to return.

PlrEuhrJvlNO8tvKfB1gCA.text: A good steakhouse can be hard to find even in Las Vegas. Strip House, however did not disappoint, not only were our steaks prepared exactly to our liking, they were also seasoned to perfection. The sides, salad, soup were also superb, I highly suggest the creamed spinach which is prepared with black truffle wow out of this world delicious!! Great cocktails, fun atmosphere and excellent service from our fantastic waiter Scott make this restaurant one of my favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jriDhNNkGuaO4pvTMC_ArA.text: We had wedding anniversary reservations at Double Eagle Steak House but we arrived in Vegas too late so I had to cancel. So...we came here instead. We were staying at Aria in City Center so it was a quick walk over to PH. The food at Strip House was superb! We ordered the Roasted Bacon appetizer, no regrets there.  I had the filet mignon and upgraded by adding two giant buttery sea scallops for my steak topper. Divine. Husband had the New York Strip and we shared the wonderful potatoes romanoff. I couldn't finish the meal so forget about dessert. The bread basket kept getting refilled and I had a Margarita while my husband had red wine.  I liked the interior decor. It was dark and felt very old Hollywood. Lots of red and black. The Ladies bathroom was very quaint. Overall a very memorable experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our meal - Filet Mignon and Strip

hzmYkZraQC68JpWXyL5VHw.text: We are from the Midwest and have a lot of great steak restaurants. This place does it right. Both of our steaks were cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing.  Daniel was great and very informative. It was a great experience all around!

Fq1JQm5NEhikrIVsq3DT_Q.text: Part one.  We were greeted by an less than warm welcome.  Jarad, some guy claiming to be a manager was rude and snotty about the wine policy.  Aka. They don't have corkage.  If you bring a nice bottle for a special occasion, Per Jared, there is no way they will break policy.   The policy is that you have to BUY another bottle from the wine list which is more expensive than the entire dinner.   No exceptions, with attitude.  Jarad should not be in a customer service position.  If we had not committed to this reservation and location near our show, we would have turned and walked away.   Shameful as a part of Planet Hollywood, that this kind of rude behavior can impact a guest.    Sad. Jarad looks to be about 22, and acts like he has no experience with a high end restaurant.  There are so, so many choices in Vegas.  I urge you to go somewhere else where I am sure they will appreciate your business.  Part two  The food was decent, somewhat average for a high end steak house.  Mastros, STK, and Ruth'sChris have better steaks.  The food was slow.  We waited 20 minutes after a salad for the entree.   The waiters were ok, not great, not bad.  Just sort of off on timing.   My overall thought.  While I had good experience here in the past, things have changed and they are not close to the previous high standard.  Also for the money at a minimum expect people to be nice.  No so much here.    Try STK at Cosmo.  Much better.

Vdx7L5hlD2uR7bFipke52w.text: Best rib eye I have ever had - and that's an understatement. The black pepper crust on these steaks is unreal. Makes the meat infinitely better. The meat is tender, juicy, and every bite is better than the last. They cook the steaks to the exact temperature you ask for. And the service is UNPARALLELED! Do yourself a favor and ask for Ricky. RICKY IS THE MAN! He provided us with one of the best table experiences we have ever had. Such a gentleman, addressing us with "yes sir, yes ma'am". Everything he suggested tasted amazing. We would come back here for Ricky and for the black pepper crusted rib eye. Ps...when he suggests the famous 24 layer chocolate cake, don't say no even though you think you cannot possibly eat another bite. Like Ricky says, you won't regret it

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2lkaGNUTVVNoqDv_YYgYvw.text: What a wonderful experience we had for Valentine's Day! The service was impeccable and the food was over-the-top! Truly one of the best dining experiences ever! The bartender, hosts and especially the server, Scott, knew  exactly how to make a guest feel welcome! They all went above and beyond to make our evening great! I highly recommend going and trying out this gem of a steakhouse!   PS - Order the Manhattan - you'll be happy you did!

goRqwJgcxfjn97dssW6AnA.text: Don't ever eat there SAVE your money!!!! Horrible place me and my husband had the lobster bisque and the lobster tail and I got food poisoning over it. I had to go to the hospital and lasted a good 7 days !!! I contacted corporate and spoke to Linda Loxterman she got my report, I offered to send her proof of the hospital paperwork and she mention to me I would be hearing back from someone, Mind you I was asking for a refund being that our bill was over $200.00 she said someone would be contacting me in a few days. Well days have gone by never heard from anyone, I left her several messages not once did she call me back! Than I get a letter in the mail from Linda Loxterman saying they apologized and since they didn't get any other complaints they weren't refunding me my money! I've never seen such a horrible customer service in such a upscale restaurant!  horrible service pls don't give them any business they have no consideration and they don't care to satisfy there customers!!! Stay away from this pls or don't order there lobster!!!

jVlMs0P0f3XU26ESal34Jw.text: Visiting the Strip House is a reminder to me of two things. How much I love a good steak house, and how amazing it is to experience professional waiters!  I've been to this restaurant on several occasions, and I walked through the door knowing pretty much what I wanted. After five minutes talking to my waiter Brian C, I had completely changed my order.   He recommended the Prosciutto Rolls, prosciutto wrapped around fluffy goat cheese, with shaved parmesan and spicy balsamic. Without hyperbole, it's the best appetizer I've eaten. I also ordered the dry aged rib eye and the spicy au gratin potatoes.   Every recommendation was spot on. The food, the service, the wine (Arrowood Cabernet FTW!) were all spectacular!  This is what makes visiting a high end restaurant well worth the cost. I highly recommend the Strip House, and even more, Brian!

tx5Cakqxsm7YRAte_83Trw.text: I went back to see if the first visit, which I adored, was a fluke. I am thrilled to report it was not.   I booked a special room- and let me tell you they did this right. I was taken care of at every step. They had the whole thing planned out. They took my card before so I would be certain to avoid a client trying to grab the tab. They asked for any special requests and they met each one.   The wine room was a perfect setting. They had it set up with great flair and design.   The service and food were exceptional. I could go on forever- but honestly I quit reading these reviews after a bit and I'm sure you do too.   Do yourself a favor- go to this hidden gem.

fzdUXDYYW-PD4ciQ842X0w.text: The service was perfect! The dry-age ribeye and the way they salt and pepper the steak was amazing. There was something special about how simple the steak was but incredibly flavorful. I'd highly recommend spending an evening here.

4iu_KxAfH_bDMcZVaspMKQ.text: It was ok. Tuna serving is very small. Husband said filet was just ok. Expected more for the price. Service was just ok as well. Will not go back.

WSCVtXByTwwGXLUp5uBARQ.text: Went here for our Honeymoon celebration dinner on April 9th, 2015. Amanda was our server and she was AMAZING. Every detail was attended to. The food was fantastic. I had the filet mignon and my husband had the ribeye. Best steak we've ever had. Also, as a complimentary gift in honour of our wedding, we were gifted two glasses of champagne and a HUGE piece of their 24 layer chocolate cake. We counted, every layer is there and it is delicious. We couldn't have asked for better service or food. We were treated to a great time and we can't say enough wonderful things about their staff. GREAT choice if you're in the area and would like a phenomenal meal.

H9xe80wBb23Hi2GdPsJ3gw.text: Do not be scared off by the name or anticipated ambiance. The Strip House is extremely tastefully decorated with a unique atmosphere. More important, it is the best char on a steak I've ever had. Been here twice and they haven't disappointed. Their steak is prepared in special ovens with a perfect salt and pepper mixture that gives it a perfect combination of char and flavor that makes it easily among the best steaks I've ever tasted.

leRAX8HNI3mpx0E890aV2g.text: Love this place! Scott is the best!! We had the tomahawk steak, dry aged NY steak, black truffle creamed spinach, potatoes romanoff, and 24 layer chocolate cake!!! Best birthday for my Mom!!

gp5DLyw-6AuOv8Jf_mO-eA.text: Went on Sunday evening. Had reservations but still had to wait ten minutes. I ordered asparagus, mushrooms, and broccolini. Steak was good. A solid four out of five. Veggies were delicious. Service was excellent.

njWMpV94JjDRCrvMIQCrIg.text: One of the finer steakhouses on the strip, out of the way in the Planet Hollywood Casino. Superb service and really great food

0Ps4hq2t-ss_XFFXRDeRww.text: I came here for my birthday/new year's dinner, and it was ok.  For the price you're paying, the service is not nearly up to standard, and to be quite honest, neither was the food.    After being left alone for a lonnggg time without bread or drinks, the server told us the specials: surf and turf with any steak you want...sweet. So I ordered filet mignon with lobster. Oh wait, the waiter says, I forgot to tell you that we're out of surf and turf. Wtf? So why did you even include that on the specials? Anyway, he offered to switch lobster for lump crab meat. Meh, ok, I'll try it.  Crab was dry and tasteless, filet was sooo dry, such a shame, I love a good steak. In fact, everyone at my table said their steak was dry. BOO  The "fondue" appetizer wasn't really fondue but it was still tasty, tuna tartare was delicious, creamed truffle spinach was rich and delicious, and their famous chocolate cake was pretty bomb also. But hey, if you're going to pride yourself on being a steakhouse, you better make sure it's perfect.  And the server could class it up a little, it's not outback steakhouse, brah.

bLtfQXtQbwCWflpSxj18QA.text: What happened to this place!?!   I had the special (22 oz boneless ribeye) and the $16 chocolate cake... the steak was great, as I expected, but the cake was awful....  Allow me to elaborate: The cake tasted frost bitten and like it was cut with a rusted knife. And the night after was not good for me at all. I think that the lacking in food quality might have made me the way that I feel today....   Also the service was horrible! The first waiter was rude because I asked if I could have a separate check for the drinks and his reply was "no"... that was it. Also our female waitress acted like she was going to cry, as if she had some personal problems. She was not having any of the small talk from our table.   I know that our average age was 25 but we're there looking for a great meal, so overall we paid $260 for 5 meals when it might as well been 5 dogs from the weinershniztle.   Sadly I'll be going to Caesar's Palace for my steaks from now on. 1 year was great, today, strip house you shame me.  This place can eat my poo.

afEvpO7ZHKbBNVvXvjuvkw.text: Let's start with our server. Carlos. If you ever want the truth, best, customer service in a server, we found him! Exceptional service all the way around! Thank you again Carlos. Now moving on to the food. I ordered a filet mignon and lobster tail oscar style that my wife had the Flaming yawn with lobster tail top of blue cheese. But first we started with the kalamari and Caesar salad. Can I say very flavorful very tasty, cooked perfectly, nice crisp salad. And the timing was perfect. From bringing our appetizers to taking plates away to bringing our second course, to taking plates away to bringing our entrees taking. To top it all off we could not even ordered dessert as I could not put another piece of food in my mouth, yet Carlos knew it was my birthday and ended up bringing out the 24 layer chocolate cake, as a birthday dessert gift! Hands down, the best restaurant experience I have ever had exclamation point

Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a6VPde9waEu51eEdbFWM6g.text: I've been here twice over two separate Vegas trips and I'm glad I found this place. It's a little harder to find since it's inside a casino and then you need to rent a camel and a guide to find it from there. Bring water or your alcoholic beverage of choice to tide you over till you find it. Professor Livingston I presume?! No? You're just a dancer? Where is The Strip House? I've received top notch service here every time. The wait staff has just the right amount of personable cheeriness and attentiveness without constantly interrupting. The Strip House can get super busy so plan a head. The decor is awesome here! Low lights, red highlights and vintage photos of pin-ups/nude models. It has a real old school classy vibe... if you are seated in the back it almost feels like a speak easy. The steaks here are magnificent. Both my father and my buddy both were wholly impressed by the steaks. The side dishes I've tried have a bit to be desired (I did... mac n' cheese and 2 nonstandard potato dishes) so next time I'll stick with the standard mashed potatoes. They make good strong drinks, have a decent selection of more expensive sipping alcohols and carry a good stock of vino.  The desserts here are a bit underwhelming in size but they are very well made and quite tasty. No meal is complete with out dessert! I feel like I would be more suited to smoking a cigar here and enjoying a the ambiance. It's quite comfy and welcoming here and this joint has become one of my faves in LV. I'll definitely stop here for some burnt cow sacrifices whenever I'm in town. I'm a fan!

1ebFByzg-C0vndVr8C98jQ.text: So I came here for a random steak dinner, 1 hour before they were closing. I ordered the 16oz steak, puree of potatoes, and sauteed garlic green beans. (All meals are a la carte) My friends got the filet mignon. When our steaks arrived they were charred horribly pretty much burnt. (I think we upset the cooks with our tardiness) the food was also very salty...we ordered the lobster bisque which was good and Caesar salad but who messes up salad. I was disappointed especially with the amount of money we spent $300 for 3 people....spend your money at Caesars palace buffet, more bang for your buck.

NcI2uoJn59kd-dOpiA7dIA.text: This place is a gem! We had an amazing dinner. I ordered the lobster ravioli plate and it was just perfect. We dine in a private room for 15+ guest. Excellent food and drinks. Service was incredible!

5P9OdO_YCEOGkVqCmoUwhw.text: I would come back here any day.  The food is delicious. The service was awesome. We accidentally came 15 mins before close and they still served us with awesome food.  We mostly ate the chef's special for the night:  - tuna salad - surf and turf - seared salmon  Everything was beyond perfect. I was so glad I wore a dress so I didn't have to unbutton my pants.   Their filet is amazing. Try it!

Yw22NsbW34_9pdpEBsAhHA.text: We had a dinner reservation prior to seeing a show and we still had to wait about 15 minutes for our table.  Oysters were fresh and delicious. Steak was a perfect medium rare with a fabulous crust, and the creamed spinach and Mac and cheese were amazing.  Service at our table was spotty, with long wait times every step of the way, to get menus, order, take care of the bill, even though the staff knew we were going to a show.  I may return if I don't have plans following dinner since the food was so good, but service needs to improve.

4uvqU6CmcKPytBIItK_reQ.text: I recently hosted a large dinner group here and Dawn Hammond made it easy and comfortable.  Everyone had a wonderful time and  the food and  service was excellent.  John and Tiffany did a great job making sure everyone's wine glasses were full and that everyone was happy and well taken care of.  Overall I would recommend the Strip House for a fabulous evening.

byOrw1iUbmamlChqQmb11Q.text: OMG...omgoodness this place is crazy, white linen table cloths, sparkling water, flat water, wtf man a little too much for me. The food was very good, tender and tasty, the prices are STeeeP so bring a wod of cash. Any who the service was nice and fast, until we ran out of "flat" bottled water (we didn't know it was a charge) all they said was "what can I get you flat or sparkling water"... For sure we were going for regular water, pipe water lol but flat sounded close then to find out they were like  would like to get another bottle water or regular water and the we were like OMG regular water so is that not flat water...lol. So it was a little confusing but over all we had a great time, except for the fact that everyone else dining there was so serious, we're like damn smile guys, have some fun, don't be so serious!

8XXuwz2LhQ7BNPJeYPvi0Q.text: We had a pretty large group of people that ate here late (16 people at 10:30pm).  In a quick search of places, it seemed like the only steak house that was open a little later (closed at 11:30pm on weekends).  The food here was good, but not good enough to make me want to go back there.  Also, the portions are pretty big.  Two people could probably share one dinner entree.  For example, their steaks only listed 16oz or 20oz sizes on the menu.

3S5TbHmxJOStkG4Qld3rzA.text: I'm usually not a fan of eating steak out in restaurants because I can buy great steak at Costco for about $30 for three pieces of ribeye and I think I make a pretty good one.  Anyway our company was in town for a conference and we didn't finish our day until about 10pm.  Since we were staying in the Planet Hollywood, our CFO said let's eat here as he ate here the night before.    Strip Steak is in the Mezzanie level next to Koi which is a restaurant/club.  Strip Steak definitely has the feel of a steak house, much like Morton's or Ruth Chris where it's dark inside with wooden chairs, booths and etc.  I had a taste of the tuna, avocado salad which was pretty good however my colleague said there was too much avocado.  I ordered a mac and cheese which was decent and a 28 day dry aged rib eye.  The steak was on the dryer side but it was delicious.  Not sure what seasoning they used but it definitely had a lot of flavor.  I usually don't enjoy steak out in a restaurant but this one changed my mind in the sense that I should get steak next time I eat out.  It could also be that I was super hungry because I didn't eat all day.  I think it was the former though.  I ordered a strawberry mojito which was fantastic with pieces of strawberry in it.  As for why this place gets four stars and not five?  The service.  The waiter seemed to have a harsh tone when talking to us.  He wasn't pleasant, just said what do you want or do you want this and etc.  We all felt the service wasn't good so I was glad it wasn't just me.  Anyway if I am yearning for steak again and am in the middle of the strip, I might come back.  I ate at Cut before and I think the one here was better.

FJTtDFSpwJ6LKZ3fo0g3_g.text: I did want to update my review and say management did contact me and were very apologetic.  I did receive a gift card and will use it when I am in Vegas again soon.  I am hoping my next trip to Strip House will be more like my first, as that was amazing.

6MBFTEdusrZU6V2aHS0-7Q.text: This week, we took my friend out to the Strip House for his birthday. The only thing that matched the high quality of the steak we ate was the waitress we had, Crystal. She was so polite and gave such great recommendations from the menu to enhance our dinner. She was so genuinely nice and even surprised us with a delicious chocolate cake dessert for the birthday boy. Her amazing personality combined with the deliciousness of the food made this birthday celebration one we will never forget!

esmdykiQKBhs9AiOlrvhGw.text: This was the most phenomenal meal I have ever had. The atmosphere is relaxing and classy, with such a unique vintage feel. Scott, my waiter, instantly made me feel at home and less awkward about being alone. My hibiscus cooler was a delicious cocktail. I had the best filet mignon and lobster duo with the potatoes romanoff, which is a twice baked au gratin. My dessert, a rocky road ice cream with marshmallow and salted caramel Rice Krispie was a decadent finish to my perfect meal! Thank you for making such a fun, classy, solo Vegas dinner! I can't wait to bring my family in October!

fZ5CW-hIQDGTlgW0oMk1qQ.text: First off I have to say, be forewarned that this place will cost you an arm and a leg, but the good news is it's well worth it.  I cannot honestly say that I had the best filet mignon of my life here, but it was definitely up there in the top 5.  But their creamed spinach with truffles...my goodness.  The spinach was absolutely to die for!  It is a must if you go there.  We had the goose fat potato, but that was just ok for me. We also shared the bib salad, which was also quite good.   We also tried the house chocolate cake, and I have to say that I was quite impressed.  We boxed most of it, seeing that it is a 24 layer chocolate cake, but it was well worth it.  We ate off of it for the next 3 days.  It was not too sweet, and the cake was moist, delish!  The service was also impeccable.  Our server definitely deserved his tip.  I guess the service should be amazing when you're dropping that amount of money.  But I definitely recommend this restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

dPCIXIb_DmpQ8930Fg0A7A.text: Ive been to the Strip House in Houston and LOVED it. The Strip House in Vegas did not disappoint from a food perspective. Everything was delicious and prepared perfectly. The 2 star rating comes from the fact that I found the service to be less than stellar. Our waiter seemed annoyed by questions about the menu. He argued about splitting our checks. He wasn't terribly responsive to the table's needs. I probably won't go back to this restaurant if/when I go back to Las Vegas. If I Want to go to the Strip House, I'll make the trip to Houston.

Df6AkPNPJvc-eKEcfKulVg.text: A little conflicted about the rating here as the food was really good.  But where the food merited a better rating, I couldn't bring myself to rate higher than three for the value.  And not 'Vegas' value, but compared against other high end steak houses it prices against.  That being said, here we go: 16 Oz NY Strip, medium:  very good, pink throughout with no trace of red, cooked to perfection.  Seasoning for me was fine, but I like things with a little zest, others may find it overly seasoned or salted.  Even so, it really only served as a crust and did not detract from the flavor of the meat itself.  Good cut, minimal marbling, but enough to provide some flavor.  The creamed spinach with bacon was simply amazing; flavored with garlic, truffle oil and large pieces of bacon throughout; I would highly recommend it.  Whipped potatoes and Potatoes Romanov were good, but paled in comparison to the spinach.  ides are served in very small portions, probably enough for two but no more.  Which, for the spinach was a crime.  No dessert tonight.  Service was excellent as well, Chris was our waiter and he was attendant and professional and as good as any I have seen at any similar establishment.  Liked the Vargas girl styled photos throughout as well. To summarize: Food was 3.5 stars ( down from 4 due to the 2 sides which were 'meh')'  service was 5 and value was around a 3 at best, hence the overall rating.

qUQiqGN4qRy4pPhlTga73g.text: Sexy Restaurant!!!!  I felt like I was dining in Old Hollywood....and most importantly Delicious food.  The bartender KNOWS how to make a great martini.  I still think about the amazing dinner I had.  For starters....The martini!!!  DELICIOUS!  Okay...lets down to the nitty gritty....The New England Sea Scallops Edamame Succotash and Black Truffle Butter!!!!  OMG!!!! I love good delicious and amazing food!!!  My friend ordered the pan seared Atlantic Salmon.....she was totally blown away.  and for my entree, I ordered the 10oz Filet Mignon medium rare...it was perfect!!!  I tell you PERFECT!!!!   Along with my Filet I had Black Truffle Creamed Spinach and Whipped Potato Puree (super duper whipped airy mashed potatoes).  I tell you the food here is impeccable and the service is definitely top notch.    I still get happy when I think of this experience and it was unforgettable.    When in Vegas...check out this restaurant.  You will NOT be disappointed.

zVTe-QkGEj8DK8MCqNTMNA.text: Loved the warm garlic bread with Gorgonzola fondue, yummy!  Their porterhouse with baked/mashed potatoes was the bomb!  Although it is pricey the food is excellent.

sYXGPqL4Iye25139zrTezQ.text: I've been wanting to go to Strip House for years. I have no idea why it's taken me so long to finally make it happen. My experience last night (11/14) far exceeded my expectations.   The decor right down to the sillouettes of naked ladies on the napkins more than satisfied my pin-up fetish. I expected the floors to be plush red carpet as well and was surprised to see small tiles. At first I was concerned about noise. (The Palm at Ceasars has a tiled floor and gets ridiculously loud when it's full.) However, the sound level was perfect. Not sure how they did it--perhaps the velvet in the wallpaper was sufficient to absorb the sound.   I was also pleasantly surprised to see how busy it was. In fact, Planet Hollywood in general was totally jamming. Wonderful sight!!  The service was impeccable: never rushed, thoughtful, and thorough without being intrusive. And the food was outstanding. I mostly eat a raw vegan diet when I am on my own. And everyonce in a while, on special occasions, I go overboard. Last night was that night and I was lucky enough to have the best lamb chop I've ever tasted. Extraordinary. The beet salad was beautiful. And my chocolate ice cream filled, hot fudge drenched, pastry puff was scrumptious, simple, and somehow was not overly sweet. Again, perfect.    My companions loved their steaks and all agreed on the excellent service. The winelist was consistent and well suited. Yay! for my favorite: Duckhorn Merlot. I can't wait to go big again.  Decadence in perfect balance.

MwYmE696zpnaE5WaxqPkaQ.text: Strip House serves very good food. I enjoyed the 22-oz. ribeye (cut me some slack, it's only 16 oz. without the bone), and my husband had the filet mignon. Both were excellent and didn't require any of the special sauces you can add (particularly the ribeye, which was appropriately marbled for flavor). Accompaniments like the truffled cream spinach and goose fat potatoes were as good as they sound. Bread served and replenished before the meal was hot and tasty, and the chef even threw in an amuse bouche (a pureed potato soup of some sort).  So why not 5 stars? First off, service was slow. Diners who sat after we did were served before - not sure why. In Vegas where time stands still, this is less of an issue than it typically would be, but nevertheless, it was strange. And with a 10pm reservation, it seems unnecessary. Second, service seemed slightly amateur. Everyone was friendly, but there were little snafus a restaurant like this should never exhibit, like the wine being opened without a dinner napkin, and the amuse bouche being delivered twice. Third, as much as I wanted to love the atmosphere, something just seemed a little off. Maybe it's the Planet Hollywood resort itself, but it bordered on almost tacky - almost. For some reason, in the private room next to us, Oprah was airing on their TV - very weird. And even the choice of flooring...I don't know...it felt like a linoleum diner floor.   Those things aside, this is a good spot, as my 4 stars imply, and many will love it (as evidenced by these reviews). Personally, I prefer Strip Steak and BOA for a Vegas joint with a hip vibe, and Craftsteak and Prime for fancier and more traditional.

ShDI6jJSERWFz22Qu31SxA.text: The ambiance is just great I love the 1920's burlesque photos all over and the sexy red and black. My fiance and I came in for an early dinner at 6pm on a Sunday and we were seated right away in a nice table along the wall with booth seating on one side. our server was nice and prompt. I ordered the watermelon martini which was just ok, its funny because our amuse bouche tasted just like my martini mixture since it was made with watermelon also. We started off with new england scallops, wow! it was one of the best scallop dishes I've ever had. Just melt in your mouth and the sweetness from the corn and the sauce was amazing. The scallops were enormous and perfectly seared on the outside. Next I ordered the filet and my fiance had the Ny strip both were cooked perfectly nice medium rare with a nice char crust and coarse salt. lso wanted the potatoes romaneoff  but they weren't able to make them so we settled for mashed potatoes. We were both so full and had no room for dessert. Its a bit pricey but  I did it enjoy everything very much!

kIFZHaocXoeUVEDm54rtEg.text: I really enjoyed this place. The line to get in seemed a bit long, but it was worth the wait. The food was great, the service was steller (and that was after i spilled a glass of water all over the floor). I had a filet and it was perfectly cooked. I'm not a huge spinach fan but I now understand why pop-eye loved it so much. This place made it really well. It should be a side you plan on ordering when you. Do yourself a favor and placed a reservation on OpenTable or on Yelp to get the time you want. The only downside I experienced was the hostesses seemed to be way too snooty which I really hate about fancy resturants.

cvG3IbQSYs_G1edcb1HiAg.text: I have never been to a nice restaurant. From food, service, decor, atmosphere. So impressed from start to finish. We had heard about the Strip House before, as we stay at Planet Hollywood every time we are in Vegas, but have usually made it too late in time for dinner.  We were sat right away, and our waiter who served us was extremely helpful. He told us all the specials, and came back quite frequently to check on us. The wait staff of the entire restaurant was so quick and helpful, I felt like I was in a Disney movie. If your water glass got less than half full, it was instantly filled, bread was replaced quickly (which it needed to be, because it was fresh baked and delicious!), and every item we ordered was brought out almost immediately. It was fantastic. And everyone was very polite.  For our appetizer, we shared a jumbo ship cocktail which was extraordinary. I ordered a lobster linguine, and my boyfriend ordered a new York strip with onion strings. My lobster linguine was good, but it wasn't as amazing as I hoped. My boyfriends steak on the others hand.. Was absolutely MOUTHWATERING! As soon as I tried a bite, it melted in my mouth and I had to check if it was unicorn because it was so magical.  I tried a few bites with onion strings and the pairing of the salty bite with the perfect savory steak was just amazing.  For dessert we shared the house cheesecake, which had a hint of citrus and a sweet, almost white chocolate topping, also amazing and perfect. My boyfriend had a glass of Knob Creek and I had a small Baileys Irish Creme. Perfect ending to a perfect meal. The decor of the restaurant was styled like an old fashion burlesque hall, with red printed wall paper and dim lighting, and lots of framed black and white photos of silent film stars and burlesque dancers. The beautiful restroom had rose wall paper on top and tiled red bejeweled brick on the bottom, the entire place is gorgeous.

OTOvRNgY4EnODlNDyjDW4g.text: My wife and I went to The Strip House for dinner on New Year's Eve. So my thoughts were that on a night as crazy as NYE and in a hotel that is about a minute away from being another Harrah's property, we are probably not going to have the best meal ever. Man was i wrong...   1st, the service was fantastic...happy wait staff who talked you up while they were working, were attentive at all times, and made accommodations on a very busy night. For example, I brought a really nice bottle of wine with me, and the waiter thought that maybe I would not be allowed to do that (I had called ahead, and they had a "buy bottle/waive corkage" policy). he confirmed with the manager, everything was cool, and he even shared a drink with us.   2nd, the food!! This is truly a steakhouse...you ask for your meat cooked a certain way, it gets cooked that way. Perfectly seasoned, great portions, and the sides are fantastic. Signature creamed spinach, Potatoes Roskoff...you are not leaving that place hungry, and if you have not eaten something that made you say NOTHING but only smile to yourself....than you should give this place a chance.   3rd, the drinks...we had to wait a couple minutes at the bar because we were early, so we grabbed a drink. This place had a couple of really sharp guys behind the bar; knowledgeable, friendly, no one waited for drinks and they realized that if you are paying $12 for a drink, you should be getting $12 worth of liquor.   Finally, the atmosphere. I have only been to a couple of places where the decor and atmosphere is...in my opinion...perfect. Strip House is such a place. It is loud enough to make you feel like you picked the right place, but not so deafening you can't hear your companions. Dark velvet wallpaper covered with pictures of '30's burlesque strippers lit from behind. High-back booths you can sink into and watch people go by.   If none of that is motivation to go, here are five final words that may do it: Twenty-One Layer Chocolate Cake.   Happy new year!!

2b8-iBN70W9UkGh9_yYHBg.text: Absolutely fantastic!!  Fabulous food and outstanding service.  Will definitely be back.

pjyupCb562JguSe04H0m9w.text: A group of friends and I stayed at Planet Hollywood Westgate for NYE's weekend and we chose The Strip House cause 1) it was conveniently located on the premises 2) reviews were excellent here on Yelp. (Thanks Yelpers) & 3) we wanted to have an excellent last dinner of the year. They accommodated our group of 10 nicely. We had an awesome waiter, Andrew. He was helpful with what was on the menu and I almsot believed that he was the one who created the menu. He memorized that menu down to a T with all of the night's specials. We started off with two of the Seafood Plateau appetizer. This is based on market price so it's worth it if you're a seafood lover and all of us were. Everything was fresh and good. I got the 10 oz. filet mignon, medium well with a butterfly cut. The sides are table shared sides (if you want to, that is). The side I got to share with the table was the Black Truffle Cream Spinach. Both dishes were delicious! I pretty much cleaned up the plate. It was worth every penny spent. Oh and I can't leave out that the table got a slice of the restaurant's infamous 24-layer cake. It was super rich in chocolate and milk would have helped out a lot. Ten people and we couldn't finish that single slice.  The place is a bit on the high end but that's what you get with a steakhouse. Let's just say our ten person bill was 2 bills short of a grand.    Overall, I give this place 5 stars for service, food, and atmosphere and of course the great friends that made it even better.

4UyO6DzyPKCJ-zUOMvksOQ.text: Great meal!!!! Started with the seafood plateau and finished with the filet. They nailed it!

QScXGyMEjfuJCB-Izxqshw.text: The strip house was excellent. The atmosphere is just what I like in a good steak house, darker, old time decor. The service was excellent and the waiter was too notch and wasn't overly present during dinner, just the perfect amount of attention. The house special potatoes and creed spinach were delicious. My bone in rib eye cooked perfectly. All in all a great experience and dinner.

QCJKNsIfH_e1liGnb6tuhA.text: Went here recently and had a poor experience. Our steak took almost an hour and a half to come out. I asked the waiter if the kitchen was down or if there was something going on. He responded no. The problem is there was hardly anyone there so they were not busy at all. When the steaks arrived they were overcooked not at all medium rare. The manager I believe named Chris said just because the outside was blackened it was medium rare, no idea what the outside has to do with the inside of a steak? Either way there was no excuse from the manager why it took 1.5 hours to overcook a steak. My wife and I left to eat elsewhere. Sent a note to the GM there and no response. Gave them a chance to not post a neative review but since no response, here we are. Vegas is about fun and service, Strip House is neither.

VnC9pPxYyVyGpTWB1OYYiw.text: Ate here for a bachelor party.  NY Strip cooked medium- rare had great flavor but was a little tough (not overly so, but more than some other prime strips I've had).  The mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, and macaroni and cheese were all very good. Great environment, suitable for a bunch of guys or a date with your wife.  Not stuffy like Prime at the Bellagio, but not as laid-back as Stripsteak in Mandalay Bay.

MvTgz98gjTSOk-TVBNZU7Q.text: Excellent steak - had the ribeye, which was cooked medium rare.  It had some pepper on it, which wasn't advertised but was tasty.  Also got to try some of the porterhouse.  Not too shabby at all.  We shared the tuna tartare to start - which actually had a kick to it.  A very good iteration of this dish.  Also shared a garden salad, that came with a parmesan crisp.  Sides were the asparagus, green beans and garlic fries.  The french fries were crispy and we ate them all.  They even made mint tea for us with fresh mint, although it wasn't on the menu.  Great service throughout the meal.  The steak was better than any I've had at a steakhouse in San Francisco, although not Peter Luger quality.  Highly recommended.

hnpolkShQN8ChRBkqxaOyQ.text: Dissapointing experience compared to Strip House in NYC.  We went to the restaurant August 29th 2014. When we arrived, we were showed to our table by a hostess and our waiter then came by the table and handed us our menus and left again. We had booked the restaurant 3 months in advance to our stay in Vegas and had already decided what to get: the Porterhouse for 2 :)   Anyway - we ordered the lobster bisque for starter and the porterhouse as main and decided to order our desserts (the chocolate cake) when we were done with our first 2 courses.  My husband doesn't drink alcohol, so he just had water, but I ordered a blueberry cosmo to begin with and as Im not very educated in wines, I asked our waiter if he could suggest something to compliment the main course. His answer was: "I'll find something" and then he left our table.   5 minutes later he placed the cosmo on our table saying nothing and left again. 10 minutes later our lobster soup came out and it tasted wonderful. Our waiter didn't come by the table and asked if we needed anything, but oh well ... perhaps he was busy somewhere else. After finishing the lobster and the complementary bread etc, the dishes were taken off our table and the table wasn't cleared for next course. Lots of bread crumbs all over the place, but apparently its different from NYC in relation to preparing the table for next dish.  A bit later another waiter came with my red wine and placed it in the opposite corner compared to where we were sitting, so my husband had to reach out and get it for me. Guess its the easy way, when you don't know, who the wine is for. Again it was placed on the table without a word. Noone saying: "Enjoy" or "here you go" or anything.   10 minutes later our main was ready and the Porterhouse was cut by our table by yet again another waiter. He cut the 2 sides of the bones and cut it out and placed all the meat on our plates. The sides came at the same time and we got started. A few minutes later our "head waiter" (don't know what else to call him, as we had so many different people on our table) came to serve the table next to us and I asked for his attention and asked about the wine, I was drinking. I had no idea what it was, didnt like it in particular, but guess thats because he hadn't asked be about what type of wines, I normally like. But he was a bit annoyed about my question and quickly just said that he thought it was a good wine for the Porterhouse and then he left again. No explanation at all and I was left irritated. Still to this date, I have no idea what wine I was drinking. Furthermore he had forgot a side dish, we had ordered and they had to bring it to our table 5 minutes into the main.  The food itself was good. The waiter who had cut the Porterhouse, hadn't done a very good job, as my husband had to cut approx. 125-150g of meat off the bone afterwards.   After we had completed our mains, we decided not to go for dessert. Had been looking forward for 2 years since our visit in NYC to the chocolate cake, but we were sitting feeling let down over the whole dining experience that we just wanted to get out of the restaurant. My husband who doesn't drink alcohol, had four times been sitting with his water glass empty too, asking if he could have some more. Thats just unacceptable.   We might only have been a party of two and the tips might not be as good as if we were 6 people dining and we might be in Vegas and I know this particular restaurant isn't living of regular customers, but holiday guests - but that shouldn't be an excuse of delivering a really really bad service. I would also understand the completely lack of focus, if the restaurant was full and the waiters were busy - just wasn't the case.  I gave our dining experience in NYC 5 stars 2 years ago. This time around its 2 stars. The starter and main dishes were fine, but the service pulled down the whole experience and I will never spend that much money dining on Strip House in Vegas again, but go somewhere else in the future.

lQfXBBHPFbzFX9BrFVfHHQ.text: The food here sucks.  The service is OK, drinks are fine but for the price, it's terrible.  Granted I can't stand Vegas to begin with but when you fork over $250 for a shitty steak, some canned veggies and a few cocktails, you know you've been duped.  Anyone that say this place has the best steak or any derivation thereof is insane, delusional or both.  The food here is barely edible, they have some nerve charging what they do.

iWkad7jKP0Bd_dcjLY01IQ.text: TL;DR Expensive "upscale" restaurant that doesn't season their food, server staff are great, managers are useless, ask quickly to be moved away from drunks or you're gonna have a sexist/racist comment filled bad time.   Very unique atmosphere. Very dimly lit, "high-class"  dining.  Expect to pay a lot, entrees don't come with sides (adding a baked potato is $11).  Our conservative meal for two was $175 before tip.  A party beside us ordered drinks and decided to leave after looking at the menu prices.  Food was a 2/5 stars.  Steak was not seasoned enough, and goose fat fried potatoes were unimpressive. The "ribeye" I ordered (medium-rare) was very tuff and gristly, with no marbling, and truly seemed to be a bad NY Strip rather than a ribeye. Food took about an hour to be prepared, while there weren't that many customers in the restaurant (I believe they were trying to run the bill up by getting us to order more wine while we waited).  The service from the server staff was exceptional, hence the bump to my 3 star rating.  Servers had excellent knowledge of the menu, kept drink glasses full constantly, and removed literally every crumb from the table during the meal.  We also had a table beside us of 10 drunk New Yorker men, who cussed, screamed, made fun of women in Falsetto voices, and yelled racist comments throughout the entire dinner.  Drunks in Vegas are to be expected, but no server or manager ever asked them to keep it down or to refrain from the vulgar and racist/sexist language. (I'm sure the server was afraid of losing what should've been a $1,000-$2,000 tip from the drunks).   We wanted to love this restaurant, but unfortunately we won't be coming back.

gFIry42xR29-0Gfaosoc0A.text: AMAZING STEAKS!!! Service was not so bueno...two days before dining here, my wife and I dined at The Steak House at the Circus Circus like we always do when we visit Vegas- There, the service was exceptional, but the our steak had no flavor at all.   So, being that my wife wanted to go see Pitbul at Planet Hollywood, we decided to give this place a try. We didn't have reservations but they Sat us right away. I believe the managers name was Alex if I'm not mistaken very nice and professional man sad is that our table and told our waitress would be with us in a little bit. The restaurant was extremely packed from what I heard from one of the waiters was that almost everybody dining in there that night was going to the concert. About five minutes later we finally got our menus and met our waitress Tiffany.She either was overwhelmed very tired or just very moody that day. Again the WOW FACTOR was already ruined- but oh well- we were hungry and we were not going to go anywhere else to go dying so we had to suck it up.   My wife and I always order and share everything. We got our bread which was very good we ordered a salad we both had a beer each and ordered a ribeye steak 14 ounce medium well with a side of garlic french fries.   We actually got the steak faster than what we anticipated. The steak itself had a beautiful char to it and it was cooked perfectly. My wife and I both enjoyed our steak.  Our waitress Tiffany did check up on us quite a few times and towards the end she finally started smiling which kind of made a difference with our visit. Overall this place has amazing steaks I was very impressed I just wish the service was just as good as the steaks that's what we are noticing in Las Vegas in many restaurants now they either lack something their quality of food or the quality of customer service we spent five days in Las Vegas.   Out of all of the places that we went to go eat there was absolutely no WOW FACTOR in any of the places we dined at- it's sad that we travel so far to come to Vegas to enjoy ourselves and get pampered, but something always has to ruin it.   There are many steak houses in Las Vegas and in the surrounding areas that you can dine at.   I d rather have exceptional service and ok food than shitty service and great food. Service sets the tone immediately with you and how your total experience will be while dining.   I d give this place 5 stars,but the service ruined it-

BsLIgK3nBvMPJjKi9CCS5w.text: this place was beautifully decked out for Valentine's day. The balloons on the ceiling really made my night . Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The bread was semi hard and not that good, My filet mignon was amazing , my boyfriends steak was even more amazing .. we were disappointed with our chocolate cake dessert I've definitely had better. This place is dark romantic and secluded perfect for a first date.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OS7uDyj0kluhTJwMkqc9_A.text: Love this place, I've eaten here probably five or six times. I've had several different cuts of steak and the roasted chicken. All of the sides are very good and the service is excellent. If you're there for business traveling alone the bar is a great place to eat. They serve the full menu and their bartender is amazing. He remembers your drink and your name. It's not cheap, but what is in Vegas? Do you self a favor and stop in.

m1s2rHu8sH1ofUV4riyvog.text: If I could give them no stars I would, not because of food or ambiance. Purely because of the manager's poor customer service. We had the reservations for 11pm, we checked in at 11:05. Hostess said 15 mins grace period time so you're fine but let me grab my manager and as I type this review it 11:13pm. The manager came completely disregarded our reservations and said we are close..! Per their yelp page they are open for another 19 mins.  False effing advertisement. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! Rude management team ..! And way to turn off your clientele..   I understand they weren't busy so it was their easy way out, but this is such a terrible way to run a business.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their current yelp time !! FALSE ADVERTISING!!! Poor customer service!!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As I&#39;m typing in front of the manager.

xilefRdV05wAgznmy_G07Q.text: I recently traveled to Las Vegas last week. And I must say as many new steakhouses I have tried because there are quite a few I say Hands down the best place I have been to. Yes the steaks are AMAZING.  So tender and moist no pun intended. Fantastic. The flavor, the char. Perfection! Let me add the truffle spinach and lobster Mac n cheese a must have. So good! The drinks were great. The ambiance is so relaxing and elegant. Great decor and style. And what makes this all be so great is the Staff. Hats off to the staff.  Fabulous customer service. Very personable, great sense of humors. Everyone had a smile and made you feel so comfortable and enjoy your dinner that much more. Definitely a place to visit over and over again.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chateaubriand with black truffles creamed spinach, lobster Mac n cheese and sautéed wild mushrooms
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The serving of the Chateaubriand
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Alaska. The presentation is awesome

8eOIJEIwLh8WU-TRu8hz7w.text: Our experience here has always been amazing. We have been here every year on our wedding anniversary. Our drinks, the bread, the awesome hospitality is always on point. Plus, the food is soo delicious full of flavor and the bone in ribeye is to die for. I love seafood and the crab cakes are delicious they are buttery full of flavor. I can't wait to visit again. If your in Las Vegas you need to try this steakhouse.

TrBDgQs2Z0-39IlWKcgTSg.text: We came here for the chocolate cake, so that is all this review is about. My friend heard about their famous chocolate cake and after eating and drinking elsewhere, we came here for that cake for her. We were sat immediately. It's dark and there are old strip photos all over the walls. It's a fun vibe. Our waitress was nice and did not seem to mind we were there just for dessert. So the cake- it's called the 24 Layer Chocolate Cake. IT IS HUGE. It could feed 5 people dessert, so get ready. If you love chocolate though, you will love this cake. It is many layers (24 layers I assume, but I didn't count) of chocolate cake and chocolate mousse with a chocolate ganache. It was delicious. If you like chocolate, go check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This cake is HUGE!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate!

uixmGZzExjl_JCwNu87BzA.text: We didn't have any reservation here. My son wanted a burger and I thought we can go to Gordon Ramsay before the show. We didn't realize that Gordon Ramsay has a long line to get in since there's no reservation. I hate lines! So we end up here in Strip House Steak House. I'm glad they took us in considering that it was full and a lot of people dining were also going to JLo show afterwards just like us.   Although they couldn't offer us the regular table since it was full.  Few high tables are the only available tables left. The waitress was very prompt and service was quite fast. The food was good too! I had salmon and he had 14oz steak. It was tasty and savory. But let me tell you that the calamari appetizer was very little, only few pieces. Overall I like this place and if ever I find myself in this casino again I wouldn't mind going back to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HyuH3py4zU2kBRxUH1ze0w.text: We went here a couple of times since we were staying at Planet Hollywood.  Did not eat dinner, just appetizers and cocktails.  The bar was warm and welcoming, bartender Marc was really friendly.  Love the feeling of this place with the red furniture and vintage burlesque pictures.  Next time we will definitely make arrangements to have the full dinner experience

c55s_Z6w5FUYcr9Y4kQj6g.text: Once again, Open Table made reservations a breeze.  As I was seated the steak house mood was set with the dim lighting and dark/red colors of the room.  The staff was very accommodating and attentive throughout my meal.  I starte with Rye Chai cocktail which was tasty and set a good tone for the rest of the meal.  An assortment of breads started the meal with the pretzel bread standing out.  I starte with the lobster bisque which was rich and savory.  The main course was the aged prime rib done perfectly medium rare, tender and juicy with excellent flavor.  I accompanied the meat with charred broccoli and the velvety pureed mashed potatoes.  After a second Rye Chai (it was that good), I finished with a wonderful espresso creme brulee for the win.  Another excellent steak house in sin city?  This one makes my list of sinfully decadent places to take care of my meat cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso Creme Brullee
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged Prime Rib
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Purred Mashed Potatoes

6aL412SDlTgM3f47Lak6JA.text: It's Saturday night and oh no we can't get a reservation to any nearby steak houses! Everything is booked! Luckily and thank fully The Strip House helped our insecurity of not finding a nice steak restaurant to go and dine at. Being in Vegas you want to splurge yourself with a nice fancy dinner after penny pushing your budget at the buffet (nothing wrong with that but it's time for something nice).  So we walked our way to the second floor of Planet Hollywood and were greeted with friendly faces and made our way into this dazzling vintage house. I love when steak houses stick to the dim lights and seductive type of look. Treat yourself to an awesome steak! I ordered the Surf and Turf (Lobster tail & Filet Mignon) and oh my gosh as soon as I put it in my mouth it melted! (That's what she said...) Steak talk here, the chef's really put their talent to the maximum because it was made beautifully where I ate it slowly to savor every bite. It had a salt and pepper cover that was very tasty. Lobster was good too but the steak sold me! Mash potatoes are must, but everything is a la carte so you can choose what ever you please. There was no room for dessert even though the sugar menu looked good. So, next time we are in Vegas, we are definitely booking a reservation here again!

za6A4l9gzREf_h3EXJl3aQ.text: It's an okay steakhouse and part of the Landry's group  of restaurants. I've been wanting to dine here since I moved to Vegas and sadly I have to report: don't expect service or food to be out of this world. If this is the closest steakhouse to you it'll do the job. Steaks were on the higher end of prices -$50 for an 8oz filet and the menu online isn't up to date so expect more choices on the menu when you arrive for the non-beef eaters.   In regards to service it was terrible for the high price tag of this restaurant. You expect more with these fine dining restaurants. The server forgot to bring a soft drink and steak knives until we reminded him of the missing items. There were only 3 other tables in the restaurant so not sure what the excuse was. I was certain he went home for the night because we asked the server assistant for everything and even they took awhile to bring the items.   The food was pretty average. Like i said it's part of a corporate chain. The filet mignon wasn't ground breaking and the side of potatoes au gratin was just mashed red potatoes with melted cheese on top. To make matters worse the mashed potatoes were dry and stiff. The chicken entree was pretty good and a good sized portion to be honest.   I wouldn't go back considering there are three better steakhouses within walking distance of this hotel- Mastros at Crystals,  STK at Cosmopolitan, and Prime at Bellagio- all better and comparable in price.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porcini crusted chicken entree with brussel sprouts

S_n9GLLvDwQUs5sWLYQZaA.text: Had a dinner with friends another night and we had a great time. My friend and I shared the 24 Chateaubriand cut beautiful seasoning cooked perfect, for a sauce we chose which I don't remember the name but remind hollandaise it was delicious, four sides we had a salted mushrooms mac and cheese..... Nice environment I loved the dark red kinda... Definitely go back very good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry, don&#39;t have the picture of the beautiful steak just the bag LOL

h28AMNlnfJfHTn-sJbzrbQ.text: This is not wagyu beef! We ordered an expensive Wagyu steak, and it was absolutely not what they promised. We were told that "you can cut it with a butter knife" and that it was A5 official wagyu. I have had legitimate A5 wagyu, and this was far from that. I am very disappointed and would never recommend this to anyone.  The rest of our group said the steaks were fine, but nothing to be excited about.

jGJTTUsb-JFEO9LhrTSyyQ.text: We went to the Strip House for New Year's Eve dinner and had a lovely table for 8 inside the wine room.   We were about 20-25 min pushed past our reservation time.  Drinks took literally 20 min to come and then two small baskets of bread for 8 people. When the food finally came it was warm and not sizzling like a $65 steak should be.   The food runners had to ask each person what they ordered and one lady even asked how my friend ordered his steak temp.   I've been to this restaurant before and had a great experience, but this time was satisfactory.   The food was delicious and the mashed potatoes are bomb, but for that kind of money I expect speedy service and attention to detail.   The part that really got on my nerves was when we asked the waiter to separate the bill 2 ways so we could do separate room charges. He got all butt hurt and shrugged his shoulders. Unprofessional.   I will try another steak house on my next trip to Vegas.

RZ9vOSEvljc_V76xOYK0gg.text: Steak that literally melts in your mouth. Great pepper crust & amazing finishing butter. Steaks were cooked perfectly. Got the filet & ribeye. Yummy! Oh - and get the whipped potatoes. So creamy and delish! And ok - they have a 24 layer chocolate cake. Seriously. That's just crazy people.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 layer cake!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charming ambience
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

4vzMQVKsjn0E9b3TtdGjUw.text: Had a great meal here and it's consistent with New York. The Caesar salad is fantastic. As a main I ordered the Crisp Organic Chicken which consisted of porcini rub, market vegetables, and truffle jus. I loved it accompanied by the black truffle creamed spinach as a side.

cTqZqHzfwq0XAn92vFyNKw.text: We've been to Striph House twice and have LOVED the food both times. The first time we went on a spur of the moment. We were going to see a show and needed a place to eat. After walking around a while we were getting ready to settle for something pretty basic and then decided to search on our phones. Luckily we found this place. We were seated pretty fast and decided to try the filet and split a couple of sides: mac and cheese and strip house potatoes. The food was amazing. So good that a few weeks later when we were in town with friends we went again. Sometimes you remember food being much better than it was so I wasn't sure if the Stip House would live up to all the bragging we had done but once again everyone loved the food. We had another steakhouse the previous night and while it was great, Strip House was the clear winner.

UgJQp9XWFcmoXmIqpHB9YQ.text: Awesome place. Not the cheapest steakhouse but they are baller steaks. This place is a True high end steakhouse through and through. They do a great job at all of the items on the menu.  We enjoyed our visit here greatly. Absolutely love it.

JxxFyDNPj6ljkK8UYmXQJw.text: Awesome Staff!!! Great water best cake!!!!!!bartenders were so nice especially Sean and Mark with a C!!!!

9mfZqXEa2UlV2Q15GgVwFw.text: Spent Valentines here with my hubby and our bff's  who are also married! We got there around 11:00pm and that was excellent because it permitted us to watch a movie first! The food was phenomenal! We had fresh oysters, the prime age rib-eye, filet mignons, shredded twiced baked potatoes, whipped potatoes, calamari, GEESH, and creamed spinach.. I am a bit ashamed because i didn't know we ate so much. Oh geez and not to go without mention they have a fabulous full bar we indulged our selves in  Coronas, Cognac/ Hen-dog, and Adios Mutha F*#kas!! All tasty and got the body warming. The food was cooked to perfection and the atmosphere was great.   Our server was Sarah and she was great ! The manager was rude about us being there late, but ill take that up w her boss on Monday!   $430 tab plus tip close to $500 for the dinner... id say it was worth the flavors and experience!!

Sln01GRB0xZpONre3dRdMg.text: We had reservations here which were made on Opentable. We checked in a few minutes early and were seated right away.   Service was a bit slow and at time inattentive but overall was ok. The drink and wine choices were great. The food was good. Baked potato was great the filet was ok. Pretzel bread was pretty awesome.   If you like a dark atmosphere this is the place for u.

dNcszYfJm7QkRGjmVJ89Sw.text: Excellent, excellent, excellent is all I can say.  Amazing service!  Our waiter made recommendations and shared the chef's specials for the evening.  We were having trouble deciding between two bottles of wine and the waiter made the perfect recommendation.  The food was fabulous!  I loved the crispness of the outside of the steak while remaining juicy and tender inside.  I was full and couldn't try the baked Alaska but definitely dessert next time..... and there will be a next time.

jX7jBGfIyxVpmO3G9SSLiA.text: After my last visit and prior negative review the manager called me repeatedly to apologize and to make things right. He was so nice and so apologetic and tried very hard to do the right thing. I love the venue and the menu and the crowd so don't let my review deter you (I'm sure it hasn't as there are so many other great reviews!) and try the joint and have a great dining experience. I'll go back and give them another chance when I'm next in Vegas and when I do and it's awesome I'll let you know.

39Rx_zf33I5pe8wJyZnVsg.text: Fabulous atmosphere. Delicious drinks. Amazing food. Fantastic service. This wasn't second time here, and it was as great as my first! I brought my son for his 21st birthday, and he LOVED it!! Scott made the entire experience memorable with his shining personality and his on point service!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AcBb5DOMl6ouEjTBFYV9rw.text: I wish I could give Strip House Steak House 6 stars! Located in the Planet Hollywood Hotel on the second level this restaurant has a dark/trendy atmosphere. Price range $$-$$$. I went with a group of 5 people and we shared various appetizers and each had filet steak for our main meal. Appetizers/Entrees shared: - Spicy Tuna Tartar -Calamari -Oysters -French Fries -Caesar Salad   -Asparagus -Broccoli -Lobster Pasta -12 oz. Filet Mignon  Food was absolutely amazing, service was superb, experience was memorable.

3Jk8ZCHKLGAjnvLG8O23jw.text: Was out on the Strip and dying solo. Wasn't too hungry until I walked by this place. Beautiful room. Clubby, with lots of reds. The word "plush" comes to mind. (The artwork didn't hurt). Being solo I decided to eat at the bar. Mark, behind the stick, was great. Wasn't sure what I wanted to drink (yes, I'm one of those people) but told him I tend toward the boozier classics. Made me a barrel aged Old Fashioned. Perfect. Figured being in a Steakhouse I should have a steak. Didn't think I could finish one if I had an app, so I just let Mark pick one out for me (he did well with the cocktail). After a few questions about what I look for, how I like my steaks (tender and MR) he sold me on the bone-in filet. I'm not much for vegetables but when he mentioned truffles with the creamed spinach, who was I to say no? Steak was tender, flavorful, and cooked perfectly. The spinach was like a savory dessert, which was good, because I saw some behemoth of a piece of chocolate cake go by, and knew my belt line couldn't handle that. Great food, and a beautiful room, but Mark is who/what will bring me back.

rPykrcpr3_5TSU_Uksf8sA.text: Best dinner I've had to-date. My fiance and I stopped here on a whim, clearly underdressed but that didn't matter, service was still on point. We shared a 38 oz porterhouse, loaded baked and broccoli. Appetizer was calamari. Everything was exceptional. Steak literally melted in our mouths like butter. Only downside was being in a food coma in Vegas and in bed by 11 pm. Oh well, it was worth it.

JphAlDfGtwK6prrca0q0Sw.text: Of course the food is wonderful! You get what you pay for. The SERVICE, is what I'm talking about. My glass could never get close to low. The bread basket, same thing. You want a really great dinner, this is the place. Potatoes romanof,  filet and lobster, roasted garlic bulb, awesome across the board. I don't even eat steak sauce, the waiter put it on the table. If I could buy this I would use steak sauce, you must try. This place needs 6 stars. Great SERVICE! Almost fogot to give my waiter, Scott, credit for the excellent service, that made me want to write this review in the first place.

KH2_Pctp9ZZVJ8uXehJb-A.text: Really great food but incredibly slow service. Two hours to serve dinner for 5 is extreme. Beautiful presentation and tasty flavor profiles but the wait to get our food and check was not worth the $$$$

A7cwqdI3D4cxBVPandjomg.text: Bearnaise sauce is out of this world. The mashed potatoes and cosmopolitans were amazing as well. I would come back to this restaurant in the future. The service was fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had a fillet medium rare and it was almost completely rare but still had great flavor.

OYnh4TENMzen5fyNC8A7SA.text: Got a ribeye here, wife got a lobster pasta... both were really good, but man was that steak good.  I mean REALLY good.  Salt and pepper only for seasoning, cooked to perfection, but they didn't use a "spicy" black pepper, it was more savory.  Super good.  They also had a twice baked potato equivalent that had green chilies in it and it was EXCELLENT.  Potatoes were whipped well, well spiced, spicy but not burning stupid hot.  Wonderful overall ambiance and had excellent service from start to finish.  Waiters were attentive and really explained their steak process and the seasoning.  Would return in an instant!

aD-jmwj_oNWROUnstN3xjg.text: I'm the type that I says "anyone can make a great steak" but the 4 of us loved what we got.  Surf and turf.  Appetizers.  All good.  Place was great with a cool atmosphere!

ZDmb5gaSfNkNOyTm6c0eMg.text: 14 Oz. dry aged ribeye cooked to medium. A burnt tasting seasoning I had to scrape off since it was too salty for my taste. Our server Cat was attentive and agreed that the in-house steak sauce tasted like filipino banana catsup, the sauce was trippin' me out since it was sweet, but I was addicted to it. I've had been to steakhouses here in the Bay Area and I compare all steaks to what I had at Alexander's steakhouse in the South Bay. I give the steak a 3 stars, but the service boosts it an extra 1 star.

uaSqLech9-QR3_rHe8EJrQ.text: Great experience and one of the best steaks I've ever had. My wife and I ordered a couple of glasses of wine and calamari for an app. Bread was also served before the meal. She ordered the salmon and I got the 8 oz. filet along with the potatoes Romanoff. Her salmon was cooked perfectly, the potatoes were creamy and flavorful and my steak was seasoned really well. I'd say my only complaint (and it's very minor) was how my steak was cooked. I asked for medium rare and got medium. Regardless, it was delicious and tender.   The service was top-notch. Our server was attentive without being annoying. If I had any room, I would've loved to try dessert, but we will be back for more another time!

zDC51SuLej38Vi-iNlUOfQ.text: We made a last minute decision to dine here based on a recommendation from a friend...glad we did! First impressions: the atmosphere was decent enough with nothing standing out as being over the top nice but concurrently nothing that was offensive. The place wasn't very crowded, which initially made me worry re: whether we made the right choice to dine here. My concerns were immediately laid to rest when the food arrived. The starters were delicious as were the cocktails. The steaks were perfectly charred and full of flavor. Our server, Ricky, was extremely attentive but never intrusive. He was knowledgable about his menu and was able to make great recommendations based on our preferences. He was superb. I highly recommend this place!

-YTmKYUIXTWdCr-Am8r0fA.text: Just very simply put, the steaks are amazing.  Do Not even mess around with one being cooked more then medium, you are just punishing yourself.  The sides are good sized, so share them.  But don't miss this opportunity to enjoy a steak you will never forget.

CPEv-X7Z1ltKel9hNmr59w.text: Great service and delicious food.. the tastiest cuisines...pricey, but full filling.   The portions were not huge but surprisingly it filled us up.  Food that will fill you up and leave you satisfied.  Again the warm friendly service added to the food I believe .

81di0B9SlwTZO58c-7x5Og.text: We visited this restaurant for the second time and it definitely didn't disappoint. The food and service is wonderful! I had the 8 oz filet mignon which was tender and juicy and my husband had the 16 oz NY strip which was equally as good. We ordered the mac and cheese and baked potato as our sides and both were big enough to split. We have eaten at many steakhouses on the strip and this is definitely our favorite. Well worth the prices!

cs6EufkTNm6v7R3t5Val-g.text: Ate here this past weekend for mine and my best friend's birthday.  We ended up here for a couple reasons.  First, it was pretty much the only restaurant with good yelp reviews that was able to take a late reservation for 8 people at dinner time.  Second, we were staying at PH towers and Strip house is in PH.    It wasn't super busy, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the food.  The steaks were REALLY good.  I ordered Lobster Linguine, which was good, but I should've just gone for a steak since this is a steak house.  Almost everyone else got steaks and everyone was very happy with their meals.  We also shared 4 sides - mac n cheese, potato romanoff, creamed corn, and fries.  They were all decent although not mind blowing.   With everyone getting an entree, 4 sides and 2 bottles of wine, our bill came out to $80/person.  It was expensive, but I can definitely say that we were all happy with the experience and would come back here again.  And I repeat....GET THE STEAK!

cmVuxX2bcuuV8-HUh4eI3Q.text: It's what you expect of a steak house in Vegas.  Food was expensive, but great quality.  Service was good, but not quite the best.  I went with a group of coworkers.  We spent about $150 each.  I had steak, wedge salad, 2 bourbons, and we shared several sides.  The special mashed potatoes with bacon, sour cream and some sort of spicy peppers were excellent.  By far the best part of an overall good meal.  I didn't like the Caesar salad that my coworker ordered.  Overall, good meal.

FfWH6aAMU01SBgtbp2vJmg.text: Our family came here in the late evening for dinner after our early afternoon wedding.  We have a 13 year old child who is severely allergic to milk, eggs and beef. He is very rarely allowed to eat anything from any restaurant, as every utensil must be thoroughly cleaned, hands cleaned prior to cooking his food, after touching other foods, and distance kept between items is also a must, or something horrible could happen. We asked to speak to the chef, and he promptly came out to discuss our concerns. He was very thorough, asked what he was allergic to, and helped us choose the perfect dish for our son. He assured us that he takes food allergies very seriously, and even had a separate area to prepare his food. He was able to safely eat the squash, with a huge main dish of chicken. We ordered the steak and lobster, asparagus, and potatoes....Let me tell you, the food was out of this world fantastic! The potatoes had the most amazing flavor,  the lobster was superb, and I have never had more fresh, wonderful tasting asparagus in my life! The steak was also fabulous! By far our favorite was the potatoes.  The fact that our son could be included in enjoying a delicious meal with our family made everything perfect for all of us. If you go late at night,  put blindfolds on your kids when you walk through the casino if you're worried about risque attire, or perhaps go in the afternoon (we learned the hard way lol.)  This is definitely a restaurant worth the price, and we will be going there first if we go back to Las Vegas. If you read these, thank you chef! Compliments from our family to you!

TqTjhM8xN-wH3UGa1u133g.text: I ate here two weekends ago when we were in town and staying at the Planet Hollywood Westgate Towers.  When we stopped by earlier in the afternoon to make dinner reservations, the earliest they can seat us was at 9:30 for a Saturday night.  No problem since we had to squeeze in an afternoon power nap from the day drinking and site seeing we did earlier in the day.  We got there and it still took a while for our table to be ready for our party of six.  When we sat down, service was a little on the slow side, but that was to accommodate our sixth person who was leaving her car with valet.  We started off with lobster bisque which my boyfriend and I shared, it was nice they split it up for us (versus being cheesy and sharing it in one bowl, lol).  I got the surf & turf dish that came with a petite filet mignon and lobster tail.  He got the rib eye which was enormous!  The side dishes we all shared were all good except the mac & cheese was a little too rich for me, but it was a hit with the others.  Overall, the service was good, the dinner was great, but the company I was with alone deserves five stars.  We walked over to the bar after dinner to continue with our night of drinking and little did I know that comedian, Wayne Brady was lounging right behind us.  Heyyyyyy....

oDpgtj1p8-Gp7k-LzDIV6A.text: Anytime I'm in Vegas I make a stop to the strip house. The ambiance and decor is sexy and mysterious. Red velvet line the walls along with pictures of beautiful pin up girls from days of old. It's lightly lit to almost a candle light setting. A great place to to dine with your partner. The food is amazing. I was greeted with a smokey potato soup shooter compliments of the chef ( very classy ). I had the massive 22oz rib eye steak which was cooked perfectly and tasted divine.
