Creamy whipped potato and creamed spinach accompanied my steak. If your looking for a romantic steak house to take your date the strip house is the spot to go

-uYzHN35MlVFlkkeAoUIWQ.text: Oh my gosh, I Love their Filet/Lobster! Tender, hot & seasoned perfectly. I actually came back the next night and ordered the exact same thing. I'll come here again!

yEfe_YAeJKs9JRvzSZifOg.text: I LOVE this restaurant.  My company stays at this hotel twice a year, and the Strip House is one of our favorite spots.  Very quiet inside, dark, relaxing, great service, excellent food.  I get the Filet Mignon and also pastas and fish, and everything is awesome.  Even the side dishes (mushrooms, creamed spinach) are phenomenal.  VERY pricey (like $40 for steak with no side dishes) but I get reimbursed so it's OK.  The decor is slightly risque but classy enough to bring a date.

w7H2zooV2w7K1_J386i-BQ.text: Chris Rosen is the bestest best server. His pairings are on point and service is unpretentious and spectacular. Ask for him. Every table in this restaurant is full and for a good reason. Do your taste buds a favor.

sKCgCgp6haC-vTnq6TGxBQ.text: I read about the 24 layer cake on other people's reviews and I figured, hey, I'm in Vegas and it also happens to be my birthday, so why not. Luckily, the restaurant did take out, so I was able to just get my cake and take it back to our room, since we were also staying at PH. The cake cost $16 for a slice, but I swear it could feed a 3rd world country. My boyfriend and I both dove into the 24 layers, only to be taken down by the massive slice. Sadly, we only finished about half of it. I had plans on eating some for breakfast the next morning, but we had to check out at 4:30 a.m. to catch our flight and since I was so half asleep, I left the cake on the table.   We will definitely have to try conquering the cake next time we are in Vegas (and based on the reviews, I would like to try a whole meal here too)!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was so big, I just had to take a picture!

H6QSm3rAVs-QIt-rbULtmg.text: We only came in for the Gorgonzola fondue with garlic bread, and we were so pleased.  Not only was the cheese amazing, but so was the bread. I literally don't think I'll ever go to Vegas again without hitting this spot. The only thing I'd do differently is to order two!

K-vIKy9iZM5Fiq7NZl_mOA.text: One of the best tasting filets I've had. If you like yours with a seared, slightly charred exterior and a tender center, give Strip House's filet a try. I thought the meal was very reasonable considering it's quality too. The shrimp cocktail was quite yummy also.

ZqgVtAhs9rEech83s5ixwQ.text: Had dinner here on a last minute reservation because Stripsteak was booked. I only like to eat steak at somewhat nicer places. Not a snob but just am a little particular about steak. I was staying at Planet Hollywood so figured I would try it.  Was a pretty good meal service was excellent food was great the menu was nicely laid out with a good selection of cuts of meat and accompaniments. no real complaints just thought for eating a good steak but maybe 3 times a year it hasn't made my top five, but really close.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a booth...
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. front entryway
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. front sign

_Yqy92IJ7VABBT7XFt_kww.text: A very enjoyable meal and wonderful service. A kind staff that was attentive and respectful. Ordered the filet that was cooked just as ordered (medium well) and the lobster tail was excellent as well. The brocolli was made as I like it and even the drinks were great. I recommend going. It's as good as any other steak place on the strip in Vegas.

ndYZHuT2IIl5tHha6qaMHg.text: It was our first night in town and wanted to a good steak. We were directed here by the concierge. We asked for a good steak place where you didn't have to dress up. When we got there, we found that we may have been underdressed. After a double look from the hostess, we were seated in the back.  It was about 7 PM on Friday night and the place was near empty (should have been a warning sign).  Drinks - The waiter was a bit slow to come over but when he did we ordered cocktails. Drinks were watered down.  When I asked for regular water it tasted like it came from the bottom of the ice machine. I had to buy bottled water. I later tasted local water and it was fine. Another instance where they played the customer.   Staff - The waiter was not unpleasant, just not pleasant. Other waiters there seemed to have better personalities.  Food - I ordered my steak medium rare but it came out medium. I would have sent it back but everyone else at the table had their food and were eating. I find that unless it is uneditable it makes no sense to send back as everyone would be finished eating by the time you get your food again. One of the other guys in our party ordered the "surf and turf" and said it was perfect, another had rib eye and said it was average. Everything is al a carte, even the sauces. We had the creamed spinach with bacon and it was probably my favorite for the night.  Everything in the place is an upsell and pricy.  I don't mind paying for good food and service, but this place left me regretting the money I had to put out.

DLA7HoKyqtcSADJYhUPMPA.text: One of the best parts of Vegas has to be the amazing variety of top notch restaurants you can choose from.  I am always trying to find the best ribeye steak in town.  I have to say, this was in the top 3!    Oh, and you have to try to the mac'n'cheese.  And don't let your server try and convince you that you don't need your own side of this!  I would have given them a better star rating but the service didn't match the quality of the food.

XXIVpX2SbGjBCNyi_suGCg.text: Every dish was incredible. The Maine lobster linguine, the rib eye, the sides (potato puree and broccolini). The service was very good. The staff was friendly. The ambiance is nice, but the arrangements of some of the photographs can look a bit dated. The drink selection was great. Overall, we had a fabulous time and highly recommend this place!

48PG2dktb-yLsB4fZ5YKwA.text: Food and service were excellent. Would highly recommend the scallops as a starter! Hands down best tasting food we had during our stay in Las Vegas.

VVcwC5IG-xztTakAUDfejg.text: Outside of the lobster bisque, the food was outstanding! The surf and turf with the filet and lobster were divine. The macaroni and cheese and goose fat potatoes melted in my mouth. OMG!!! Too full for dessert....

1l1Kpmx11Dfhu7z5kz-PQA.text: Went here for my husband's and my 60th birthday while vacationing in Vegas.  All staff was very friendly and our waiter, John, couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  He recommended a great wine and even brought us some wonderful cheese that brought out the wine's flavor.  The food was very good, however the steak was a little over seasoned for our taste.  It wasn't a big deal though because it was easy to remove some of it.  We were very surprised when we were gifted a huge slice of their decadent chocolate layer cake with two candles and Happy 60th Birthday written on the plate in chocolate.  I would totally recommend this restaurant!

9TzvZqTytB2Wmwf151w13Q.text: Visited the Strip House during a visit to LV last week (4/7/11). Came later in the evening (930ish) and restaurant was pretty empty. My friend and I felt a little under dressed, but did notice other seated parties dressed similarly. The restaurant itself is quite cozy...dark and sexy B/W photos on the walls, with some larger ones back lit with red light. The food was decent, but a medium-well fillet should have some pink and not be charred quite that much. All sides are Ala carte and as stated in other reviews, quite potatoe-centric. The service was the sticking point with me though. Sullen waiter who just repeated out the specials and then zoomed off, appetizers delivered (or tossed) on the table and no real customer service given. For the price of the bill ($200+), I would expect a little more respect for the patrons.

Ob3NW-ufn8OqJLRzd3hcPA.text: Strip House Steakhouse was everything I expected from a Vegas hotel steakhouse. I can only speak for what I had, since I ate there alone, but from the look of the other customers' faces, the entire menu is top notch. Starting with the bar, the drinks were expensive, as can be expected in Vegas, but well worth it and well made. I had a Sapphire and tonic and a glass of Bordeaux. Dinner itself was top notch. I was served an assortment of bread with butter to start. The mini- French loaf was great and the butter was soft enough to spread without any difficulty. As an appetizer, I had the lobster bisque. At first I found it a bit salty, but it somehow became more delicious with every spoonful. It had a nice thick consistency and had a good amount of lobster that seemed to almost melt on contact. For dinner, I had the 8oz filet done medium and asparagus. The steak was wonderful, slightly salty and crispy on the edges, soft, pink and full of flavor on the inside. It was served with a Bearnaise sauce, but there was a variety of other sauces available. The steak also came with a roasted tomato half and garlic off to the side. My only disappointment with the food came with the asparagus. For $8 I was expecting something a little more exciting. It was served with Hollandaise sauce on the side, but it was still just ok. It was carried by the steak rather than complimenting it. The waiter was a 10 out of 10. He balanced making sure I was ok with not annoying me perfectly and brought everything to the table quickly . My only other dislikes of this amazing place were the noise from the casino and a slightly wobbly table. I know, that is a minuscule thing, but that is what separates amazing from very good. I can't rate this place against other Vegas steakhouses because I haven't been to any others, but I would rate this in my top five ever, but probably #5.  And if it's any indication of other Vegas steakhouses, I am in heaven.

DAz5VDVsOSVkUxm5gV1iWA.text: Strip House was a great splurge for a girl's night out! They have an X-rated Martini that will knock your socks off! The NY strip was perfect with their Garlic-Herb fries and Black Truffle Creamed Spinach. Sorry to say there was no room for dessert, but I would imagine it would be fantastic!

ef0pFKaWGWWwg_ApvpxAIw.text: YUM! To our surprise there were actually some boutique Napa wineries on their wine list! The truffle creamed spinach with pork fat back was amazing! The steaks were cooked perfectly to order and the giant chocolate cake lasted us several days!

LxIW4qpvoOityUBwWt4ghg.text: The truffle creamed spinach was awesome!!  I got the tuna (I know, at a steak house) and it was ok.  Husband liked his steak but preferred Delmonico's for the same price.  Overall, the food was ok.

lpRVJ9n9uuJA8OCnhAkh8g.text: This place has to be the worst steak house in all of Las Vegas in terms of food quality.  The steak was tough with no marbling.  I ordered a salad and got these three massive strips of bacon with a couple of pieces of lettuce.  Some of the things sounded good but they just weren't.  Our meal was comped and to steal a line from my boss "it aint worth free"...and truly it wasn't.  In fairness, the vibe is good and the waiter was very nice.

2KOyLu-rrvyAIIh_3xEUEQ.text: My friends and I have been to most of the steak houses on the strip.  This one will be on our short list of places to return to again.  Service was excellent.  The pace of the meal was quite good.  Quality and preparation of the food was fine.  Only complaints - background music was a bit too loud, and the wine list is a bit pricey.  Otherwise no complaints.

824WBl9xvhdIEEMfUiaiQQ.text: I've been here 3 times: Twice for dinner and once just for drinks. I'd say they batted two for 3 in most ways. The one dining experience was Very good (4 stars) but the server was a "Professional Server" and was mainly concerned with up-selling to a point that was Very annoying (4 stars on the annoying scale). The food and drink was Very good(4 stars). The bill was Very large (4 Stars on he expensive scale).  The second time I ate there was with alarger group and we had a Pre Set menu. The shell fish paltters were awesome (5 Stars). The steaks were fantastic (5 stars). The service was suspect - not very attentive and their depth of knowledge was lacking. Drinks in the lounge on my 3rd visit was average. Overall, A-Ok - when you combine the 3 trips. I'm uncertain if I will return.

fmu05T1rsCu2punFt_z3wA.text: There has been a lot of buzz about this place.  We don't go to the strip and never come to planet hollywood, but gave it a shot. Not worth it.  Decor and pictures are pretty and hip.  The place does not look very big and not what we expected but still looks nice. We came on Friday. We started in the lounge as we were waiting for a table.  It took some time for someone to notice we were even there but then someone finally came over.  Drinks were okay but took forever as we watched the cocktail server finish her conversation with her coworkers before she delivered our drinks.  One of them looked like a manager who we felt like was just staring at us. Our server at our table was completely opposite.  He was more pleasant and confident, but also annoying.  He was friendly but tried to make a joke after every thing we said.  But at least he was nice. Food was good, steak was delicious but pricey. It felt like our food took a long time and the place was nowhere need full.  I liked the corn sidedish a lot. We had already planned on getting the dark chocolate cake slice, but they gave us it anyway if you tell them you live in Las Vegas.  There are many other better places to eat that cost less.  It was nothing terrible, but not what we were hoping.

U1XIqARH_33PbGkL9yS9ow.text: I dined at Strip House with a small group of friends on Saturday, December 18, 2010 hoping for a delicious steak dinner. No one in our group was impressed by our experience. I ordered the Porterhouse for two to share. It was cooked beautifully but lacked flavor and was therefore overpriced. My friend and I eat fine dining, particularly upscale steakhouses, quite often so we have some idea what steak should taste like. The lobster bisque was good but nothing to write home about. Our mashed potatoes and mac n cheese were unfairly small portions for our table and the mac n cheese was overwhelming with the truffle flavor. We were all disturbed by the harsh flavor. The mashed potatoes were bland. Sarah's salmon was cooked appropriately but the pesto fluff drowned out any real flavor. Even the bread was subpar. I would expect better from a restaurant in this price range. It was by far the most disappointed steakhouse experience the four of us had ever experience both individually and cumulatively and then to pay $400 was the ultimate slap in the face. I have no idea how this restaurant was rated so highly by other diners or culinary spectators because I think it was the biggest bogus culinery hipe of my life! Overpriced and not impressive! I would not recommend this restaurant to ANYONE! It actually put a damper on all of our moods the remainder of the night after having spent so much money and no dining satisfaction. The thought of that place now puts a bad taste in our mouths and turns our stomachs. And that is not even an exaggeration.

sZJspmw071F9MZ-jz-sZXQ.text: We were going to see the show Peep Show (With CoCo) and we didn't want to feel rushed, so we made a reservation at this restaurant.  The hostess was sweet and made our reservation for 8:30, so we had plenty of time to eat.  Its very dimly lit and its a little noisy, but its ok.  There are great pictures on the wall of stars and models from back in the day.  The staff is WELL TRAINED they know what utensils to give you and take away and they do it quickly!  The bread and butter they give you is amazing.  My friend and I ate all three. My friend had the scallops for the appetizer which were really tasty its a shame that they only give you 2-3 depending on the scallops size and I had raw oysters.  I was given 3 from the east coast and 3 from the west coast.  The East coast had more natural salt to them then the west coast, but they were delicious.  I had the Lobster Linguine which has been the best that I have had ever!  My Friend had roast chicken, but he isn't choose any sides, but at the end we shared the cheese cake which was a huge piece.  We had no choice, but to share it.  Its pricey, but if you don't mind paying a pretty penny this is a great place to do so.  They give you star treatment here.

ObFUoEyfMDBOH8T0RjV1MA.text: First off let me start by saying that I am huge fan of steak! I have eaten at a variety of steakhouses in Vegas that have not disappointed. We left to Vegas with extremely high expectations of having fun and also eating at this "highly" rated steakhouse. My wife and I ate here on our last night in Vegas expecting SOOO much. I ordered the bone in rib-eye and she had the fillet. We each had the same sides of goose fat potatoes and the spinach with bacon that was a special that evening. I have to say that neither of us were impressed with the steak. About the only thing I really liked was the spinach and even that was a bit over rated. The bone in rib-eye was good but nothing to slap yo mama for. The service was really good and very attentive. They were able to accommodate us although we called for reservations late due to an extreme hangover. The decor is great and the atmosphere is also fun, even on a Wednesday night. Definitely a fun and romantic setting all in one. I was not all that impressed with the food as you have already read and I would never go back to this place again. It wasn't horrible but there are plenty of other places in Vegas that have really pleased the palate. All of the above and 1 glass of wine came out to $172.48 minus the tip of course, not to bad. Recommendation: IF you go, share the sides, it's enough for two people.

WGGcr-zXkAYb1FkTADUfYg.text: The server messed up our order,steak was overcooked,sat a very large party right next to us even though the dining room was 2/3 empty.After finishing dinner the party was still arriving and literally surrounding our table we decided to take the rest of our wine to the bar(the whole time no sign of our server).Told the hostess we were stepping out for a smoke,came in 5 min later and two full glasses of wine r gone.Ask to talk to the manager, she sneakily shows up with 2 glasses saying they were just moved into the back.Clearly not the same glasses,no lipstick,and not the same wine(more like there house pour).Finally came out with a 1/2 bottle, 2 years greener,still no apology.Server finally shows with check,even charged 4 the espresso, YUCK

Eyhr8twuTR_qCU7weOToiw.text: The real draw of this place has to be the decor.  It has dark lighting with bold red walls (pay attention to the design in the wall paper, same pattern used on the napkins) with burlesque style, black and white photos all over the walls.  Same goes for the bathrooms.  Very cool looking. However, great decor doesn't make up for an overpriced, mediocre steak.  For the price I paid, this steak just doesn't measure up.  Don't get me wrong, the steak was good, it's just that I've had much better steaks for less. I ordered a 14 oz filet mignon and when I was done, my response was "ehh."  It lacked any real flavor and wasn't as tender as one would expect.  This was pretty much the response from my entire party (8 people). All of the sides that we ordered (spinach, green beans, asparagus, & creamed corn) were excellent, specifically the creamed corn.  One member of my party commented that it was the best creamed corn he had ever had and we all agreed. The service was good, but it was very slow.  It took a long time to bring out drinks and then the food after they were ordered, otherwise, they didn't miss a beat.  I think the entire wait staff has obsessive compulsive disorder to some extent.  Every time one of us would leave the table (restroom or smoke break), any server that was passing by would immediately pick up the missing persons napkin and re-fold it into a triangle and place it on the table.  This may not seem strange, but the frequency of it was almost comical.  I even left the table a couple of times, just to test them and each time, I came back to a folded napkin.  To sum it up, great decor, great sides, mediocre steak.  Will I be back?  Definitely NO.  For a few bucks less, I can go a bit farther down the LV Strip to Smith and Wollensky's and get the best damn steak ever made.  Nice try Strip House, but no dice.

Id8FQ6DGhojcoUoQQREgzw.text: food was excellent, great atmosphere, so-so service - not terrible - you just should get more from that type of place

OZVLs9e69jj1xJeY4IjrFg.text: expensive but actually not TOO expensive for Vegas. Plus if your in Vegas your usually on vacation ssoooooo why not. Ok the steak and all the appetizers were amazing and different Butttt the desert!!! There were I think four of us and we all wanted a little something sweet. Being on the verge of Explosion we all agreed on a little piece of cheese cake for all of us to share. ...let me finish by just saying the cheesecake was the size of my head literally.

pVOisWxOUNvvulJP7p6s9g.text: Excellent meal! Went to celebrate our anniversary and although it's pricey, it was soooo worth it! My husband had the NY strip steak. I really only like filet, but I tried his steak and it was heaven! Melt in your mouth. The crab cake appetizer was awesome too.   My filet was cooked to perfection and came with lobster. The truffle mac and cheese made the meal. We ordered the 24 layer chocolate cake for dessert and couldn't eat more than a bite...it's pretty rich.  Great meal and service, great ambience too. One of the best meals we have ever had!

GOpDLWr-FLVpGSdor7Unww.text: Happened to stumble upon this place because we wanted to eat and not be rushed before seeing Peepshow.  The decor was really cute (old photos of 30's-40's pinup girls) and the waiter offered to let us taste most of the wines offered by the bottle, just so we could choose easier.  For dinner we ordered filets and potatoes romanoff, the mushrooms, and a daily special of baked bacon creamed spinach.  Now, we had pretty high standards, as we have eaten at steakhouses in the wynn, endore, casars, etc.  and let me tell you this place blew them all away!  Every bite was heaven!  we were way too full for dessert, but it was worth it!  We now have a new favorite steak house in town!

UDpVtT2dqWE-OoR9RhQ6iw.text: OK so I don't eat red meat, BUT everyone in my party did, so I was fine with coming here to try.....and I was pleasantly surprised! the Decor was very cool, the service was very attentive but not annoying, and the food was great. Everyone loved there steaks BUT the highlight of the evening was the appetizer- the bacon salad thing- OK its NOT a salad- but its SO DELICIOUS! The best bacon I have EVER had- These GIANT slices of thick thick apple smoked bacon came out and they melted in my mouth- the flavor was amazing and i didn't want to order anything else it was that good! I did end up getting the salmon, which was great, but the bacon still lingered in my mind...in fact I'm tasting it right now....anyways if your a bacon lover you MUST have this!

EbCozQnYlIpoZsVouTgEmw.text: First, I'm upset that I even had to give them one star.   Myself, my husband and 5 other friends of ours went to Strip House for my birthday dinner this past weekend while staying at Planet Hollywood.  The hotel was awesome, loved it!  Strip house on the other hand?  Absolute disappointment!    Our reservation was made for 10pm for 7 people.  We arrived at 10 but had a few stragglers so had to wait to be seated until all members were present (which is already annoying especially since they took my credit card number to make the reservation).  We were seated probably around 10:15pm; ordered as soon as our completely incompetent server decided to oblige us with his presence and proceeded to wait another HOUR AND A HALF for our food while several tables who came in well after us enjoyed their meals.  After the hour and a half passed and our plans for the night were slowly but surely being single-handedly sabotaged by this restaurant  I got up and asked to speak with the restaurant manager.  I informed her that we were sat over an hour ago (closer to two at this point), that we still didn't have our food and that several tables who sat after us were already eating.  Her response was unimpressive, at best.  She offered no real apology instead just said she'd go check on our food.  After a few minutes our degenerate server came out with our food and this awesomely inconsiderate and rude comment; "I'm sorry you FELT like it took so long".  No, I'm sorry, but 2 hours is a long time in anyone's world to be waiting for food you're paying $400 for.    As far as the food; I can't honestly say it was worth the money I spent on it or the amount of my life I wasted waiting for it.  I will absolutely never go back to Strip House.  I wouldn't go back if they paid me.  The service and the food were unacceptable for the price you're paying for it; I've had better experiences at Denny's.   I recommend KOI (right next to Strip House) service and food were far beyond expectation!

rLlvKUlSUm0BIN669iCkmg.text: Been here to Strip House Steakhouse 4 times and it never ever disappoints! The Rib eye is as good as it gets and their sides ( mac and cheese, creamed spinach) are DELICIOUS

15Nz83BwoWCZ__PB3Z2Z_A.text: My boyfriend wanted to treat me to a nice steak and raved about Strip House in New York and said I would love it if Las Vegas location was same as New York. The waiter was awesome, but when we received our steak, it didn't taste the same. He asked for the steak to be split becasue it was a large cut. I am not a steak eater so I don't know when a cut is bad. His cut was great, but I kept chewing and chewing and eventually I gave him some of my cut to see. He noticed I was struggling, but assumed I was chewing slow. He spit his piece out and asked to speak to the Manager. He let the waiter know how he felt and was disappointed with my cut. They said it was from the same cut, but he disagreed. The Manager approaches and his response to our complaint was highly unprofessional. He comments were uncalled for when situation was explained. He said you ate it so nothing can be done about it even though he was told I wasn't a seasoned steak eater. He lied saying he came from new York location when my boyfriend mentioned names, he was clueless. He was very immature and childish and defensive. His hospitality skills were horrible, customer skills even worse and all he did was remove the side dishes ordered. We were not looking for a free meal, but something to be done to rectify serving a bad cut of steak which was a pretty penny. My boyfriend was outraged at the poor service the Manager gave portrays Strip House to be a place that doesn't care if a patron is satisfied or not. I cannot recommend this location due to his performance and will let the New York location know of our horrible experience in Las Vegas.

VV0mXd7CXcz40XNq3xNjQA.text: An excellent steak house.  I enjoyed a long evening here with a coworker and customer.  The steak was excellent and prepared exactly as I asked.  I had the 14oz New York Strip, wild mushrooms, garlic and herb fries and shared the 24 layer chocoate cake.  The service was beyond superb.  My only gripe was all the retro photos of strippers but it is Vegas.  As someone who considers myself a "foodie" and travels full time, I can recommend both the food and service here without reservation.

TUIld8dppDQ6HG86j2_NBQ.text: If you are in a hurry, this is the place to go. If you want to enjoy the 2-person $300 meal you are eating, this isn't the place to go.  Our main course came before we had even finished our before dinner drinks, and before that-our soup came before we had even ordered our wine.    I don't know about you, but when I am spending this much on food, I expect the waiters to know how to "time" the courses better.  I called the General Manager to let him know about this, and he didn't seem to care.  Hmmmm, seems par for the course.  Much better places to go in Vegas......spend your money elsewhere.

c2-9Y6GUkKTuoVaTKN8MTA.text: We were a little apprehensive going to this restaurant but it was where our show for the night was. This was one of the best restaurant experiences we have had in months. We got their right when it opened so we could make the show on time.  We started off with some garlic bread with a gorgonzola fondue sauce that sent my taste buds into another dimension.  My wife had the lamb chops and I had the surf and turf. Finally a restaurant that doesn't bring the lobster out in or on the shell. Both entrees were amazing and that is truly an understatement. Kept the gorgonzola fondue as a dipping sauce for the filet as opposed to bleu cheese and it was a great accompaniment. The gourmet macaroni and cheese was also unbelievable. If you haven't been there go!!!!!  Service was outstanding but I forgot his name. Top five restaurants in Vegas.

FYWpgT0Oj-wyB-3j4E3pGg.text: Let me start off by saying I have gone to and had the Potatoes Romanoff as well as the NY strip steak at the Strip House and I have to say, despite its outrageous price, the steak and potatoes are truly outstanding.  With the portions they give, I took leftovers home and had the best steak and eggs and potatoes I have ever had in my life. So, I was surprised and excited, after doing a search on the net, to find a couple of youtube type videos on the Strip House chefs doing their famous Potatoes Romanoff recipe; one being on the Today show. I listened and played the videos over and over until I got all the details to the letter and number.  I then proceeded to make these wonderful potatoes only to be incredibly disappointed at my results.  And, there were repeated attempts and all failures to capture the wonderful Strip House Potatoes Romanoff. One video said 15 minuets in the oven, the other said 25.  I tried both and even longer and every time the shallots came out crunchy and undercooked.  After multiple attempts, I decided to sweat the shallots a little.  This was better but not good enough.  Baked the potatoes, let them cool and rest for a day, grated and got good quality sour cream and white cheddar, and of course the russet potatoes, but none of my efforts seemed to pull it off. Funny thing is, as they say, it's easy to make using simple ingredients. My only conclusion is their ingredients are of a different caliber than what I can buy at my supermarket or gourmet market and or, they are doing something that they're not disclosing.

8CYrdnopb2sEpACc5mtxwA.text: Very good steak house.  Really enjoyed the food...nice 'stuffy' atmosphere.  Not the type of place I would visit often but enjoyed a fancy meal in a fancy place.  Loses one star for crazy high prices and fact that it is located in planet Hollywood...which is set up more like a mall than a casino...which makes the walk to the restaurant anything but enjoyable.

4svFi-vSGEHPTns8jqRVKw.text: With a name like Strip House you know you have to be into something decent! And not to forget its located in Planet Hollywood. Strip House was indeed that and more. This place was great, period!.   Decor: Well it indeed has a nice swanky design, dark lit, and covered with pics of nude females. The photography is awesome and no I'm not saying that because there are naked females from floor to celling. LOL If you know a little about photography you'll know these are actually nice shots. So from an decore/artistic view the place is set up very nice. It has just as much eye candy as you'll need. I guarantee you'll spend a lot of time looking/scanning the walls.  Food: Well first and foremost, I was shocked. Sure I knew it would be good but I had no idea it would be to this caliber. I tried several appetizers; used this spot as a jump pad before going to Prive (just across the way). The food was prepared great! Everything I had was delicious. And thats coming from someone who is a picky bastard. I had scallops, prawns, fondue with bread (yumm), and I had the Crab Cakes. Each item was huge! I was surprised to see scallops that big.   Overall this is a must. Give it a try!

aAm5K1M_EeyorNPSq_PWHQ.text: Had dinner here tonight, party of 6.  My first thought was that the table (not a booth) was a bit small.  Felt a bit cramped.  After placing our drink order, we had some appetizers.  Crab cakes (awesome!), Caesars salad (so-so), roasted beets w/asparagus (nice flavors, but beets were paper thin!), bacon w/arugula (yum!).  I felt the waiter wasn't very attentive to our drinks, as the glasses were empty for a while before he offered us another round...really, a big pet peeve of mine.  On to the entrees.  Bone in ribeye was perfection.  Seared tuna was very generous and as expected.  Filets were spot on.  But the most spectacular dish of the evening was the truffle mac 'n cheese.  OMFG!!!!!  To die for!!!!!!  Tried the goose fat potatoes.  Just ok, a bit heavy.  Whipped potatoes were good.  Everything was satisfying, but yeah, keep dreaming about that mac 'n cheese.  I think I will go back JUST for that!  Over all, great meal, a bit pricey, and did I mention the mac 'n cheese?!?

eP2KihW0JneNldabPACSLw.text: Strip House has a great location in the middle of the Strip in the trendy new Planet Hollywood hotel.  Strip House's original restaurant is in NYC and I hear it's one of the best steakhouses there.  So my bf and I went there before seeing a show and it was pretty tasty.  We have been to Strip Steak by Michael Mina at Mandalay Bay and I think this is better.  We ordered a steak each and a two sides to share.  I ordered my usual FILET MIGNON med rare to med and in comparison to my boyfriend's bone-in NY strip it was just ok.  The filet had a good crust but I would have liked it to come a lil warmer or at least a warm plate but was still good.  The bone BONE-IN NY STRIP he had was EXCELLENT, great crust seasoned to perfection with a lil spicy (we always like anything with a some kick) but did not  overpower the flavor of the beef and not too fatty.  Now the sides were great additions to the meal, one of the better steakhouse we've been to with exceptional side dishes.  We ordered GOOSE FAT POTATOES (recommended by many reviewers of the NYC lcoation) which is a big ball of mashed potatoes fried with a super crispy crust.  It was good different potato side dish.  We also had their BLACK TRUFFLE CREAMED SPINACH which was richly flavored.  If you like creamed spinach then you'll love this version.  FInally, we tried their CHOCOLATE CAKE.  Definitely THE BEST chocolate cakes I've had and it's HUGE.  It is 24 layers of moist chocolate cake and rich ganache; and that's it.  No nuts nor  fruit or any other extras, just chocolate.  We did however make ours a la mode, DELICIOUS!  It's a new restaurant in Vegas so try when you're in town and please save room for dessert.  Overall it was a 5 star meal!

1JXJ9RhRHI7qz_xHTBB9dQ.text: We recently came to the Strip House for Dinner while I was in Vegas and I enjoyed my experience. I sampled the Bib salad and the porter house. The salad was a bit over dressed for my liking but still very tasty. Fresh crumbles of blue cheese and bacon makes any salad delicious! My porter house was cook medium rare and was very good. There was a crispy crust of spices which added so much flavor to the steak. Service was impeccable and I would definitely come back.

MjPBV-RlEwOb0ejn6aObCQ.text: very nice ambience when you walk in. you get greated by 2 host. the bar and the dinning lounge are decorated with black and white picture of topless woman from the 50's-70's. all very tasteful with the theme. you can eat at the bar where you can get a tower of fresh seafood and wash it down with an ice cold cocktail.  great service all around from the host, bartender, too the waitress. the ribeye is great and the filet migon is a must!!  great place to take a date. very relaxed for anyone who wants to go to an upper scale steakhouse. no need to where a suit of you know what i mean.  enjoy!

fz106OrwVTOHHfJ1iHkLSw.text: I wasn't really impressed with Strip Steak. We started with the garlic bread with melted Gorgonzola cheese. It was pretty good, albeit not a whole lot of melted Gorgonzola cheese. Where's the cheese... apparently not on my plate. We also ordered the jumbo sea scallops with edamame succotash. This was a great dish. The sea scallops were seared to perfection and the succotash was an interesting base. We each got the 10oz filet. I ordered mine with the bordelaise sauce and she got her with the bernaise sauce. Here's the issue. She specifically asked for her steak to be cooked medium-well, no pink and butterflied. What she got was something more on the medium-rare side. My steak was good, cooked as I wanted it and tasty. I ordered the raspberry tea and she had the striphouse cosmo. Well I took one taste of the drink and couldn't take another. Have you ever tasted glucola or had a diabetes screen? Glucola is the sweetened liquid you drink for these tests and it is nasty....well in a word that describes my raspberry tea. I wanted to throw it up.   For what we paid and what we got I wouldn't go back. I like the hip vibe, but for me it's all about the service and food...oh did you see me mention anything about service? No, well that's because the service sucked!!

ebYMbqcLccQxHnQeXK8j_g.text: A OK place. Went here for the GF's Bday. I like the decor, dim lit, red/black color scheme with vintage 30's nude pics. I had the filet. It was good. I wouldn't say great or outstanding, but good nevertheless. Our sides were potato puree, which was decent and creamed spinach, skip this.  The GF ordered a bone-in ribeye. She likes her steak well-done and was disappointed to get her ribeye charred. She sent it back. A manager or supervisor did come over to check on us and inform her that it will be about 30mins. The GF didn't like her FYI tone and decide not to get the steak at all. Then the GM came over to smooth things over and comped us glasses of wine, birthday shots, and the 24 layer chocolate cake. Cake is huge and decent. Nice gesture by the GM.  Being that I chose this place for the GF's Bday and she had a lousy experience, this place gets a mix review. Overall, I thought it was a decent place, but I may consider other steak houses first.

kpbU3wIkxZrzTKo33o1ikw.text: Food quality, portion size  , & garnish is not as expected . Cant compare to ruth chris !

EEL4cFQ6r8y5nPs-Gl5u1w.text: Not bad.  Went with the dry aged ribeye, creamed spinach, and mushrooms. The pepper crust on the steak was a bit much. With that kind of cut, it could have done with a bit less. The mushrooms were pretty darn good. The bacon in the creamed spinach was a bit over powering.   Count on around $80 per person when you go here. Probably not the best I have had, but it's near the top and was a consolation choice when we couldn't get into Gordon Ramsey's new steakhouse to try the Beef Wellington.  If you can't get in there, then this will be a good runner up choice.

vlFHBVUvAGB2SajcKsy5bw.text: So before I start this review, I just want to mention that I've never been to a steak house before and it was my birthday soooooo . . . yeah.   That being said, this place was amazing. We were staying in Planet Hollywood anyway and I wanted to eat somewhere fancy for dinner and then place did the job. We were late for our reservation but they were about to still fit us in and sat us quickly, which they definitely didn't have to do. rThe place is decorated with 1920's models thats range of clothed to quasi nude models in way that was kinda classy but didn't interfere with your dinner either. The low lights and red interior gave it an intimate feel too.   Our waiter was a combination of charismatic and creepy, in a way that was very entertaining to me. I don't know if it was on purpose or not but either way he was very good at his job. One of my friends suggested I get the ribeye steak medium well so I went with that and I was not dissappointed! No one was in fact, not even the vegetarian! (She ordered a 2 sides instead of steak and still didn't finish everything). Probably the most surprising item was the grean beans cause they were freaking delicious. I was stuffed and could stop eating them. In fact, many of the sides that we ordered could be shared with at least one other person. They are kinda big and so flavorful, so they were also pretty filling.   We decided to get the 25 layer chocolate cake for dessert. That's right. 25 LAYERS! Again, I couldn't stop eating it and I don't even like cake that much. I had mentioned to the waiter and supervisor that was working that my birthday was my favorite holiday, so when the cake come out, it had a candle in it and Happy Birthday was written on the cake. They waiter and sup even came by and said "Have fun on your favorite holiday!" It was something simple and easy that they didn't have to do at all but they did. 5 stars!

aMDqCrZJhExv2HJzbCCrCw.text: I had a 23 person party for my bachelor party. Some of my table mates were drunk off their ass since they had to chug those yard-stick margaritas before being seated. I give Strip House at least 3-stars for not kicking us out due to my drunkard friends.  Our server was excellent, so no complaints about the service. I had a ribeye steak which was thick and delicious (and also $50). It was a bit peppery which was fine for me, but I'm sure my fiancee would not like it. Everything is a la carte, so you may be sharing side dishes and such. There is also a $7 sharing fee for meals.

ZeGFUuBOXD8bB9Xc8v-x2g.text: We discovered the Strip House Restaurant in NYC about 5 years ago. When we discovered that there was a Las Vegas location, we immediately made reservations!  Our group started with Oysters and the Mixed Greens salad - both were great. The salad came in a wonderful crispy parmesan bowl.  For entrees, our group had the salmon, the ribeye and a filet. All of the entrees were better than we remembered in NYC.  All the sides we tried were incredible!  Creamed spinach, green beans, potatoes romanoff... YUM.  This restaurant is a bit expensive, but worth every penny!!

Dz1eVdDUJiX52_eGjUhW1w.text: Level of service did not exactly match the prices, even for busy Vegas hotel standards. We had better service for a third of the price at Holsteins across The Strip and at other less expensive places. Overall, we had a good time, but mainly due to good company :)  I made reservations for my girlfriend's bday and I even received a phone call confirming the reservation and asking if there was a special occasion. They did do one thing special and that was to write happy birthday on the plate they served the piece of cake I ordered for us. Unfortunately, that was the end of the good part.  The food and service were not what we expected, and we are by no means high maintenance! She ordered the lobster linguine and almost chipped a tooth on a nickel-sized piece of shell! Our waiter, who disappeared for a while, didn't even apologize or offer any comps when I called attention to the shell, which was very disappointing. The guy who cleared our table spilled butter sauce and nearly got it on my shoe. Others at nearby tables seemed to have more engaging and better service.

A-lBp94JnlxuWp7RZb7pMg.text: The only reason this isn't a 5+ star review is because of the prices (ouch!).  The menu is standard for a steakhouse in terms of selection and prices, but the way the dishes are done makes every item truly exciting so they deserve extra props in that department.  The presentation of every dish is impeccable.  The shotglass of cold watermelon soup to whet the appetite and awaken your tastebuds does just that--it's amazing.  The salmon with basil pesto foam, lobster linguine, and steak were all devoured.  Absolutely incredible.

zQwNC9wdfQH4kakIQruXeQ.text: Sign me up for the Strip House Train.  This restaurant is tremendous. I've been twice and heartily recommend it. Why?  Because of the steaks. The New York Strip on the bone: there you go, twenty ounces of mouth watering juiciness, broiled to perfection and seasoned to within an inch of its former life, generously coated with coarse salt and potent black pepper. Oh, boy, this is going to be one of the best steaks you've ever had. Sides to go with the steak: the green beans in garlic sauce -- killer -- and the onion shoestrings, made from Spanish Onions and lightly breaded, the ideal companion for your steak. And for dessert? The 24 layer chocolate cake of course. Don't be scared, the layers are thin, and the great thing about it -- it's not that sweet, more of a semi-sweet chocolate... satisfying your desire for something a post meal treat, but allowing you to also remain in the glow of  a perfectly prepared steak.  I've been to four or five steak houses on the Las Vegas Strip and this one is my favorite so far. It isn't cheap, but the best things usually aren't..

833XgsF8KkS82IQFKq4ydA.text: We just came from dinner at Strip House tonight and were extremely impressed.  We arrived and got seated in one of their cool booths.  The decor in the restaurant is truly Las Vegas with b/w photos of pinups and go-go dancers.  The furnishings were dark woods and RED walls and seats...very sensuous and sexy.  For starters, we had their lobster bisque and garlic toast with cheese fondue.  Both dishes were sooooo good.  The bisque was very rich and full of lobster flavor..one of the best lobster bisque that I have ever had.  The garlic toast with cheese fondue not too cheesy was ....ditto good.  For our meals, we had the bone in rib eye steak, lobster linguine, goose fat potatos and bacon, truffled creamed spinach.  All these items were soooo tasty......the steak was cooked perfectly.....the lobster linguine was excellent (full of lobster flavor) and the sides of goose fat potatos (like diced hash browns) and bacon truffled creamed spinach were perfect sides...filling and with unique flavors.  For desert we had their famous 24 layer chocolate cake w/vanilla ice cream.....one of best deserts we have ever had.......sooooo sweet and super tasty.  Overall...one of the best steakhouses I have ever been to.  From the sexy ambience, to the lobster bisque, steak and chocolate cake...all was just sooo yummy.  The service was also outstanding!!  No sex tonight..........I was so satisfied, I came in my pants!

Tb-Fb2s8eWkGJYhfENO1gQ.text: We made a reservation for Strip House for a Thursday night.  We arrived & were promptly seated in a roomy corner booth.  The first thing I noticed was the decor of red velvet wallpaper with old photos on the wall.  It set a nice romantic mood.  The service right off the bat was top notch.  The food was outstanding!  Everything we had from the tuna tartar, to our steaks & even the sides were delicious and perfectly prepared.  Next time we are in Vegas we will for sure be back here.  It was overall an outstanding dining experience!

o96yOIvznEWJUzicUhuiow.text: Amazing food and service!!! Go- you won't be disappointed! The restaurant has a great atmosphere. The food was delish! The service is beyond great. Our waiter was on time with everything. This is a top notch restaurant with impeccable service!

U2L1HV28qDdpjElrEMSH6w.text: Came on a Tuesday Night (literally just got back to the room lol) we were out for my buddies fiance birthday, service was top notch! We started in the bar while we waited for a couple of our party to arrive, the bar tender was fantastic and very knowledgeable and made a great drink, once at our table the Gentleman who served us was outstanding! Gave us plenty of time to get settled and talk over the menu which I like, I hate when you just open the menu at a new place and they're already pushing appetizers, he came back told us about a few specials and took our order. We got the Bacon which was good but not great, a special appetizer they were doing with goat cheese wrapped prosciutto with a lil spicy kick to it which were good and we got Oysters on the Half Shell that were awesome! Entrees and Sides were Top Notch, I ate probably the best Rib Eye Steak I have ever had, 20oz Bone In, crispy char on the outside with a perfect medium on the inside! Seriously I will be back just for that steak! The rest of our party had the Porterhouse for 2 which they loved, the 8oz Filet was terrific and our dieting friend loved the chicken! The Romanoff Potaoes are very good but the star of the sides we got was the Mac and Cheese! Give me that Rib Eye and a plate of Mac and Cheese and I'm good! Anytime I'm in Vegas I will be coming here!! From Hostesses to busboys (my water was never less than half empty ) managers the waitstaff and whoever cooked my steak tonight you were AWESOME!!!

tGiqbJHuT1elxmp1dhVBKg.text: Ate at strip house before show at planet hollywood. It's a steakhouse and among all the other things that made this an excellent experience (service, drinks, sides, atmosphere), it was the steak that was unbelievably fantastic. NY strip done medium. Perfect char and crust. Succulent inside and made me close my eyes with each bite. Going back when i get back to Las Vegas

0fkQO5xcOMe5vO9KMgYJ7w.text: One of the best if not the best ever Bone In Rib Eye Ive ever had. There wasnt a bad bite of that steak. It was cooked to perfection. Great stop on the book tour to a some what hidden away gem upstairs in Planet Hollywood.

Hs5XrWBUStytl6fLFwkcOg.text: Decent meal. Decent service.  Decent atmosphere.  Expected prices.  We've been to probably every steak house in Las Vegas and nothing stood out either way about this one.

-25JFEZvd2i51ARJZ96EIQ.text: Dark and intimate setting great service by Brett S. Pricey but well worth it. Best steak house in Vegas. Lobster was phenomenal. I loved everything about this place. This is going to be a must every time im in Vegas. Loved it.

lJHLz2IzqDTnnS42dRyB8g.text: AMAZING FILET!  Outstanding service!  And I'm pretty damn picky.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Need I say more!?  FANTASTIC!!!

EoAWNVFf7g0NTgNw47UyLg.text: My group of five recently had a very excellent experience at this fine steak house. Very inviting atmosphere. No one was at a lost for something to look at and talk about. We were promptly seated and had all of our drinks in a few minutes. One of my guests had a sever food allergy which was addresses professional and personally handled by the manager who oversaw that no allergy issues took place. Expert Job Guys! The staff was "Johnny-on-the-spot", nothing went undone, under served or in any way negative to upset the night. I had a crab cake which was about as good as it gets when you consider the distance from the ocean. My main course was a superb cut of perfectly cooked organic chicken with just the right sides. No complaints. 4.99 out of 5. Thanks everyone for a truly amazing time for my guests and I during my birthday dinner.

uzbF7YAufu-MnnojNaKHjA.text: Steak was overcooked, appetizer's never came out, and they screwed up my drink.  Have eaten at other Strip House's and this one was by far and away the worst one of the bunch.  Side note...We think that our waiter may have been high on something, but he didn't offer to share...

laGlc4krmG4z710Zp60Z0Q.text: My husband and I ate here for a special occasion in October 2014. We ordered a steak dinner for two, blue cheese wedge salad and creamed spinach. The manager on duty (unsure of name) recognized our special occasion and provided two complimentary glasses of champagne to celebrate. They also gave us a plate full of potatoes which my husband raved about. The creamed spinach was unlike anything I've ever eaten before. Perfectly cooked and full of flavor. I couldn't stop eating it. Our server (John) was on top of all of our requests and needs and couldn't have been more professional and friendly. Lighting and ambiance was beautiful, which made for a nice romantic dinner. Highly recommended.

Auj7pAcJ1qmhCyrtp4DXQg.text: This place is amazing! My wife and I go here every time we're in Vegas. You can't find a better steak or fine dining experience. The plating is gorgeous, and the flavor is spot on every time. If you're going to Vegas, make this a must eat destination!

yeKwq8Shbrsjotqeng-iCw.text: Well en route to Vegas my wife had a hankering for a good steak house. This place was definitely a good choice. My wife had the surf and turf with a margarita and it was amazing. I had the New York strip and it was made to perfection. The staff (Carlos) was courteous and polite and made our visit pleasant. I would definitely recommend this establishment if you happen to be in the Planet Hollywood Casino area.

xqZgAbKJYVd4pnns7k85bg.text: Wife and I had an incredible meal here.  Started with the oysters then steak and lamb with sauteed mushrooms and creamed spinach.  Service was excellent but the steak was outstanding.  The crust on the steak was fantastic.  Watched a group of four friends at the table next to us have the same experience - but with cake.    Will certainly return when back in Vegas.  Great job Strip House.

QFCKmcnlLSQ0KyIiP23sag.text: Everything we had here was delicious. The steaks were amazing, the sides were yummy and of course we got the 24 layer cake and it didn't disappoint. Waiter service was quick and extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and I hope next time i'm in Vegas, I can come back for dinner here!!

9WhRiEtcBAJwKuDDfA7AGg.text: Went there last night and let me tell you...worst customer service I have ever ran across in my entire life. Don't get me wrong, the food was great. But the experience of dining in there was totally unacceptable. I am not sure if they took me seriously because I am 23 years old, but the servers don't know I run three of my own businesses. So next time, please don't judge a book by it's cover. Would've spent a lot more money, but unfortunately the environment was not where I want to be again.

EN3z1cDdlZDY9CP1cUjeLg.text: I am not a steak person however after almost 3 weeks of eating junk food throughout America my husband (who is a massive steak lover) and I just wanted something non greasy. The lady at planet Hollywood reception recommend us to go upstairs and head into strip house and we are so greatful she did I have never had such a soft, juicy, perfectly cooked steak in my life! By far the most amazing steak in the USA!! Highly recommend to eat here! It is more so 5 star dining so it is expensive! But it is so worth it! Our waiter was so lovely also and so helpful with selection of sides ect! I would fly from Australia to Vegas again just for the steak!!!

nU8y9dxGCDB1jb78Yc9jig.text: The service was horrible here!  The decor was nice inside and food was decent but I had a horrible experience here. Our server was always rushing and it made our party feel unwelcomed. He would leave the table before the last two people could order their drinks.   The food was average, my filet was very salty - I had no more than 3 bites and ordered the caprese salad, which was amazing. It could have just been I came on the wrong night, many of the items we wanted to order such as fish, specialty drinks and a few appetizers were all sold out. But it was only 7:00pm?   I had a bite of the 24 layer chocolate cake which was pretty good but rich, needed a glass of milk to go with it.   Not sure if I would come back here or recommend it, I would rather go to Gordan Ramsey's.

OUexagQtwyAHiIhUJj3SeQ.text: I was there with my girlfriend to celebrate our 25 years together and her birthday. Everything was perfect. The food was delicious, Scott took great care of us and the ambiance (both the decor and music) was just fabulous. And since it was my gf birthday, we had to try their famous chocolate layers cake which was up to our high expectations!! Great dinner and thanks to Scott.

70yqQMD4XyRiZ3q_LLM8VA.text: Where do I start?  Girl in the front gave the best seats :) I think we might have had the best waiter in the place. Drinks were perfect and good was amazing! guaranteed the greatest service I have ever received! Can't wait until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whoever the girl was, she gave us the best seats in the place :)

nYgm_j-FPL-fyDUteyevJw.text: The manager was the absolute worst. He actually ran from our table when we had a problem. Otherwise the place was great. Hope that you don't have an issue because the manager is scared of customers

KmHeGCO3y1fVHDihKHtEew.text: Good spot for a steak. Sat at the bar, had the 16oz NY strip medium rare, charred broccoli as a side.   Steak was cooked perfectly, with a heavy seasoned char on the outside and served with homemade steak sauce (which was tasty, but I didn't use it)   Broccoli was also good.  Close to 5 stars, would definitely eat here again.

FxU_Niqw6AA9DK4_rh6yQw.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from Strip House Steak House but I was pleasantly surprised with my meal here. I came on a Saturday night with some friends that were in town visiting and they were staying at Planet Hollywood. There were not a lot of people inside dining, so I was skeptical, but after everything we had, our group enjoyed our meal.  We started with the large seafood tower (would definitely recommend this for large groups) that came with an assortment of shrimp cocktail, oysters, crab legs, lobster tail, and other ceviches. Other notable appetizers included the crab cake, tuna tartare, and lobster bisque. We got a bunch of sides to share with the steaks including the mashed potatoes, string beans, mushrooms, and broccoli. Now for the steaks - definitely surprised with the quality of the steaks, but I would suggest asking them to go light on the salt - it was a little heavy for me. I got the porterhouse for two (shared it with my friend) and it was cooked a very good medium rare. The steaks also came with a roasted garlic, one of my favorite accompaniments to a steak. Finally, dessert - a baked alaska was ordered for the table to share and enjoy.  Overall a good steakhouse for those that are staying at Planet Hollywood.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wine, seafood tower, porterhouse and sides

colGH5Nm1C0IkXa_gL4mPg.text: My wife and I are in Vegas celebrating her 50th Birthday. I saw the very good Yelp reviews regarding this steakhouse so booked reservations several days ago using Open Table App leaving note regarding special birthday celebration.   We arrived on time for our 6:30pm reservation they made references to my wife's birthday. (Unfortunately did not mean anything since the restaurant does not comp birthday desserts).  So far everything is going well and were seated then ordered our meal.   We started with the Mixed Field Greens which we shared and had an adequate portion for the both of us. The Sherry vinaigrette was good.   The Main Entree meal we ordered was the Porter House Steak for two. My wife and I agreed this was the best steak we've ever eaten.   We ordered the Potato Romanoff as a side dish along with Garlic Sauteed Green Beans. These two sides were outstanding with twice baked gratin potatoes and the perfectly sauteed crisp green beans in olive oil and garlic.   Also ordered the Lobster Thermador in which the lobster that was placed back into the shell then baked again was pretty tough. I did enjoy the claws on top which were fried in a tempura batter. Advised the waiter regarding the toughness of the lobster meat but he basically ignored me and evidently did not inform management since he did not remove from my bill or make any attempt to deal with the issue. I've been to many restaurants that will remove a bad portion of a meal off the bill or workout an equitable arrangement that resolved the issue. Didn't want to cause a scene on my wife's birthday. I would normally handle these issues more vigorously if not initially heard since I'm paying for a service and want the best in return.   Dessert we ordered was the Carmelized Banana Tart which was very delicious. Of course they did not comp the dessert for her birthday but in light of the the lobster issue should have been done.   Overall the food was very good except the lobster. Disappointed they did not reach out to resolve this issue in a fair and equitable way. Hope management reads this review and contacts me to resolve this issue. I still tipped the waiter appropriately even though he did not handle my concerns properly. Only gave 3 Stars should have been 5 Star but when a business doesn't not listen their customers concerns and ignores them leaves no choice.

yc15JPWEo7BjDT-1mAbfMA.text: I return here every time I'm in Vegas. The steaks are great. The sides are fantastic. It's a very intimate setting and the service is spectacular.

tbj0vDaceKogiV2o3U9m2A.text: Of all the steakhouses I've been to, this is the best.   Fillet mignon melted in my mouth. The lobster tail was perfection. Perfectly chopped salad. And best of all, the drinks were nice and strong.

l_UT7TRVZ4eUIgjX95qfxw.text: My friends and I had a wonderful experience here at Strip House. We went for Valentines Day and were so pleased that we chose this place to dine. Billy was our server, he was extremely professional and knowledgeable about the specials and menu. Our dinner was amazing and the 24 layer chocolate cake was to die for. We will definately recommend this place to others and will be back again soon.

Z6hmNBlPzH4RJcPXRNf8Sw.text: Literally the BEST steak I have ever had! I really believe I will never find another steak that can beat this place. You have to go and try this place!  What makes this place even better was the customer service. We showed up and explained to the server that we had tickets for a show and only had 40 mins until it started and asked if this was a possibility? She said no problem and we will make sure it happens with a assuring wink.   Truth be truth. We got our food which was steak and the others got salmon faster then any other place I had ever been to. Very sweet server who got a huge tip and a large thank you.  Now the steak was so large that I shared multiple bites with others and everyone wished they had got the steak. Even after sharing I still had so much steak that I was stuffed. Thickest, juciest steak ever!   Order the steak!!! Don't doubt but order this amazing steak! It is a must go to place people. Go!!!  Drinks were amazing too and the theme is not for children but adults only. The lights inside were perfect and great for close friends, spouses, or relationships.  Why are you reading this? Go already!

UaYESf4TM_3BYy45OJBrbg.text: I never knew that Planet Hollywood had such a great restaurant upstairs.  Amazing atmosphere and three service was top notch.  Our entire table ordered the dry aged ribeye.  It was cooked to perfection.   Crusty and a little crisp on the outside and nice and tender inside.  The bulb of roasted garlic was also very tasty and complemented the meat very well.  The ambience, food, and service makes this an excellent place to splurge.

dl9uO7FnoJWzvlYhS3wUmQ.text: Fantastic! Our waiter "Scott" was great!  Our Steaks were cooked to perfection, so tender. Our Salmon was delicious and juicy not dry! The calamari is Devine, tomato & mozzarella is great as well! Definitely started our night off right!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato/mozzarella

qd-nK5pBV6W8XWfSEndkLA.text: The Decor is excellent. First of all, let's start with the waiter. John the most professional waiter I've dealt with. The pasta was awesome and my wife's Surf and turf was tasty. Then I order the Banana Tart with the Gelato. Pic is coming. Definitely coming back when I come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Art in a plate. Excellent!!!

pS7ghWYsDIsuwMoZFsBz7g.text: We walked in at 5pm and were seated immediately. It was pretty slow but it was a Tuesday night. We were seated in an awkward booth, I would've preferred a half booth or a table for a business dinner.   Service was excellent throughout our meal. My merlot paired well with my ribeye. My coworker ordered the special of the night which was the 6 oz. parmesan crusted filet mignon with a balsamic glaze. I tried some of it and it was ok. The meat was tender, however, I did not enjoy the parmesan which added no appeal to the steak. The balsamic glaze was nice, however, the overpowering pepper killed the flavor of the tender meat. The same with my 12 oz. dry aged ribeye steak which was overcooked and also was over seasoned. This prevented the meat to really shine.  As far as side dishes go, we ordered the split potatoes, potato romanasco, and black truffle creamed spinach. The split potatoes were overcooked and tough to chew. I really enjoyed the potato romanasco and the truffle creamed spinach which were delicious!   We were too full for dessert and had to forgo on it. Overall, food was ok. However, for the price ($310+ for 4 ppl), I expected higher quality and consistency in cooking and seasoning. I was sorely disappointed.

iIye5o8QA8x420HP_JyCug.text: My husband and I have been lucky to have had many fine dining experiences. Without a doubt, the strip house is among the best.  What stands out the most other than the excellent food was the outstanding service.  You rarely encounter a waiter like Jared. Not only does he know his wines but he is extremely well versed with the menu. He made this one of the finest dining experiences we have ever had.

2azb7iBAmmbtPvZkZ3qsJg.text: Already wrote a review for the Striphouse in NYC. If you read that review everything good applies here, there is no bad. Just look at the photos, the glistening steak & our big smiles say it all. I believe Striphouse has 3 locations, the most important thing about opening a location that far away from the original is consistency, this place delivers. I've eaten at 6 good steakhouses in Las Vegas & in my opinion this is the best. Besides the food, the professionalism & classic decor also hit the mark. Don't let it's sneaky location at the upper floor of Planet Hollywood fool you, place this restaurant anywhere and it will dominate!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brothers out for Vegas steak night!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goose fat potatoes
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in NY strip... Phenomenal!

L0_CHLvMcT41gQdhQc57kg.text: While we were in Vegas we wanted to get a good steak. So we started checking around and came across the strip house. We were concerned about reservations for six so last minute, but they were extremely accommodating and were able to get us right in at 19:30.  They had excellent selections of meats and sides.  Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in guiding us through the menu.  Most of the appetizers are for a single serving which was a little odd so we had to buy several to share with the table. My partner and myself decided on the chateaubriand steak.  That's steak was a slice of heaven and I Tell you.  The lighting is dim and has a casual ambience feel there.   There were a lot of couples, perhaps first or second dates occurring throughout the restaurant.   The waiter upfront asked if there is any time constraints which I appreciated and that we were free for the evening.

tdjI-DvAhCi7GQBZS9ZiWA.text: We stopped here on our own food tour of Vegas and had their 12-layer chocolate cake. Super decadent and delicious. My hubs and I sat at the bar and had drinks. Really friendly bartender and we were the only ones there at 5pm. The cake lived up to the price tag and expectations. We couldn't eat the entire slice since it was so rich and ended up taking it home. It was amazing as a late night snack and breakfast in the morning!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous chocolate cake. So many layers of decadence!

FIvKl3RPB_xpkL2tYnqTqQ.text: The Strip House is a quality Vegas steakhouse in the Planet Hollywood hotel. My husband and I split a 16oz New York Strip steak and three sides. The steak was a great cut of meat and it was seasoned in a superb pepper rub. For sides, we ordered the creamed spinach, the special mac and cheese with short rib bits, and the whipped mashed potatoes. We learned the hard way that three sides was way too much food but everything was tasty. We also ordered a delightful bottle of malbec. Overall, it was a great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Felino malbec
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides galore! Mac and cheese, creamed spinach and whipped potatoes
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz NY strip

DWhIWSqphSsfjxF2P7YlRw.text: You had me at chateaubriand. I had to convince my wife to share the exquisite cut of meat. But, you really can't beat the tenderness and flavor of the 'briand. They prepare the steak with a crusty salt layer with a little spicy kick, which they will adjust. I didn't need any additional sauce, our guests enjoyed the bordelaise.  The seafood platter was tasty. I wish I could have changed some of selections to add certain items and take away from others - more salmon (fave item on the platter) and tuna fewer oysters.  The 24 layer chocolate cake is over hyped. The duo of flavors was pretty pedestrian. Given the large layer count I would expect more flavor varieties. Our server thoughtfully prepared a birthday greeting for my wife's celebration.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LI_DNKZUGsawAcw2l0lehw.text: My husband and I did not have a good experience here. We consider ourselves foodies and often splurge on good meals and this place was a huge disappointment. We ordered the porterhouse for two and two side dishes. The side dishes were delicious. We chose spinach and the potato puree. The steak was not good at all. We ordered medium, it came out medium rare. When my plate filled up with blood after cutting two bites we had to flag someone down where we asked them to take it back and please cook to medium. Never once did any employee apologize for the inconvenience. The steak overall was dry, chewy and lacked flavor. For $102 piece of meat, this was awful. Our server was like a robot- not personable, friendly or welcoming. She seemed miserable and had no soft skills. I also ordered the seasonal cosmopolitan for a cocktail- it was okay, nothing special. The friendliest person we dealt with all night here was the kind gentleman that poured our water. We have eaten at too many restaurants to count in Las Vegas and this was the worst experience we have ever had. There are SO many wonderful options, I would certainly steer clear of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked steak- we requested medium and received medium rare

2M3Bbx8GskeOMl1TwahQ6A.text: I've been to a lot steakhouses in Vegas, so I didn't expect this to be one of the best (I had my expectations set low for some reason.) This place is top 5 in my book (CUT, Craftsteak, Binions for the nostalgia and great service, and Delmonico's are my other top spots to date.)  Started off with the jerky for an appetizer. I don't think I've ever had jerky in a restaurant, so the bar was low so long as they didn't put a Slim Jim on a plate. Guys... You have to try the jerky. It does have a lil kick to it, but I absolutely loved it.  For the main I went with the 16oz NY strip (medium.) The flavor was superb! Paired it with mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts so I was in heaven. I sadly was too full for dessert even though they had some good options.  The service admittedly could've been better, but it wasn't horrible. Even though it's low lit, it's not romantic because it can get noisy (unlike say Cut.) The price was on par with what I've seen at other places so I've got no real complaints. If you're staying at PH - go here if you want steak.

5spIOaM6aVCxesbfCXqCsw.text: We were in town and were looking for someplace new to us; Went here for an anniversary dinner.  Total: $206 + tip, but we don't do this very often and it was absolutely worth it!  On a Thursday night, it wasn't very busy, but I made reservations on Open Table just in case, while we made our way to Planet Hollywood Hotel. They took us right in, it was about half full at 8pm. The host was very friendly and welcoming as we made our way to the table.  Our server was sweet, and the entire dinner service as a whole was efficient. Everyone was on the ball refilling drinks and clearing the table or offering assistance.   The restaurant is dark, filled with burlesque photos and a Godfather feel of dark woods and red accents.  Our food: 8oz filet minion original pepper & salt crust was perfectly cooked medium. I actually added some of hubbys blue cheese topping and it made it to die for!  For fun, I added 2 scallops, moist, and perfect salted seasoning.  Dry-aged ribeye, also cooked perfectly at medium, and very tender. Added the delicious blue cheese topping, and there was plenty to share with the other steak.  Bread basket: pretzel bread and multi-grain cranberry bread...both were good and served with warmed, not melted, butter! So much easier to spread when it doesn't come out of the freezer!  Drinks: 1 glass of Riesling from Austria; I was warned it was dry and it was the best Riesling I've ever had...not quite as sweet as the others. Iced tea, in an individual glass bottle of "Republic of Tea." And the servers came by to refill the glass several times.  Potato puree to share was so smooth and had a certain sweetness to it...delicious!  But what I really saved room for was the asparagus...had some delicious creamy sauce with capers...I couldn't get enough! I will never want asparagus any other way!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All delicious! 8oz filet minion with scallops; Dry-aged ribeye, potato purée, asparagus in capers sauce
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy Strip House Steak Knife

5yQPzCeR-zS6_uLUxc8PbA.text: I love the decor here it is so fun with the deep reds and the hidden strippers on the wallpaper and napkins.  The booths were super comfortable and the room nice an intimate. The service was good but it was super slow at times. I felt they did not have enough bar staff working since it took forever to get the bottle of wine or after dinner drinks.  The wine list was great with tons of nice selections at every price point.  I started with the heirloom tomato salad and it was so beautifully presented and tasted wonderful. For my main course I had the small filet and lobster tail.  The lobster was delicious and perfectly cooked. The filet was good I felt that they over seasoned it so next time I will definitely ask for the filet to be naked. The sides were good and large enough to share.  This is one of the better steak houses in Las Vegas and it would be five stars if they didn't. Over-season the meat and stepped up the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small filet and lobster tail
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom tomato salad

fGaDqMFx9Xuj-oCubLR5pw.text: Oh Strip House, how I love thee!   To begin, I made a reservation for a private room for a work function with Lori C. and she was fantabulous, knowledgeable and professional throughout the process. She spent a fair amount of time helping to select wine and a preset menu but some of our guests were not able to attend so we moved to the main dining room. Lori was understanding and perfect throughout the changes.  The dinner itself was outstanding as well as the service. It was a work function so I didn't want to be the young person taking photos but the food was as beautiful as it was delicious. We shared two seafood towers and the quality was outstanding. My only complaint would be that the back servers took them away with food still on them without leaving the plates of food on the table or offering it to the diners. That tartar and those scallops should not go to waste, ever! I ordered the bone in filet Oscar style and it was....to. die. for. Cooked perfectly to medium and with the sort of flavor that doesn't need sauce! Lol And when they tell you the steak is heavily peppered, they ain't joking! Be aware if that's not your thing.   2 days after my work dinner and the convention ended I finally ate my chocolate cake and it was still good. :) I'm still shocked that I didn't know about this place sooner and shocked that they weren't busy during the convention, y'all better go so you can understand why I'm shocked. Just don't forget your wallet $$.

ba-FM7J6oUcyY0ZfFTUgCg.text: My Ny strip tasted fantastic. Although every steak shop I go to I always get medium rare, this one was more on the rare side which is fine. The taste was still great, the outside of the steak had a great seasoning with a smoked charred taste. I felt pricing was pretty good for being a steakhouse on the strip. I would come back here and recommend it to anyone.

Ixx5VtMO7emBUY6Oz2urNA.text: Excellent food and excellent customer service. I couldn't have been more satisfied with our experience. We ordered the seafood plateau, 16oz NY Strip, and twice baked potatoes. Everything was wonderful and the steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. My husband even closed his eyes on the first bite. We also ordered the 30 day barrel aged old fashioned and it was very smooth. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u-Hi1fhDHyN36B31u_u4fQ.text: Located in Planet Hollywood, the Strip House is a great dinner option while you are in Vegas. My brothers and I went on a recent trip to Vegas. We made reservations the day before (just in case). The staff is very friendly and accommodative. And let me just say, this was the best steak I've ever tasted. Ever! The char-grill on a medium tastes so good. And honestly, you don't need a steak sauce or condiment. We ordered sides because you just can't eat meat right lol. My brothers got wine but I was good with water. They enjoyed the wine. The bread was also very tasty. I'll say that the price is not like Olive Garden (not throwing shade, just saying). It's a pricey place but when in Rome, or I guess when in Vegas :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t-D3zMuxlk92Oc_Hw54aBA.text: The best meal I've had in quite a while. Bone in Ribeye, Foie Gras, n Creamed Spinach. 14 Year Anniversary well spent. Well priced for the quality, ambiance, service, n location!! This is now our new special occasion spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushrooms were amazing!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. complimentary side (creamed spinach)
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters n Ahi Poke apps.
