ENvP0ZWHQoDulM8VvGUAJA.text: The food and service was very good. I had a bone in ribeye and it comes with a a salt and pepper crust, it was seared and had a a perfectly cooked inside. The potatoes were great, brussel sprouts delicious. We finished the meal with a layered chocolate cake. The wait staff was very attentive and made sure everything we needed was provided. Like most food on the Strip I believe this meal was a little over priced but hey....it's Las Vegas. With all this said it is worth a visit.

XWR82qnoaVqjmefvtQ98lQ.text: Don't waste your time- not worth the $$$. Service was horrible and slow. Steak came out past well done (ordered medium) would never recommend to anyone... especially when there are so many great food choices in Vegas.

A3GHOAwfxoLyMbsBzjnmwA.text: Prologue: My fiancee and I had tickets for a show at Planet Hollywood and wanted to find a fantastic restaurant to have dinner before the show.  The Plot: We began by sharing the Goat Cheese Prosciutto Rolls, followed with a 12oz Filet Mignon along with Crisp Goose Fat Potatoes and Sauteed Wild Mushrooms. This sumptuous meal was concluded with their signature 24-Layer Chocolate Cake.  The Scene: The portion sizes were very good and there was plenty of food for the both of us.  You know the meal you're about to enjoy is off to a great start when the basket that first arrives at your table is filled with a variety of hot rolls that are even better than anything you've purchased at an artisan bakery.  The Prosciutto Rolls were stuffed with Calabrian-Infused Goat Cheese, Wild Arugula, Frisee, and Shaved Parmesan and were served with a Twelve-Year Aged Balsamic Glaze. To begin with, the exceptional quality of the prosciutto was immediately apparent. The spice from the Calabrian Chile was well balanced with the chilled goat cheese and greens yet still delivered enough heat to excite our taste buds. My fiancee commented that she would have been satisfied with just this dish alone for dinner.  The Filet Mignon was cooked to a perfect medium rare (see photographic evidence below) and had been allowed to rest appropriately prior to arriving at our table. The steak also had a nice crust on it with classic seasoning. My fiancee appreciated how it was moist, tender, and pink in the middle but not at all bloody.  The Potato Croquette had great texture; firm yet tender and perfectly seasoned on the inside with a lovely and very yummy crispy crust on the outside. This was a much nicer compliment to our steak than a baked potato would have been.  Personally I enjoyed the Sauteed Wild Mushrooms most of all. The portion size was very generous and the variety, texture, and flavor of the mushrooms was absolutely outstanding; perhaps the best I've ever had.  Twenty-four alternating layers of chocolate cake and chocolate mousse topped with ganache comprised their signature dessert. One could not help appreciating the time and effort that went into creating this dessert. The piece we were served was monstrous and was easily enough chocolate bliss for 3 or 4 people.  The Rest of the Story: The serivice was excellent, of course. We arrived early in the evening, were seated at one of the best tables in the house, and were cared for very well.  The ambiance and decor were classic steak house crossed with Sin City.  The tab for the meal was very reasonable for fine dining at this level in this location.  Epilogue: We happily award 4 stars for our most satisfying and memorable dinner in Las Vegas to date.  Photo Design: by Billie Z.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed Wild Mushrooms
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crisp Goose Fat Potatoes
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat Cheese Prosciutto Rolls

77PLFylZqvRuJOap-A_QLw.text: One of the top dining experiences on the Strip! Amazing ambiance (rated mature), delicious cocktails, stellar cuisine and excellent service. We sat at the bar and shared the Italian Chopped salad and the Surf 'n Turf entree with a side of Sauteed Wild Mushrooms. I could go on and on about all of it -- simply amazing! I managed to snap a pic of the salad but when the surf 'n turf and mushrooms arrived, I lost my mind and dug in immediately ... it was crazy good. We make sure to dine at the Strip House each time we visit Vegas -- can hardly wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Italian Chopped salad, complimentary bread &amp; butter, and spectacular cocktails ... yummmm.

RgthBFMX6TdJKz7wp_JwTg.text: All I can say is wow!!! Awesome rib eye! Cat was our server and she really did a great job, along with the whole staff! Water was flowing endlessly. The pepper on our steak was the best I've had in a long time. We were highly recommended by a bartender down stairs, what a great choice- had the ribeye and filet, both cooked to perfection. Service was awesome- decor is really nice too.. our new goto spot on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-eoFdWk5yY087YA9yAICfQ.text: For the price, I was expecting a little more.  I had the rib-eye steak.  It was okay...   maybe for the price.. .I was expecting it to be amazing, but it wasn't.  Mine was almost cooked right.  i asked for it medium rare, and it came a little more medium then I wanted.  Though... a lot of people in my party got their steaks over cooked.  Most of there's turned out medium instead of being medium rare.   The highlights for me were the sides.  the sides were more tasty then the rib eye steak.    They have private rooms that you can reserve.  We happened to reserve one for our group.  You can still see out of the room through the glass windows.  Service felt a little slow, I felt like the waiters forgot about us since we were in the private room.

_n5eAl8oRM0KudsD0UvFwg.text: UGH so disappointed!!!!  For the price of this place, I definitely expected wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy more.    I liked the lounge, so that place I'll probably go to again.  But I will never ever have dinner here again (unless you comped it and everything was absolutely free).  I've never seen a place charge a per person fee for splitting a meal.  (Though when the meal came out, it was portioned out for each person so I guess that was OK.  But still).  It's kind of like a Ruth's Chris, but more stuffier and less comfortable.  I kinda felt like our server was wondering wtf we were doing there since we didn't look like everyone else.  Geez.  Open up the menus and WOW.  Can you say sticker shock?  I was expecting pricey but cmon.  So with that being said, the food better match up to the cost of it.    My BF and I split the ribeye and ordered 2 sides to go with it, the onion straw things and creamed spinach with truffle oil.  Good, but the truffle oil definitely over powered the dish and it was all I could taste.  The onion straws were done just right, and provided a good contrast for the creamed spinach.  But my steak was cooked completely wrong.  I asked for medium rare.  Not well done on the exterior and raw on the interior.  That's why this place is uber dark.  So you can't look at the color of your steak and send it back for them cooking it wrong and trying to trick you into thinking your tastebuds are wrong.  Ever since then I've been cooking my own ribeyes to make up for the horrible experience.  I'm going back to Ruth's Chris.

Rh9Ky_8KJL5xbxOCPohDnA.text: This was my last night of my birthday weekend. I wanted to go somewhere nice. I heard about their chocolate cake and had to have a piece. My son and I were seated at a booth type seat. Not my favorite seating. A girl next to us was drunk and was very annoying. Not the restaurants fault. The waiter was very polite and sophisticated. We each had a very nice cocktail. We both ordered the special, surf and turf. It consisted of a 6 oz. filet and a 1 lb. lobster tail.  We had the pureed potatoes as our side order. It was presented beautifully. They also served drawn butter and their special steak sauce. The steak was cooked to perfection. The lobster was laid out beautifully on the plate. It also was cooked perfectly. We decided to take the cake to go. One piece is enough to serve 4-5 people. I was a little disappointed in the cake. It was to rich. Overall it was outstanding. It's not cheap, that's for sure. But if you are celebrating a special day I would suggest them highly.

lft4cYtN6YxbOWQBEW3k6A.text: Everything was great--except the steaks on the night I was there.  Waiter/service was great; bread was great; appetizer was great.  However, I had bone in filet--kind of tough.  My wife ordered her steak medium rare, but it was more like medium well and was kind of tough also.

jiupS9Lkvj9XcXGu2xEksQ.text: Everything was great, we had apps, steaks, salmon (my wife says it was the best she's ever had), sides, even the garlic french fries were amazing. My favorite was the crab topping (on the steak) with the bleu cheese sauce. Can't wait to go back.  We did spend $400 though... without dessert.

erU5s6TxZ2i1A3uoocavpA.text: Went for a "fancy" dinner while on our honeymoon. Pricey but absolutely delicious, and we had a spectacular waiter who truly added to the experience. Had the calamari for an appetizer which was probably the best we'd ever eaten. Perfectly seasoned. Entrees were perfectly cooked, side dishes were great. All around made for a wonderful night.

ejejfGV6DlxtNvGkQiDVmA.text: As a steak house, not impressed.  When the sides are better than the main course it should tell you something. I ordered the special Hanger steak, not good. It had a coffee rub. Pretty much tasted like burnt coffee on a steak. The potatoes romanoff was really good. Mac and cheese not bad. Vary expensive though for the quality of food that you get. Typical Las Vegas strip restaurant

PzR9DaXZS5XNFRP28NhIMQ.text: Excellent service! Started with the lobster bisque. For my entre, the filet and lobster with a side of the potatoes romanoff. I wish I could remember the martini the waiter recommemded because it was good. Priced about the same as every other Vegas steakhouse....but come here for the quality and service. Had dinner before watching PeepShow (very convenient, next to the theater).

mw3n1dpF7mamTJFsbjxMwQ.text: My first night in Las Vegas last week started at the Strip House Steak House. Mark helped us at the bar and was great, my dirty martini was excellent. We had a party of 22, so we had a pre-fixe dinner.  I started with the caprese salad with buffalo mozzarella and then moved to the iceberg lettuce salad with crumbled bacon. Both were equally good. The 10 oz. filet mignon was good, not outstanding, but it was fairly good. I certainly didn't need all 10 ounces. However, the mashed potatoes were outstanding.  We ended the night with the Strip House chocolate cake with 24 layers of chocolate. This huge piece of cake was a bit difficult to split with coworkers - it would have been easier to split with friends. However, it was delicious and paired nicely with the red wine I was finishing.

7y8Rrj7K1NTGZI91inYxYA.text: As I always do at every steakhouse, is start with the lobster bisque.  Broth was awesome! But no lobster! And had some sort of pasta textured tiny balls in it! Lose that, and put some lobster in it, and it would be great!!! Had the 8oz filet oscar, cooked to perfection! Great service!

PxSLPA7BNEvQuMWDanlGKw.text: Unbelievable. John was an excellent server. You could jot ask more from him.  Always attentive and helpful.  Prosciutto appetizer had great flavors from the salty to the power of both goat cheese and balsamic. Followed by the most tender bone - in filet with a special cheese and sause that you cut with a knife. Overall, it was the best experience I have had in a while.

nKO4wbtesbIm2fv6iOmMgw.text: Had Thanksgiving here but ordered from the standard menu. Service is excellent. Food was good. But it didn't wow me. Actually found the appetizers and side dishes to be better than my steak.  Crab cake-excellent Scallops-fresh and cooked just right.  22oz. Ribeye-cooked medium-was rather chewy and a considerable amount of gristle. Not sure what i was expecting but i've made a few steaks at home that were much better....  Duck fat potato-very good! mushrooms-pretty blah  Friend had the 16oz ny steak. he was quite pleased.  Pretty pricey dinner and it just didn't seem to blow my mind considering the cost. i did leave with a food coma-hence the three stars.

fyyKzX_CwtuiSK2FeV-iUw.text: It's like a classic steakhouse and an upscale strip club got together and had a baby....minus the naked people.  Well, that's not entirely True.  Look reallllly carefully at the design on your napkins.  :)  I was here with a big group and we got one of the private rooms.  The servers were bend-over-backwards accommodating and the food was divine.  Really delicious steak and solid sides.  It's been a few months, but I seem to remember a soup amuse bouche that was phenomenal.  If you're in the mood for steak and want a fun experience to boot, I highly recommend StripSteak.

Ab54Frv3hQW8Y2ri90nXhw.text: My fiance and I came to Strip House Las Vegas for a romantic dinner and had a great time!! Service was perfect, and food was AMAZING!!! Best creamed spinach in the world!!

11BWIZukWSd6ZzFNgm5PVg.text: I have been here a number of times. I love sitting at the bar when Mark or Mallory are working.  They are amazing.  However, tonight when my dinner was brought to me, I was greeted by Daniel delivering my food. He was so attentive in the detail and made all the difference in my meal.  Thanks to Daniel I will be back many more times.

3ICRCpQ_eSHkHata5na-sQ.text: Can I say WOW! If you are a big fan of steaks and has the wallet to put out for it. This is definitely the place to eat.  The bone-on rib-eye was my choice.  I wasn't really too hungry, but once I had one bite, I was amazed on how perfectly cooked/juicy this was. I just had to finish it. I had it with deep-fried onions and wild sauteed mushrooms. I think it was the right sides for the steak. Definitely a must if you are a steak fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 oz. Ribeye!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops for Appetizer

ZbAnPtmcZmkTU-opYVidEQ.text: I'm going to keep this one pretty short.  The restaurant is very lavish in a dark red intimate setting and conveniently located in the Planet Hollywood hotel/casino.  Service was really good and the food was excellent.  I recommend the filet mignon or the new york steak.  This place reminds me of Donovan's but a little more expensive (I wouldn't say this place was any better or worse though).  Overall, I was satisfied with both the meal and service.

atrhOZOD84flXfhbZ0XKtw.text: Tried to like it. Steak was way too salty. They tried to fix it, but the next steak came out way over done. Chocolate cake looked good.

pHyTF4ZT2qBNS4YR_fY1zA.text: John the waiter was great and the food was to die for rib eye and the salmon. Make sure to have the cake

d8lCzk9mtEH6b5QidjWing.text: I got to experience the Strip House for the first time this past week while at the SEMA show in Las Vegas.  The restaurant was quaint and dimly lit and well suited for a rambunctious group.  Limited seating and an ample wait staff made the evenings service flow quite well.  Groups gathered at large round tops while couples ca noodled in overstuffed booths along the walls.  The food was impeccable and there wine list was complete while still showing some great hidden finds (try the Flora Springs Trilogy!).  The front part of the restaurant housed a large bar, but we never had to wait, the new Planet Hollywood Casino (formerly The Aladdin) seemed to be somewhat quiet making for a good chance for seating here without a reservation.

3DsD-rue0AsoKd-g8ws86Q.text: I arrived in Vegas early so I decided to go out and treat myself to a good meal. I was staying across at the Vdara, but PH is my favorite place to hang out. So when I saw there was a steak house, why not? I love steak. I was seated first at the bar, my first impression was this was definitely a high class place, you can just tell by looking around, plus it's in a casino/resort in Vegas, it has to be right.  The bartender was super friendly, we talked for a while and since I was alone, the company was nice. It's always a good thing when the bartender talks to you because that means he cares about his job and his customers, which is why I left a fat tip at the end.  I ordered the steak and asparagus. It was amazing! The steak was cooked just the way I liked it.. medium rare, and the asparagus was fresh and tasted great. I was super satisfied when I was done with my meal, couldn't been happier.   This is a great place to enjoy a good steak, even though price is a little steep, you get what you pay for, it's vegas! Can't ball on a budget. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a good meal.

plyrYG04IB7WYaVEu0o6vg.text: Food was incredible, drinks were incredible, our server Scott was incredible. Overall great experience - very glad we found this place!!

l05klWDwdI7hsB7am775oQ.text: Somehow despite being the only one to order my steak rare (every one else ordered medium rare or medium) my steak came out the most cooked (medium). They were very nice about remaking it but its always frustrating because the timing is off with the rest of the group. They overcompensated with a really raw piece but I didn't want to send it back. My table really enjoyed their steak and sides but I wasn't crazy about their salt and pepper crust. It came with a whole clove of roasted garlic which was nice. Everything just seemed a little off to me. The sides were fine but the texture of the potatoes seemed a little gluey and the broccoli with miso butter didn't really taste like miso butter. It was also chopped into giant chunks of broccoli so we had to cut up and share pieces which was odd. For dessert, the brownie with ice cream and a chocolate sauce was very rich and tasty but the top of the brownie was so hard we were struggling to break the brownie. I don't really get the 5 star ratings, for the price I had higher expectations.

S4TxSPThOcd8zzD6UGrbOg.text: If you are going to dine at this restaurant there are two things you must do: first you must get the chocolate cake as it is phenomenal.  Second, you need to request Carlos as your server, he brings a big smile and is one of the best servers you will ever have!

LTNGyKqHs90t0gbYev2msQ.text: A great place for a great dinner! The costumer service was outstanding. While being seated they asked if we were attending a nearby concert which we were and assured us that our food would be put in in a timely manner for us to enjoy our meal and still make it to our event. Which it was with plenty of time to eat without feeling rushed. The filet mignon was seasoned well although it was slightly overcooked and a bit dry. We ordered fries as a side and they were cooked to perfection. While the decor is not family friendly it is done very tastefully and I don't believe would be of putting to people who are less comfortable with nudity. I would highly recommend eating here if you don't mind paying a higher price for a good steakhouse.

4Dpt43j-PZROWpmE4bzqqg.text: Strip House Steak is nothing short of life reaffirming beef. I had a late dinner Friday night at the bar, and enjoyed every bite of my meal.   Mark, the bartender, was extremely jovial, entertaining, and offered an exceptionally high level of service. I began my meal with the scallops. The order came with two large scallops over a buttery froth with some grains and soybeans. Every bite was perfect, the slimy texture of the scallops was complemented by the crunch of the beans, and the heartiness of the grains.   Next I had their version of a wedge salad with blue cheese dressing. It was delicious, a whole chunk of wedge covered with shaved red onions, chopped bacon, and a creamy Stilton cheese dressing. It was one of the best takes on a classic steakhouse wedge salad that I have ever had.   Lastly, I had the 12 ounce filet mignon cooked rare plus. This was the crowning jewel of the meal. The steak was thick and heavily crusted with the perfect amount of salt, and black pepper before being seared at what I can only imagine was an extremely high temperature. The steak shredded with only a fork, and melted in my mouth with an exquisite texture. To accompany the steak there was a roasted garlic clove, which combined in sparing quantities with each bite of steak added an extra dimension of flavor.   Overall, Strip House Steak is somewhat of a hidden gem for being right on the vegas strip. I found it to be a little bit more reasonably priced than some of the better known alternatives, and every bit as good.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops (after I had already eaten one)

fxHzcJuNKiIjfrcXIBIZrw.text: The food was great and service was ok but came to desert & found hair in the ice cream waitress was nice and kind about it but i saw her show the manager who looked at it and walked past us like it wasn't a big deal... absolutely disgusting and ridiculous never ever going back at least a little sincerity would be kind you are in charge of the damn place the waitress was more professional

BwmoAiZqlhaHGahZeaENSw.text: Let me first say this, you will not be disappointed!  The ambiance is perfect with the lighting and choice of color and decor..  We had the pleasure of meeting Scott who was outstanding!  Scott welcomed us and immediately engaged in conversation and assured us he would take care of us for the evening.  Scott went over the menu and the specials for the evening as well as his recommendations.   The goat cheese prosciutto rolls were amazing!  The dry aged rib eye was cooked to perfection.. a nice charred exterior while maintaining a medium rare throughout every bite.  The salmon prepared medium was spot on.  As Scott promised we would not be disappointed with the truffle cream spinach as well as the whipped potato puree... delicious!!   If ever given the chance to dine here..  do not pass on it!  The entire staff is amazing!!  If you are fortunate maybe Scott will be there to make it a great experience for you as well.

qnVQyZbRCtTH0Q2geQallw.text: I am so happy our other reservations didn't work out because it led our party here and this dinner was nothing less than incredible!! Our server was probably the most impressive out of all the food and drinks - he was so on it, knew everything that was in the food, how it was prepared, gave amazing recommendations without giving you the most expensive items on the menu, and lastly, had the entire wine list memorized down pat and gave us a wine recommendation since we drink wine rarely. We ordered the New York strip, filet, black truffle creamed spinach and whipped mashed potatoes. Everything was 10/10. We didn't have room for dessert, but wish we had! Thank you for an amazing experience, we will definitely be back when we return to Las Vegas!

zoLAgafiI3xlyWgq2GDiMw.text: We had an excellent experience here! Our waiter was absolutely amazing. We ordered the porterhouse for two. The steak was prepared exactly as I asked at a perfect medium-rare. It was juicy, delicious, and had a perfect sear on the outside that every stake should have. The whipped potatoes were amazing! Will come back next time we are in Vegas. Highly recommend!

SnqQTWXmchNWzJDDun-O-Q.text: Took my grandson here for his 21st birthday before Brittany concert.  I saw the various reviews so was pleasantly surprised to get a waiter, Daniel, who really knew how to make the dinner special.  Andrew ordered the filet which he described as the best steak he had ever eaten.  I had the bone in ribeye.  The pepper crust preparation and the quality of the beef made this the best I've had and I'm a pro on this cut.  Next time in Vegas I'll bring the entire family.

VH8VouHmueyxbDWLS8ZdSQ.text: I don't understand how this only had 4 stars.  From Lynn who helped us with the reservation, to our waiter John, who was knowledgeable & friendly, it all made for a memorable experience.  Our filets, and lobster were perfect and the baked Alaska and choclate cake topped off a wonderful evening.  Definitely go and check them out!!!  Kudos and thanks!!!

qQBIepUZJVlaCSB1s5_NHA.text: Received a call from the manager about the issue. I will say that he handled the situation very well and offered to take care of us personally whenever my wife and I make it back to Vegas. Very respectable management in my opinion.

NtSwBmJcPo0tYaD_SFyirg.text: Best Steakhouse! Bone - in Ribeye was cooked perfectly and was definitely took center stage. The Romanoff potatoes were very flavorful and could be considered a main dish.  Our serve Chris provided excellent and friendly service.

kFZOIzOcKOeVNVdrGVlyHQ.text: Our first time here & WOW the FOOD is Amazing! Thank you to everyone working here, especially Carlos our head waiter who made my daughter's 21st bday celebration a success! And also a big Thank You to the chef for the incredible dinner!

zJc3XLp3MqVPPa9fleYDtw.text: The service here was good, our server was very friendly.  We got the two person steak and it was cut very professionally by the manager in a suit.  Great ambiance and environment.  I was a bit turned off when we arrived early for our reservation that they made us wait almost 10 minutes even though the restaurant was not full and there was clearly open seating.   I'm giving it 3 stars because we took some food home with us and after I ate it, it immediately killed my stomach.

D1ROt4mBUy5jdfIS1CafXg.text: Food was really really good.  We ordered some wine & it was very good for a reasonable price, especially considering you are dining at at a Las Vegas Casino.    The steak was absolutely great... Salty char crust! Perfectly done.  I would go back if only for the tasty steak.  Scallops were also beautifully cooked & tasty. So the truth is the food was really 5 star & the service was the unfortunate part.   Our waitress was not someone who I would request or want again.  She was not attentive at all, the drinks did not arrive for more than 15 minutes.  I am happy that I did not notice her name.  Were it not for her this would be a 5 star review.

QDGgYcXtU8JJwgPZ8IBv8Q.text: Being a native New Yorker and having the ability to travel for work  I am fortunate enough to experience fine dining on many different levels.  One of my favorite places to eat when home is the Strip House downtown.  I love the decor and the illusion of stepping back in time with the velvet walls and vintage photos  I did not want to ruin that experience by experimenting with Strip House Las Vegas.    We decided to gamble and give it try in the hopes that it would not be an over the top glitzy Vegas version of a place we love so much. On first approach, I could see flat screen TV and my heart sank.  I was pleased to see that they were just in the bar area and not viewable from the dining area.  Our hostess was very gracious, asked us where we were from, made pleasant small talk and sat us at a booth.    We were greeted by our server John.  It was obvious that he has been in the service industry for many years because he was courtesy and knowledgeable not only of the menu but had committed the specials to memory.   He described each dish with his own personal experience and interpretation of what the chef was attempting to do.  John had suggested a bottle of wine which I would not usually lean towards...but the gamble was paying off already so we went with it and it was an excellent choice.  I usually don't order the specials because I am very particular about what I want and go to the places where I know it would be perfect.  In this case, John had beautifully described a bone in Filet Mignon with parmesan crust sitting atop a balsamic reduction.  The steak arrived and it was cooked to perfection and as complex and delicious as he had described.    During the meal the manager came to the table and we explained that our dining experience to that point had been excellent because of the attention to detail and prompt service of the wait staff especially our server.    John suggested and provided at the end of the meal a banana and caramel dessert which was not something I would order but proved to be outstanding.    All in all our beloved NYC Strip House experience will be enhanced knowing that each time we travel to Vegas there is a home away from home with the same quality of service and five star dining.  Well done Vegas............NYC should be proud!

ceU0jWNWQMBSVB_-VRcRjQ.text: What a great dining experience, enjoyed the decor & atmosphere, attentive awesome wait staff, we got the porterhouse for 2 it was the most delicious unbelievable steak I've had in a long time!  You won't be disappointed!

944wKUUUOuIwBr_n9T_fIQ.text: I mean texas steakhouses you get more for your buck but with the exception of prices the food was just ok, I would recommend it to a friend the service was good seemed under staffed but I have no complaints , my girls are picky and the servers got it right

JGOwqBagSKURzvgrRkYDhg.text: Ok my son saw a show on TV where they went through the process of making a 24 layer cake. My son is a 'Foodie' in the making. As we were driving through Vegas, he saw the 'Strip House' Sing in Vegas and was very excited. Letting me know that this was in fact the place that served this decadent dessert! He is a pretty amazing young man, with his Sudent Pilots license, NCO in Civil Air Patrol, on the Nevada Wresting Team, high School Football Team and a National Judo competitor...So he deserved a treat (even @ $17/slice)   I called ahead and let them know we wanted to just have dessert. The person on the phone said no problem and it wasn't busy, so no need to Reserve a table. It is located in the Planet Hollywood Casino so parking was a bit rough. The casino was flat out Packed. I mean really packed. The Restaurant is located up stairs toward the LV strip.   As we entered, we were greeted nicely. There were only a few tables with patrons, it is a really large dinning room. We were sat immediately and I took the time to peruse the drinks menu as well as the dinner and dessert menu. Like any top end Steak House in Vegas, the prices were $$$. The server was very nice and attentive. The menu was huge. I think I included about 30 pictures just of the menus. Drink menus, wine menus, scotch menu, whiskey menu, Food menu,  That being said, here is what we ordered:  2x Crisp Goose fat potatoes 2x Striphouse chocolate cake  As soon as we ordered, we were brought a bread basket. There were 3-4 types of bread and soft butter in a small ramekin. The bread was really good. The kids loved the gluten free bread, so the waiter brought more. The goose fat tater, it was really good also. I thought it was fries, but it was more like a large fritter/tater tot. Delicious for sure.  Next we had the 24 layer chocolate cake. It was huge. I think the guy said each slice was around 2 pounds. My first thought was we really only should've ordered one piece. Even with this many people. The cake is filled with a chocolate custard, and then a decadent chocolate ganache frosting. And though I was reeling at the price of the two orders of potatoes costing $24, the $17 per slice cake, it take was worth every bit of it. It is hands-down the best chocolate cake I've had...Ever. And after 60 countries, I have had a lot of chocolate cake. since we had had dinner earlier, and weren't there just for dessert, we ended up taking quite a bit of the cake back to our RV.   I will definitely try this again. I cannot say that I would go so far as to spend 60 or $70 for a steak dinner. The time for eating like that ended when I had five children. But the cake, we will be back for. Or who knows, we may actually visit the original one in New York.

lXTS9DGA1wPRAnc1IXGvew.text: The decor in this place reminds me of an old Italian feel--red velvet type wallpaper, pictures of 1920's--1930's burlesque models, dim lighting, God-father like feel.  They are apparently known for their salt and pepper crusted steaks--which was FABULOUS!! (We had filet Mignon)...additionally, we had their pan-seared scallops with Eda-mame corn succotash, Caesar Salad, and Hatch Chili Mashed Potatoes....AMAZING!!  Our server, Brian, was attentive and informative. He kept our wine glasses filled and kept us abreast of the status of our food.

qIOt_T-_lyzqNW1HuSYs1A.text: Sizzler...,with boobs  That's all this is.  Went here looking for a great steakhouse....ambiance was great, bar was great- food was straight up sizzler- tough, over seasoned and service was raw  Keep looking  Only thing "strip" was vintage pics of old white hookers on wall  Meh

1w7m2sm9p2PEBvu1Lv2zMw.text: We came here late night before closing. The whole place is very dark, a little too red and dark for having a meal in my opinion. The crab cake was really good but I was not a fan of the dressing: so spicy!! The tuna tartare was good, tasted like it had no seasoning and I personally like that however I assume the majority won't. The Caesar salad was not good, no fresh crispy lettuce and poor presentation. We did not eat it and they were kind enough to take it off the check. Drinks were delicious and I was good with one as it was large and strong. Not a bad restaurant, but I'm underwhelmed especially for this price range.

vD4h-3xaN0KbAAUY6J-AnQ.text: Wow- amazing!!!! Sean was attentive and made sure I was taken care of even though I was seated at the bar and most of the restaurant was made of mostly men.  I ordered 2 appetizers my meal but it was more than enough. I did not have a reservation but they got me in right away. Definitely choose this as one of your stops on the strip for a place to eat!! Right above the gaming floor and an amazing menu!!  Food was great along with service.  This was my second time here and they did not disappoint.  Thank you for a great meal!!!

XNBuClMYq8VaPVZwBmdWuQ.text: So glad we found this place only because we were going to the Rob Thomas concert (he was actually having dinner there while we were dining). Fantastic food (other than poor choice of appetizers), the steaks came out cooked perfectly and the service was very good. They also have extensive wine list, try some of their Italian reds you will not be disappointed.

bmsJ-D_Nc7fWokY6wJTA0g.text: This is the perfect Vegas steakhouse: from the handsome, bordello-like decor, to the crooner-centric playlist, to the impeccable service, pristine table settings, and the perfectly-seared steaks,this place is an oasis of old school cool in a increasingly trendy-centric Las Vegas. It is all created ambiance, so technically it's a themed concept, but it does it to perfection and makes for a memorable and enjoyable meal.   Now to get to the meat of things, pun intended: the wedge salad with blue cheese dressing and crumbles, red onions and bacon was perfect and is a splendid way of waking up your appetite for the umami-ness to come. The New York strip was done to perfection with a delicious mahogany, salty crust given way to a red center, just as ordered. As a special, they had this wonderful hash brown fritter, the size of a baseball, that was crispy and crunchy on the outside with a soft warm interior. The scallop dish was exceptionally prepared, although I could have done with an extra scallop or two. The wine list is extensive, and their by-the- glass selection is diner friendly.  We had a lovely Malbec that complimented our meal well.   This is a great dinner place amidst the sea of places that are way too cheap or way too expensive.

Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip

W9Pk-ffL2sZctXCEa96ioA.text: Situated on the second floor of Planet Hollywood next to the Criss Angel Theatre, I came here for dinner prior to a show (NO, not Angel!).  I was seated after being asked if I wanted to be in the main dining room or the bar/lounge area.  I chose the main dining room and I was shown to a semi-circular booth in the rear with a great view of the restaurant and my back away from the door (thank you Wild Bill Hickok).  I was quickly asked about water/drinks and I was brought an iced tea.  They only serve Republic of Tea in bottles.  I was then brought a small bread basket with two pretzel rolls and two other rolls and a small dish of butter.  Checking on the size of starters--most meant for sharing--I opted for lobster bisque for a starter and I ordered the 14 ounce dry-aged ribeye with a topping of seared foie gras.  The server asked me if I wanted salt and pepper on the steak and I said yes.  After a while, a runner came to the table with a boat shaped bowl and poured the bisque into the bowl.  The lobster bisque was good but it only had a few, very small pieces of lobster.  I also had the runner add some freshly ground pepper to the bisque.  There was time in between courses which was perfect.  I was brought the steak and fries.  The steak was tender and flavorful and I liked the salt and pepper topping.  It was done a bit too much--more than the blue I had ordered.  The foie gras was excellent--the best part of the steak dish.  The fries were also good but they didn't have a garlic/herb flavor at all.  It was a large amount of food and I didn't finish the fries--opting for dessert instead of mere fries.  My server brought the dessert and after dinner drink menu and he mentioned a few things.  He also told me his favorite was the deconstructed Snickers bar.  I decided to taker his recommendation and ordered that.  It consists of a thin layer of chocolate cake with three small scoops of ice cream--vanilla, chocolate, and dulce de leche, candied peanuts, nougat, and caramel.  It was very good and a fitting end to the meal.  Service was very good with attention to paroling the table for empty sweetener packets et. al.  The room is done in red and lots of wood.  The walls are covered with photos of exotic dancers.  Quiet when I first arrived at 5:15, it was almost full when I left.  Definite Strip pricing for an OK meal.

0T8d0YtgizJyDjSi3EHpqA.text: Pleasantly surprised by the service and food quality at the Strip House.... we've tried many steak houses back home and in Vegas and this one by far is going to the top of the list! We will definitely be back!

6g7K2i9Qxl-0SFfZ31ljEw.text: Had a pleasant dinner date with a girlfriend the other night.. we had a reservation at 5:30; arrived just shy of 5:20 and we were seated riiiiight away.   Strip House is easily located on the second floor of the Planet Hollywood Casino And Hotel. It's neighbors is the CrissAngel Theater (to the right) and Koi Seafood Restaurant (to the left). I think this place is a little to dark for my dining experience, I wish it was brighter and more well-lit, but I guess that's just setting the mood. The decor and ambiance itself is not so fancy, but still considered casual fine dining. You don't need to be suited and booted, but don't come in dressing like a bum either.   Our server, Kate was cool. She provided us with off the menu recommendations and was totally chill with the fact that my gf and I were going to share a steak and sides.   We tried the 14oz NY Strip; cooked medium. Man, this steak was cooked beyond perfectly with a salt&pep seared too, and a juicy beautiful pink center! At $50+ for this 14oz, I'd say it's perfect to share between two people, easily.   Our side, was fantastic! The black truffle cream of spinach is soooooo creamy and that truffle after taste- brings a huge smile to my face. I would highly recommend this side dish. ($15).  So glad I was finally able to try this place. A decent steakhouse located in one of my favorite hotels. Check it out!

Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip Medium
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black truffle cream of spinach ($15)

_hx_6FzJzxb8zfdMVM7zAw.text: Located on the mezzanine level, 1 level above the casino in Planet Hollywood lies Strip House. It was hard to tell if it was one of those fancy steakhouses because it was dark and candle lit romantic ambiance but the floor made it less "stuffy" and the music and artwork all around. It is white table cloth and there is a bar and they have various specials. We ordered the Bone In 20oz NY Strip and the Bone In 20oz Ribeye. Both almost $60 each. The seasoning and the crust of the NY Strip was really well cooked. The RibEye has high flavors in oil and seasoning as well. Service was efficient for the most part. They recommend that the sides are good for sharing from 2-4 people. We had the $12 Mac n cheese. In my opinion, the Mac n cheese side is more so for one person, maybe two if I was nice to share.

r0Yd2ebib8gr8E9zoPhD8A.text: My husband and I brought our daughter here on a Friday night. It was very busy and service was more slow than acceptable. The staff was great when we saw them though.  I ordered a Caesar Salad, 8 oz Filet and a side of Brussel Sprouts. Everything was nicely prepared and I was surprised when they brought out gluten free rolls.  They have a since selection of deserts and dessert drinks.

UI4zPUiiy4IxggeEUtMYYA.text: This is one of the best steakhouses in town. If you're going for the steak I would highly suggest sticking to their salt and pepper crust which lets the meat shine! The sides are all amazing! (try the goose fat potatoes) overall super pleased with the food. The service was ok. Our waiter made us feel a little rushed but overall took good care of us!

c0nAwnvZIuVhXwEvb2vm4g.text: Delicious!  I love this place because you can make reservations on Open Table and it's super easy.  We were running late for our reservation but we called and they saved us a spot.    The only downside to this place: It is TRICKY to find.  It is within the Planet Hollywood Hotel on the 2nd floor next to the Chriss Angel theater.  Nobody in the Planet Hollywood (or mall nearby) knew where on earth this place was -- which was FRUSTRATING and also why we were late!  This place is LEGIT.  Very fancy.  Fun "old Vegas" atmosphere.  Moody lighting.  Great date spot, although I didn't come for a date.  :D   Their steaks are HUGE and very well seasoned.  Their sides are equally HUGE but AMAZING.  Do not delay!  Don't miss out!  Add this to your list of "must visit" spots the next time you are in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUM!

hq6hAoEyHcN0KRXP9Rj3Kw.text: Thee BEST! Steak I have ever ate. I even kinda regret it because I know I'll never get anything like that where I live.  Also their Mac and cheese was amazing.

YdMIi0hAvJ_pLsJ9U3yjCQ.text: I can say enough about Strip House. I had a filet cooked to medium rare. It was spot on perfect. The table shared the asparagus and some mashed potatoes. Everything was amazing including the appetizer bread.  Now what topped the meal off was the dessert. We shared the 24 layer chocolate cake and the sherbet with fresh fruit. Absolutely amazing on both.

SlsxuN6SFbYoz-B3KF2dEQ.text: Super cute treasure.   Felt all fancy dining in the private wine room, feeling the elegance from the minute we walked in.   Apps..lobster bisque and strip house bacon. Lets talk about mouth watering. The bacon was the best thing Ive honestly had in awhile. I am a bacon lover too!! My son loved it so much we did fight over the last peice ha.   Seafood platter was amazing. I got the half order and it was still SO much food,  i cant even imagine what the full platter is like.   Porterhouse was HUGE, bone in and so much meat. Love the way it was presented. They let you see the whole peice then cut it up table side.    24 layer cake?! Yes, it was bigger than my sons head, but he went to town on it :)  Only thing is the restaurant is somewhat hidden upstairs away from the flow of the casino so foot traffic isnt very high. Great plave tho so check them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JAv2RGy209NhVlt3jLD0JQ.text: This exquisite classic gem is filled with nostalgia, class and mood. Upon arriving, it is liken to time travel...to another era. The staff all demonstrated a passion for service and kindness. From the waiting team to the proprietors, they exude class and refinement. Courteous, very attentive, genuinely friendly and experts in their field. The deco is artistic, chic, charming and daring at the same time! The atmosphere is warm and inviting with a very distinct ambiance. Whilst experiencing a delight to so many senses, the pallet becomes eager to partake of a delectable creation. And the chef does not disappoint, in fact he dares you not to be dazzled by his masterpiece. The Filet Mignon is prepared to perfection, the Salmon is beyond sumptuous and all  d'accompagnements just amazed and beguiled. If you desire unlimited decadence and pleasure of epic proportions, this is the place to be. An establishment of excellence in cuisine, service and decor. Thank you Strip House!!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Salmon

Y_zbxObRZ5jPzw--ekvcmg.text: Absolutely on point in every way. I ordered the rack of lamb medium rare, and it was perfect. Tender, flavorful, and well-presented. My husband ordered the dry aged rib eye steak and it was pepper crusted and done just right. One side is enough to split for two people, and you don't get up charged for it, in fact, the waiter recommended it. Prices are not low, but the service, ambiance, and quality justifies this splurge. We're looking forward to spending another special occasion here!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior - it&#39;s on the second floor above the slot machines, by Criss Angel
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch cart options
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch cart

kaFWY47jxQuB-vQdFYAZFA.text: Can I give more than 5?! Had a reservation at 5 on Thursday so we could see a show that started at 7 so we were a little nervous. Wasn't an issue at all. The waiter said we'd be out by 645 and he was right!   Speaking of our waiter, he was fantastic! Amazing service with great knowledge of the menu. He treated us like we were his only table. The hostess, water server and manager were also amazing.  We had the half size seafood platter. Every single thing was delicious. They have sauces that compliment each thing and whatever sauce was on the salmon needs to be duplicated here at my house.   Hubby and I had the dry aged ribeye, a side of scallops and the best potatoes au gratin. We also tried the mushrooms and asparagus. My steak was supposed to be medium rare but it came out closer to a medium, but the manager quickly made it right. Dessert was also in the plans. 24 layer chocolate cake and a deconstructed Snickers for the win.   It's definitely on the pricey side, but it's worth every penny. Take the money you were going to waste in the slots and go here instead.
