5fyBPRWLAPMwNoFtnob9Tw.text: I would totally give this place 5 stars if it weren't for the terrible service when we first arrived.  We'd made a 7:30pm reservation for my birthday before the Backstreet Boys concert.  Upon arrival we were told they were just prepping our table and it would be a few minutes because they were running behind.  They offered bar seating while we waited but there wasn't room,  however a high top table was.  We ordered our drinks and after 15 minutes of waiting the gal came back and said it would be another 5-10 minutes because the table still wasn't ready.  We explained we had a concert to get to so time was critical.  After 5 minutes they sat us at a table that had been prepared and vacant the entire time we were there.  It was clear we'd been lied to and I was not happy!  Luckily enough our waiter Ricky was top notch,  the food was fantastic and the service was unbeatable.  I had the  shrimp cocktail and a ribeye both were A+!  They then brought me the best birthday cake ever and we still made the concert just as the band took the stage.  All in all it was fantastic,  but I'm still under impressed with the hostess!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M0HWlRKR2TsaXeLJaNHfqQ.text: It was a perfect evening, the hostess walked us to a comfy corner booth. Our server Carlos was so friendly and attentive.  Food was absolutely mouth watering. The charred pepper steak was delicious. Thier cosmo was also super tasty. I loved the decor! dark with romantic candlelight. At the end of an amazing meal our server brought me a piece of chocolate fudge cake for my birthday. Yum! I definitely enjoyed every aspect of my night,  can't wait to return.

Oc397S3ErOEzZ1sxU8YdsQ.text: Top notch classic drinks and first rate service. Atmosphere fantastic. Split NY and 3 great sides. Potatoes with green chilies great - wedge just ok. Steak was Delish.  This is worth going to even with all the steak house options in Vegas

27uW4WTZ7sfstb07pm8wEA.text: Great environment and the food was amazing. I go to. Head a few times a year and I'm literally mad that I haven't been here before. Italian chop salad and filet is a must! Daniel was our server and he was amazing, top service possible!

MQSNrzYEdMvofWhfZZrZTw.text: First, the atmosphere is very nice.  The service and food were a different experience.  I have been to a lot of steak houses, from very expensive to the chains, and expected much better.  Our group of 6 arrived at 6pm with not many people in the restaurant.  Drink order was taken quick and the food order was shortly there after, but it took 45 minutes to get our dinner.  No special food order and as I said the place was not busy.  I asked the manager, or person in charge, if 45 minutes was a standard wait and he replied - "one of our guest ordered their steak well done so that is what it is".  The response sounded crazy, but it was also delivered with a I really don't care attitude.  The steaks were marginal at best and had to send back the "charred broccoli".  Our bill for two came out to be around $185 - not worth it.  With all the options in Vegas, this place should have done better.  Will not be back.

5ox65bl0v-zjVxRFu0WO1g.text: This is my top two restaurants in Vegas next to NoBu. Their calamari is super bomb. I always get the usual filet mignon is one of the best Ive ever had. The restaurant itself is super nice and red all over. The service was pretty good. Server was nice and respectful. Definitely recommend if looking for a great steak place.

xOEMN5OshT4mzeM-Axmxhw.text: Saw all the positive reviews and wanted to give this place a try for my friend's birthday. Huge disappointment. I've been to plenty of steakhouses to be able to compare and this place did not hit the mark. My boyfriend and I both offered the bone in ribeye, medium rare and it came out almost medium. There was a good crust on the outside but the inside was not as we ordered. Maybe it was an off night. Don't think we will be trying this again.

oX3-gszdQBrH90QyCFYbqA.text: An absolutely excellent meal. From the service, to the ambiance, to the food...everything was top notch!   We went here for Christmas dinner this past December. It's our new Xmas tradition to go out to a fancy dinner just the 2 of us on Christmas night. I was a little worried when we first arrived, as the hostesses seemed very LA-hostessish, and the decor was very red and very dark. Although the hostesses looked LA, they were very pleasant. When dining outside of Los Angeles, I find the service experience to be so much more tolerable and deeply rooted in customer service. The waiter and the bus boy for our table were both outstanding. Attentive, friendly, and on top of everything.  The food was some of our favorite food in Las Vegas so far. Everything was decadent and delicious.   Everything we got was a highlight, hopefully there's enough room to write about everything!   The drink I got was so different and tasty! I got a chocolate martini, but instead of vodka or gin, it was made with Patron XO tequila that has a bit of a coffee flavor, but is definitely tequila. There is Godiva chocolate liquor in it, and the rim is covered in chocolate covered bacon crumbles. OH. EM. GEE. AMAZING! The bread basket that each table gets comes with some amazing breads, but the star of the basket to me were the pretzel bread rolls. It was like eating a big, plump, less greasy gourmet soft pretzel with butter. I could have eaten tons of them.   For our appetizers my husband got the Oysters which were spilt into East Coast and West Coast Oysters. He loved them and couldn't believe he was able to get such fresh seafood in the middle of the Las Vegas and all of its lack of bodies of water!  I got the Roasted Bacon, with arugala and russian dressing. Holy wow! I can't even put in to words how amazingly spectacularly delicious and rich that dish was. I just can't. All I can say is, if you even remotely like bacon...GET THIS APPETIZER!!  The steaks were cooked perfectly, and as tender as butter. We were very pleased.  We got the potatoes romanoff and garlic green beans on the side, and both were amazing as well.   We got a wonderful bananas foster tart for dessert. Although we were stuffed, we couldn't stop eating the dessert. Like everything else that night, it too, was amazing!   I highly recommend this steak house. I know there are a lot to choose from just on that block of the strip alone, but I promise you will not be disappointed if you choose this one for your next amazing Las Vegas meal!

l1hPtU2CClbd5FwTxfTCBg.text: Was not impressed we came there with a very large party and the food was nothing to write home about. My ny strip had too much pepper and way to much salt the side dishes were nothing special

LA4mE6ZQH-XEzhP-Ilic3Q.text: This review is for a reservation made on open table on a Saturday night. Right from the start, our waiter was extremely accommodating. I ordered the 14oz dry aged ribeye (reasonably priced) with a side of roasted brussel sprouts and black truffle creamed spinach. All three were incredible and came out after a reasonable wait time. Our desserts were comped by the restaurant after they heard we were celebrating an anniversary. Even if I wasn't staying at Planet Hollywood, I'd definitely return again.

bsqRAEFE_SCmWNphf9v9Xw.text: Had dinner before a show we split a crab cake appetizer, 20oz steak and potatoes romanoff and the 2 of us could not finish it all! Great food Restaurant decor was sexy and modern Waiter was ok fast service but not personable

mfw1CwTFTEmvJ2nwe3nwjA.text: Excellent steak house. The food and service was perfect. I had a bone in filet mignon and it was to die for. i also had a dessert, maybe apple crostada and it was delicious. everything was made to a very high standard. would definetely come back. i had an ice tea in a bottle and it was delicious.

ru3oUdOBCyJgovG1pEpLQA.text: Awesome! The manager was super friendly asked us where we were from and informed us of the other restaurants in our area. He brought out a complimentary appetizer. Our waiter was awesome u just wish I remembered everyone's names. We had a hard time choosing between 2 different steak he recommended the boneless ribeye which was to die for. We loved our appetizers wine sides and dinner. We have been to just about every well known steak house and this was definitely the top of the list. Definitely coming back!

HWcBLuYvvSld4gHXReUj4w.text: First time at this restaurant.  Daniel did a great job at taking care of us, made sure we were well taken care off.  We will be back because of the service he provided, oh and that porterhouse too!

A5TpmdXJNQFgWiifBfE7Ig.text: I ate here twice in two days!  The first night I ordered the petit filet mignon and it was wonderful. So tender it melted in my mouth. We got sides of baked potato and creamed spinach and I got a Fat Tire Belgian beer. For desert I got the banana tart. All were very delicious. The second night I ordered the baked salmon a mixed green salad and had the warm brownie and a cappuccino for desert. Fantastic! The decor is elegant with beautiful black and white photos of past movie stars in the nude. How beautiful were those untampered, natural breasts!  The price, however is expensive so hopefully you can win enough at black-jack or craps to afford to eat there!

_qBZ6Woc1qr4qM_ixRAdgQ.text: Wanted some place in town that had baked alaskan. Picked this place.  Greeted immediately by host. Sat right away with reservation.   Server was very prompt and attentive.  Cool decor with lots of pictures on the walls.  Dark romantic atmosphere.  Good menu.  Wanted the bacon app but were saving room for dessert.  The table next to us got it and it looked amazing.  That will be one regret I will have to live with forever...get the bacon app.  Four huge slices of bacon.   Started with bread service witch was nothing special.  Go the dry aged ribeye.  Was amazing. One of the best pan sears I have ever had on a steak.  Crisp and seasoned, tail trimmed well, just perfect  Way better than other steaks I have paid way more for.    Delay with the sauces.  Got the steak first then was a waiting  for sauces and sides.  They brought out our sides, steak sauce and peppercorn sauce.  Both delicious. were missing the bearnaise.  Said the chef was making a fresh batch.  When the bearnaise came out it was perfect.  Fine diced tarragon instead of leafs.  Not too thick not too thin.   Sides, got the mushrooms-ok and the crispy duck fat potato- good.  Baked alaskan-ok meringue was good but ice cream was too hard and just a small slice of frozen cake on the bottom.

i4kIMkwVoIS0ZNv536X-6A.text: i take a trip to vegas with my besties every two year and we enjoy fine dining while we stay in vegas. amazing steak and sides. love this place and would come back again. i had a blessed time w my girls

Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rib eye w bone

64qBbRV4gX_ydDXscNhGMg.text: We were a bit disappointed that we were unable to get a reservation to Gordon Ramsey's so we settled for the Strip House.  As far as steakhouses go in Vegas, this place was really a lot better than I expected. We had reservations on Memorial Day around 5pm and there weren't many other people in the joint at that time, which made it feel very personal.    We ordered the scallops for an appetizer and they were cooked perfectly. I did not try any of the bread selections as I am gluten free but the pretzel looked very inviting.    For the meal, I had the aged Ribeye and sauteed mushrooms. My buddy had the 12oz Filet and steamed broccoli. The steaks were seasoned and cooked perfectly. The only real suggestion that I have for them would be to add creamed spinach, but that all depends on whether or not you enjoy it.   The service was great, they were always there to refill our waters and etc.   The price was a bit high  but then again it is Vegas and a up-scale steakhouse.    Overall I thought the place was very solid and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a steak in Planet Hollywood.

tWeET0XiP5pdFiv2ne5Csw.text: Ate here after searching for the place for some time. I am one of those man's man guys that is too stupid to figure out where something is before just randomly looking...and heaven forbid I ask anybody.  But I digress.  I ate here because of the cake...believe it or not.  Yeah the zillion layer chocolate cake was good and they had to amputate my legs from too much sugar yada yada yada.  If you go here for the cake then you miss the point.    The steak is amazing.  Other restaurants may be able to cook a steak perfectly like the Strip House, but they do not have the same seasoning.  It tasted like a salt/garlic blend of seasonings that enhanced the steak to a point that it was unlike any I have had.  I would be able to tell you more about the seasoning if I could have seen it in light...why is it so dark in here?  Decor and atmosphere reminded me of a place that is nice and dressy, but also a place where a major mob hit would have taken place.  That somehow appealed to me.  If you see some old guy in a nice suit in a dark corner then they are probably planning some point shaving scam or hasseling the teamsters.  But what am I saying?  Every corner in this place is dark...every inch of this place is dark.  Well worth the visit.  You will feel right at home if you just came out of the optometrist....good steak though.

4xB7UI0659xNgEZsxDQDoA.text: Had dinner here with the wife and her girlfriends.  Overall the food was excellent.  Kind of like ruth chris experience where everything is al a carte.  The only downer was damn super expensive.  Wife had 2 glasses of wine and I had a beer.  we split a 24oz ribeye(no sides come with)....bill 116 plus tip..ouch   But no complaints on quality or service.

lO1V7O7Gn-AU0-C2VS1qAQ.text: Found this place on Yelp, decided to give it a try. We were a bit wary at first because the place was pretty empty, but we decided to give it a try, and I'm glad we did.  Our waiter promptly greeted us and went over the menu.  We ordered a bottle of wine, which was kept chilled at our table, which was nice. My boyfriend and I ordered the porter house for 2, and a couple of sides. Our steak was cooked perfectly, and the truffle spinach was delicious! Had we had more room, we would have tried dessert, but we were stuffed! Prices are high, but it is a steak house, so that being said, prices are not out of line for the service and quality.

MQVROyt7M-UNXHEf9nDLnw.text: Beautiful restaurant with great food and amazing service.  Our server was Carlos and he was fantastic.  Near the end of our meal we complimented him for his serving skills and he told us it was his first day serving alone.  We were shocked he was a True pro and made our experience at the restaurant an unforgettable one.  We also complimented the manager Ken on the classiness and attentiveness of his staff, especially and he was friendly and grateful for the compliment and gave us some history on the restaurant which was a nice touch.  I highly recommend trying Strip house when u are in Las Vegas.   We found out they have one not far from home so we plan to check it out someday.

eo0o-onx4BWmemYq5gCuGA.text: Lindaaa :). She's awesome, everyone here is awesome. I just came back 2nd time since last week bc it's delicious. It's my favorite restaurant you should try it.

sGE-IVxW1l_mwYsU7TDELA.text: Excellent! The best steak I ever had in Vegas and service is tip top! Had a great experience and the food was amazing, perfectly cooked Rib Eye. Highly recommend this establishment.

D9Qw_gqJ1FFfmQ6B6lp4sQ.text: The steaks are phenomenal and way too large for a normal person. The highlight was a tiny glass of potato soup with a drizzle of green leek puree. I wish I had a bowl of this delicious soup.   Beautiful wine collection.  Excellent service and a beautiful place. Very reminiscent of a classic Las Vegas steak house.   Would definitely visit again.

zUV7oEV3tOGKY144kvUBUw.text: Wow. I realize sending a vegetarian into a meat palace isn't going to turn out well...but, the meatatarian was with me and he wasn't impressed either.   Decor - great decor, great theme, standard dark, red, plush steakhouse. The staff was aloof at the door and the waitress was as well.   We were 20 minutes early for our dinner reservation so we were going to have a cocktail in the lounge which they didn't direct us to, and then the waitress forgot our drinks.   A manager noticed and fixed the issue however, that was just plain sad. It wasn't bumping- our reservation was for 9pm. Let me say that the choice for this spot was ease of access only as we stayed at PH this last trip.   We were sat a decent table, a round booth that was comfy and lent us a great vantage point for people watching.   The waiter was fast, knew the menu and to the point. We were missing out on a return round of drinks.   I ordered a Beefsteak tomato salad, we ordered shrimp cocktail and calamari to start. DH ordered a fettuccini - lobster fettuccini.   All tasted AWFUL. Calamari was rubbery, cocktail shrimp were actually jumbo prawns that weren't deveined, tomato salad came as a scalped tomato with some cheese on top. Pasta tasted mushy and the lobster was chewy.   Luckily we weren't too hungry because we didn't finish any of it - but we also didn't complain.   Pricing was out of control - even for a steakhouse. Mortons/Hy's is far better quality & service for far less.   Wouldn't head back here for love or money - nothing nice to say.

9eITsnrwGka2E5ozxDpztA.text: Strip House is undoubtedly good and one of the top steak houses in Vegas, however I just don't know if I'd return.  Everything was cooked very well, our service was on the spot, and the ambiance was posh and comforting, but I just didn't get the WOW factor.  We go through the motions with our server (tap or bottled) and let him know tap is fine, order two glasses of wine, and were served bread.  All very standard in fine dining restaurants, blah.  Upon the arrival of our wines, we order our first course of either crab cakes or scallops (can't remember) and a caesar salad.  We continue on the order our entrees, a 16 oz. NY Strip and a 10 oz. filet mignon.  We also ordered three sides: whipped potatoes puree, potatoes romanoff, and black truffle creamed spinach.  Our first courses arrived in a timely manner.  The salad was fresh but wasn't the best I've ever had.  And as far as I know with the seafood, it was decent, nothing to rave about.  Shortly, after finishing them, our steaks and sides arrive and are cooked near perfectly.  The NY Strip was juicy and flavorful!  And even though my filet was cooked medium (the way I wanted), it was a tad on the dry side with little flavor.  Our sides were very good but perhaps a little on the "heavy" side.  My favorite being the whipped potatoes puree.  The spinach was very rich, creamy, and flavorful.  Though I don't recommend ordering it unless you have at least four people in your party.  The potatoes romanoff was rich as well, with a vast amount of cheddar cheese and sauteed onion.  Again, I wouldn't recommend ordering this unless your are dining with at least a group of four--too much food!  Strip House has a beautiful, luxurious red interior, which is reminiscent of a 1920s red light district.  There are tons of artsy, burlesque'ish pictures of girls hanging from the walls.  For those of you who are dining alone, they do have a nice bar upon entering the restaurant equipped with a large flat screen to watch the games.  Be aware there is music spinning.  However, the music is of a modern retro beat, that is very easy to listen to.  Somehow the music fits the vibe of the restaurant, since most of the clientele is between the ages of 20s-40s.  This is definitely a restaurant to be seen in!  But like I mentioned above, the food just didn't give me the WOW factor.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, NY Strip (back).  Creamed Spinach (top), whipped potatoes puree (left), potatoes romanoff (right).

T1Ic5HU9uAr5Fjbgma8DbQ.text: Great ambience and killer martini. Steak was a little over done, but John was a fabulous server. On point service, and definitely knows his shit. Made dinner easy and fun. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BNMgX3CFpPtrpxIz3GYM1g.text: Ate here for my husband's birthday. The food was great no doubt. I'm disappointed with the service. We called to change our time which they obliged. We were grateful. When we got there, there was no greeting which they professed they would do and stated that's what they're known for. No greeting. We ate dinner and two tables next to us had birthday greetings. Disappointed to see this and seeing husband see all this. Waiter spoke with a "matter of fact" tone. No warmth. We ordered dessert hoping for redemption. Nothing. I think had there been no call day before dinner stating how they would excitedly greet we would have been fine. Better off not hearing that and just ate they wonderful food. Not good service for a so called fine dining price.

GraaMpe4kGwTxyQi98xe6Q.text: The decor and ambiance are the best thing about this place. We sat at a table in the bar, before going on to a show at 9pm. The service was very slow and disorganized.  We ordered drinks and appetizers, and the food came before the drinks. The ordered the house cosmopolitans, made with KetelOne Vodka. But were all agreed the drinks were too syrupy sweet, and had to be sent back. I ordered 1/2 dozen Fanny Bay raw oysters. One oyster was a good medium size, the other 5 were were no bigger than my pinky fingernail, and should have never been put on a plate. We expressed our concerns to the manager, who was only mildly understanding. I feel they should have at least comped the cocktails, but we did not ask for that. Yet, it may have made our dining experience a bit more enjoyable, but no adjustment was made. We still left 20% tip though, but will not be returning. A $150 bill, including tip for 3 cosmos and 3 appetizers. The calamari and a prosciutto appetizer were good though.

xpKKsbyIbQrzL9YDkkUrSQ.text: I have had better food at cheaper prices. The atmosphere was cool... quite loud. I was expecting more from the food... for the price. There was 5 of us and our bill was almost $500 with no alcohol.   I have had better.

se8zu9H6O_SURykw9343Jw.text: I really wanted to love this meal... the atmosphere and ambiance was great.  Service was excellent.  However that is where the positive comments end.   Very disappointed with all of the food.   Limited non-steak entree options.  I had read a comment that the spinach was velvety.  OMG - The spinach was pure slime.  I literally gagged.  The baked potato was flavorless.  The steak was just "ok".  A 5 out of 10.   Giving this place two stars; one for the cool pictures and one for the waiter.

lzAluY8Rx1KITLTrLQs7Mw.text: One of the best meals I have had in a long time. The filet was cooked perfectly and the drinks were very well done. The item that I remember the most though was the cream spinach with truffle oil. That was amazing. I will be stopping in here at least once every time I'm in Vegas.

zmyM3TbWq8xp0VtzvD6Mfg.text: WOW!!! So glad my husband wanted to eat here! Unfortunately neither of us actually got a steak, but what we did get was amazing! The hostess was very friendly, our waitress was very attentive and patient, and the entire wait staff was always around to help us out without standing over us. We were sat in a coveted corner booth, which was a really great surprise. We were greeted with a Watermelon juice and Mint  "shot" (I don't remember what the waiter called it) as a welcome from the chef, which was followed up by a selection of bread and the largest ramekin of butter ever! Paula Deen would be jealous lol.   For our first course, my husband and I shared the most delicious crab cake of our lives! I was not feeling so great at this point (heat stroke?), so I took it slow, but I think it worked out in my favor lol. I got to taste all of the elements of the crab cake and really savor it, it was so good! The mustardy potatoes they paired with the crab cake were a bit intense by themselves, but paired with the crab cake they were really good.   For our main course we both ordered the Crispy Skin Organic Chicken Breast. I know, why come to a steak place for chicken?! Well my husband was all set on a steak but changed his mind last minute, and as I said I was not feeling so good so chicken seemed like my best option when I ordered. So glad we ordered that dish! My husband ordered his chicken with crispy onions and I ordered the garlic fries. My fries were a little over done (it cost them a star), but my husband's crispy onions were amazing! Not greasy like onion rings - very light and delicious. And they served the chicken with a chicken au jus which made it that much better. Sadly we were too full to try the famous chocolate cake, but there's always a next time!   Overall a really great experience! The best part was that there were no kids in sight! I know it's Vegas, but omg we saw kids EVERYWHERE! It was nice to have an adults only restaurant for once! We will definitely be back for the cake and some of the sides!

tu6kimCKWTcVFJ1rJgX_Fw.text: Came to Vegas for a mini vacation staying at Planet Hollywood!  This is by far the best steak house I have been to in Vegas and our waiter Brian was awesome. He introduced my boyfriend and I to a drink called a Full Moon.  Love it.   Thanks Brian your awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zpkUQE7DYdifpzeRcRp59g.text: Not a good experience.  Party of 5 lots of errors on the food and drinks.   Steaks and appetizers were over salted.   Old fashion and Moscow Mule cocktails were not made correctly.   Lobster bisque was bland.   Been here several times years ago and enjoyed it immensely.  I hope it returns to its former glory

KtH-4n4MM6hNaCy5Z8bAxA.text: You will have a much better time throwing a couple hundred of your hard earned dollars into a trash bucket on the front porch, dousing it in lighter fluid, and lighting it on fire than eating here! The net result is the same and it will be warmer!  First of all, they ask for your CREDIT CARD to place a reservation for four people. I asked why and they said they would charge me if I didn't show up. Okay. So have a fake credit card handy when you call. In my case I "messed up" some numbers and they never said anything about it.   We get there and the place is fricken freezing and empty. Glad they would have charged me for ditching a table when I would have been preventing absolutely no one from using it had we not shown.   The waitress was frigid. I don't know if it was the extreme cold (it was seriously unbearable in there), her first day, or just her marching orders (be as stern and unapproachable as possible- and above all: no fun), or perhaps she was just having a bad day... But she was not in the mood for any bullshit. You will order. You will eat. You will die. Not necessarily in that order.   Food was okay at best, cold when it came out (I wonder why??). Plus, the food is outrageously expensive and you get very little of it. Any review you read about "my meat was cooked to perfection." Get over it, I cook my steaks to perfection on a $99 grill every time at home too so we're not exactly curing cancer over here.   A lot of people confuse pretentiousness with good food, and I found the whole atmosphere to be misleading. You're at planet hollywood, on the strip in Vegas, and here you have a restaurant with a silly name taking itself way too seriously.

sZNLbPsyR9VuGh0ugYdD8g.text: One of the best steaks that I have had. I was inspired to visit here based on a show that was on the Travel Channel showing some of the things to do while visiting Las Vegas. I was not disappointed!  The ambiance was fantastic! Very classy looking and intimately lit. They have tasteful pictures of pinup up models illuminated perfectly all around and it is very red in the restaurant. Someone proposed across from us and I think it was a great setting to do so!  I had oysters, the bone in NY Strip, and the chocolate cake with a double shot of espresso. Others in my party had the filet mignon and the boneless NY strip steak.  We shared the goose fat potatoes, warm garlic bread with gorgonzola fondue, black truffle creamed spinach, garlic herb french fries, and mac & cheese.  It was a bit pricey but being a great steak house right on the strip it's what we expected to pay. I will definitely be returning for a steak here when I go back to Las Vegas!

nT19DeTF-HHPDtLZ_dw-ow.text: Average food at above average prices.  Overall experience was quite poor. Booked a table for 8pm but did not get seated until almost 830 despite there being tables available.   Food order took a considerable time. I order the 12oz rib eye and my wife the surf and turf. Her steak was overcooked by a lot and my undercooked, I asked for a medium and got a medium rare. The side dish of potato was very good and the steak itself was okay but just that. For $50+ I had hoped for better.  Wine selection again is okay but very overpriced. Service was mediocre at best.  Would not go again or recommend.

m9kOtqVOtolyhpsZZKQxdQ.text: We were recently in Las Vegas to attend the IBS Trade Show and we were staying close to Planet Hollywood. There was four of us and we had trouble deciding on food! Casual and cheap or dressy and no so cheap! Well this was the place! I only gave it four stars versus five due to the cost of this fantastic dinner! Yes, it was fantastic! I have posted a few items that we had. First of all, the waiter was exceptional! I think his name was Scott, but wouldn't swear to it due to alcohol consumption! He was extremely helpful with explaining the menu and what would best suite each of our appetites. Love the chic decor with the red vintage feel. We had a corner booth style table that was private and allowed for intimate conversation. I felt that the food portions were overall generous. Especially being a high end steak house. My favorites were the Maine Lobster Linguine and Lobster Bisque (Picture that is posted doesn't do it justice!). Obviously I am a lobster fan! My girlfriend had the surf and turf. Again, there was lobster involved! Her steak was cooked perfect for her and she is picky! We had the Baby Iceberg Salad. Always one of my favorites and they didn't miss a beat with this one. Broccolini was nice, but the Black Truffle Creamed Spinach is the best ever! The waiter recommended the perfect wine to pairing with our entrees. I am now on the hunt for one of the wines to purchase by the bottle locally in the Phoenix area.  Highly recommend Strip House Steak House! Budget accordingly. It is well worth every dime! I also feel like they would go the extra mile if you had a special occasion going on. Just call ahead! Perfect place for a celebration of some sort!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccolini
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail

mwa3393X6WLF3bNbqBSyvw.text: Went there with friends, had the seafood plateu, wasnt too bad, we are seafood lovers so their blue point oysters were just OK, we had better in a cheaper place which was suprisingly weird, bc it is a very expensive restaurant we thought they would be bigger and nice and plumbed but they weren't. Their tuna salad was also OK, had better in a sushi place. The boys had a steak, they said it was amazing. The place was not packed on Thursday night, we didn't have reservations so they just took us in, which was nice of them!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20oz Steak
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 Seafood Plateu

X2xpk5qzXEBAvnTdGj2HdQ.text: Wasn't too happy with my Filet - was very dry and way too much pepper crust on the outside.  My husband enjoyed his NY Strip, though.  The steak sauce on the side was a little too sweet for me.  Sides were meh.  Was an ok experience - not sure I'd come back again.

8tfQAWXHskTtpwdzK82GHw.text: I was really impressed by my dinner here.  I'll cut straight to the beef: Got the bone-in ribeye and they nailed it. Great unique-flavored char on the outside and cooked to a juicy medium rare.   Normally sides dishes can be throwaways but I liked all 3 we got: wild mushrooms, green beans and the Strip House potatoes (definitely get these)!  We got there kind of late, so by the time dessert rolled around we were the last people there. We decided against it, but the staff never made us feel rushed at all.

8AHpVlcRsuoGB69xpQPiQg.text: The food and service is nothing less than outstanding at this restaurant. The prices are expensive but are relative for a steak house. I highly recommend the Buffalo Milk Burrata which was fantastic pairing with the balsamic and creative squash. We then ordered a 40 Oz tomahawk rib eye served table side which is out of this world. Our other guests ordered the lobster pasta, white asparagus and potatoes Romanoff side, all which they claimed were also very appetizing. The evening dinner service ambiance is amiable. The location is fairly hidden on the level above the casino in the planet hollywood, and my only suggestion is if you didn't know this is a steak house, the sign visible to guests on the casino floor just reads "strip house" implying it might be something different frkm a restaurant.

KU_y_vM1ysOQcwXpNFeFxA.text: The steak was amazing as was the asparagus side. Salads were underwhelming and could have been split even though we were led to believe they would not be enough. Bread was disappointing. If you order the baked Alaska put the pistachio sauce on the side. We thought it tasted horrible and ruined the look of the dessert.

nrzdfE49D7TAP6P-QdIiTQ.text: Phenomenal. Great food. Flapper era photos and dim lights gave it a speak easy and roaring 20s feel. Ma Barker and I right at home. Good food. New staff dialing in but did well. Inside 0lanet Hollywood. Homerun

DXdXxabDw7TZwwKp3TMinw.text: Not sure how this place isn't busier- it was amazing! Starting with the cocktail- I got the ruby mule which was a Moscow mule but with red grapefruit added to it- omg! It woke us up with the perfect ginger spiciness!   Ordered the salmon, was cooked perfectly- the sides were delicious too, mushrooms, potatoes Au gratin and whipped potatoes. The hubbies loved their steaks.  Services was perfect and the espresso creme brulee was a nice change from the traditional dessert.  The place is on the second floor of the casino but really nice and swanky as far as decor.

RY0tocMlikfXh6uCkseyTQ.text: We went to Strip House for my birthday dinner on August 5th.  I got a horrible birthday present from Strip House,  FOOD POISONING!!!  I was the only one at the dinner who ordered scallops.  I ended up spending my birthday feeling like I was going to die.  I had to have a doctor come to my room to give me a shot that cost me $400.      During our visit we had terrible service.  The waitress forgot all of our cocktails every time we ordered them.  We had to get to a show at 9.  We were sat at the table at 6:30pm.  The food did not arrive to our table until 8:30pm.  We had to rush to eat our food to make it to the show onetime.  I will never recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!!

ZnQrnUofrfgiamRc8zQzxg.text: Unbelievable food and service! My husband and I booked Strip House for our wedding reception dinner. When booking the time/day, we were given options for a pre-selected menu which were great! When we arrived we were seated in a private dining room with the menus on the table and it was personalized with our names and event. All of our guests complimented the servers on the food and service we received. We also had their famous 24-layer cake and they gave us a piece to take home to freeze for our one-year anniversary. I cannot say enough about this restaurant and their staff! They made our wedding reception incredible!! Ricky was our head server... thank you so much, Ricky, for everything!!

XCOpnWvolD8NhUcD0bFfWw.text: I would not recommend this place to dine in for steak to a friend of mine. Timing: we were seated at 7:40, did not get our order in for a while, it's not until 8:49 that we got our foods in (party of 8). Service was pretty much non existence.  Price: bone in ribeye was $56 at minimum, side orders comes separately. 1 crab cake (regular size) for $20. Ordered the surf and turf (filet mignon + 1 lobster tail) for $62. The only reason we came here is because they weren't busy on a Saturday night and could seat us within 15 minutes.  Overall the taste of the steak was okay, fresh lobster. But the time we had to wait plus the pricing is what will keep us from coming back.

53Wp9jTZHSU0FTYo5I58dQ.text: Exceptionally poor service and management has an extremely poor follow up; therefore all around bad on that aspect. Much of the food was delicious, but the bread might have been the best part of the experience. When service is rude, short, and ignorant of the customer obviously its much easier to do very poor work and/or miss things.. such as details of an order, etc. This part should not be missing as it throws off the experience of the restaurant. I watched and listened as many complained of the same bartender being awful in one way or another. I'm sure her tips suffered as did many customer's experience. The ambiance here is pleasing and enjoyable; the steaks and service are.. no joke.. the worst of any supposed "high end" steakhouse. Much worse than any I have been to in what seems like a decade actually. I love and live for great meals and this one really, really failed. I promise you, this is absolutely not a premiere steakhouse. Do not come here if you're expecting to get your money's worth with a delicious meal or be taken care of whatsoever. I feel bad for them. Mastro's, Larsons, blahblahblah... any other place would have at least corrected the error. Lol. The last mistake and one that will not allow repeat customers and perhaps the people in those person's circles. Farewell forever awful "steakhouse."

DAwk4OmdKf1PXHSD40RKhQ.text: Booked their wine room for 6 people, and we were very nicely greeted, quickly seated, and felt welcomed. The ambiance is classy meets romance and modern touches. Love the red colored designs and photos!  Our server was excellent, prompt, and very polite. One of the managers hopped in to help us take a group photo (it's the little things that count), and everyone seemed to be working as a team to make the experience delightful for all.  We all had a steak of some sort, along with the lobster tail, a bottle of wine, and varied sides. Everything was so great! Our check was brought in on time and taken care of quickly.  Really enjoyed my first experience here! Thank you!

6QR0o3YTe1OrYXJZ0TPxEg.text: The service is horrible!  We are sitting in the lounge and the waitress goes missing for 30+ minutes. We have been without wine and water and when the waitress finally comes back we order two bottles of wine and some water. 10-minutes and still not here. The waitress is a witch and acts inconvenienced that we ordered dinner and drinks. Unfortunate for sure!

xYwLmvEjlXPb-JR2tMvIMg.text: Seriously cannot say enough about eating here! The price is up there but the service and food make it well worth it and then some! Our waiter was impeccable. He knew everything about anything on the menu. The ribeye and garlic cloves were heaven. I could not have enjoyed a better meal. Their wine list was a little overwhelming but I told him what I like and he came back with an amazing malbec that went perfect with the meal. The sides are meant to split. We spent between 4 of us about $100.00 a piece. But oh my! We truly enjoyed everything about eating here. Cannot wait to come back!

oobi2VQsasrz_l2j-X6-Fw.text: Really good steak. Service was a little slow. Otherwise would have given it 5stars. Love the bread options.  Reasonably priced menu

YSV8H4HG_I4jYZnTnLrLmg.text: Very good food here! Great wine/drink menu, and the appetizers are huge and easily shared. We had a table of 5 and everyone seemed happy with the portion sizes. I recommend the lobster pasta and the goose fat potatoes. It was your typical expensive and decadent steakhouse menu, but they delivered big time on quality and flavor.

aolTbawyyeM6fdajEt4pNA.text: Dinner for 22 is a tough number to serve and keep happy. Fantastic job by the service crew  Nice to see management assign the correct number of serverrs. Steaks were fantastic. Appitizer bacon dish was worthy of the visit by itself.  There are many choices in Vegas, put this one on your list.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tbni5K8OSVBlYtM9reEw8Q.text: Can you say a hidden gem in Vegas ? From all the big names like Gordon Ramsey,Morton's and all the major strip hotel steakhouses , there is Striphouse. Located on the 2nd floor of the main casino Planet Hollywood . It has a very nice dark ambience inside surrounded with Hollywood legends red seats . Service here is fantastic and very prompt . I like the way they bring you pretzel bread and little cheese bread rolls with room temperature butter simply amazing.  The Menu has a perfect simple choice of prime steaks on the menu. I had the 8oz fillet cooked at a perfect medium rare with  instant taste orgasams accompanied by broccoli and mushrooms was the perfect side . I'm getting hungry as I'm writing this and want to go back they do have a amazing chocolate cake which I highly recommend you try. If you're looking for that perfect steakhouse which is quiet dark and very relaxing look no further strip house at planet Hollywood is the spot

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rPDBqanP_XOTYaRP7aefjg.text: Not much that was wrong with our dinner. First of all the most positive experience we could offer was the staff. Our server knew his menu as well as the chef that created it. Right down to where the animal was raised and how it will be prepared. We prefer restaurants that keep the experience simple. And that was our experience last night. Simple. We arrived and were promptly seated. We were offered a very extensive menu presentation. Every single question we had was thoroughly answered by our server. And the plates that were brought to us were exactly how they were described. We ordered the ahi tuna and chateaubriand. There wasn't a chewy bite on the plate. Sashimi grade ahi and an extremely lean tenderloin. We will definitely be returning!  Too many times people only leave negative reviews. In our case I have no issue taking time out of my day to commend an exceptional employee. Our server was Billy. I suggest you add his name to your future reservations.

BDG0AsiUGzweX8BfjyFqqA.text: Food was great. My favorite part of dinner was Carlos. All of his suggestions were on point. I wanted the bone in ribeye but they were out. He assured me that the other ribeye was just as good. He was right. The wine and sides were very good also. So thank you Carlos for a nice birthday dinner. The restaurant is so very lucky to have you

qeTAIVk12YmBeRjTWjQE4g.text: We came here before a show at Planet Hollywood. The food was fantastic, the service was great and we loved the atmosphere. We ordered the Filet mignon's. My Mom is pretty picky about how her steak is cooked - medium well but not quite well - but this actually doesn't exists. However, they cooked her streak to her expectations which in in itself is a miracle. We also ordered some sides which were large enough to share and delicious - asparagus and Strip House potatoes.  Our server Ricky was very knowledgeable and friendly. He asked if we were going to a show and I said we had one at 9. Ricky was so considerate to watch timing of our meal to make sure we left in time which I truly appreciated. All in all it was a great experience. Can't wait to return to dig into that famous chocolate cake.

pQdRN3Nm-pearwxKkBuGmw.text: I was at Strip House in Vegas a couple weeks ago (oddly was in at NYC location just a week before - this review should mirror that location as well).  This place was solid.  As steakhouses go, really good, however, I have to say, and yes it was my first time, but the wagyu was freaking ridiculous!!!  So many props to the Chef.    Our waiter was fantastic, directed me to a tasty single malt, took care of my friends, didn't BS me or my friends on their preferences, and our server took care of the bachelor, and us, like we were much more important than we really were.  Oh, AND the mac and cheese was superb.   The ability to have such high standards and consistency from NYC to Vegas is really a nod to management as well.    Server.  Bus.  Chef. Host.  Bartender.  And anyone I left out - Cheers.  Well Done!

i8xo8ZnOOfAT8BtfXvNO6g.text: So first off I do not eat meat and I know weird, why go to a steak house but it was a family dinner so I decided to not be selfish. The service and ambiance was so amazing and went over expectations especially after walking around the planet hollywood casino and miracle mile mall. There were 14 of us so we got a nice private room which was really cool. Pretty much everyone in my family all shared the meat order for two people and then got a few sides which made it cheaper. Being I don't eat meat I got a tomato and cucumber salad which not only was stunning but amazing. The cream of spinach and mac n cheese were also a hit. The meat plates were also beautiful and carved in front of us which added for a nice little show if you will. For dessert we mainly got the fudge brownie and the 24 layer chocolate. Both very rich and sweet but so darn good. Cake was so massive let me tell you. Overall, I would highly recommend to anyone- even a non meat eater. Not to mention we had the most adorable little server who seemed to just about everything.

WuWyQDkfIw_ksV9L8EdCEg.text: I have a gluten allergy and the staff is very knowledgeable! Love the filet mignon with gf broccoli and whipped potatoes. And the gluten free garlic bread is to die for! Go here, it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KW1I67ze-_XfUkjm0Oaghw.text: Well we used to love this place. My husband ordered his steak medium rare, it came med well, we told the server. They made it again, it took a good 20 min, I was done with my meal by the time it came. When we were charged full price for the mistake, we asked for the manager. He came, we explained the situation, he says "did you eat it?"  And left. We will never return sadly :(

gB5LFP5VI8XYpSqPV5Vyhw.text: Great steak house, one of my favorites.  Everything tasted lovely and the servers were so courteous.  No complains what so ever, top of my list for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NUKnblNaywk9LX_V3pU1EQ.text: Come on Strip House. The quality of everything here is just great. It's the type of place that I would drive 3 hours to eat at. The Strip House just does everything right.  The salads, the steaks and the sides. The Strip steak was, and is my favorite. The wedge salad is over the top. And if you eat desert, get the cake and nothing else.  The prices are fair for the quality, and the service. A must every time I hit the Strip.

lebOYSYnOBrmd4CqsbVeCw.text: It's all about the cake.  If nothing else, get the chocolate cake.  You will thank me later.  I needed to grab a bite after a long day at work.  I was staying at Planet Hollywood and didn't want to roam around the casino floor with the chaos that is Vegas.  I decided to walk into the strip house and sit at the bar.    The bar tender was great - attentive but not overbearing.  While sitting there eating and enjoying my meal, a man walked up to the bar and ordered a slice of chocolate cake to go. GENIUS!!!!  Stuffed from my meal and cocktail...I simply didn't have room for dessert - but took a slice to go as well. As it was my first time ordering the cake, I had no idea how friggin' humongous the slice would be.  It had to have weighed at least 3-5lbs.   OMG. After one bite, I wished I had taken three or four or five to go. HEAVEN. I love chocolate cake, and the 24-layer chocolate cake at strip house is the best ever. I guess you can share the ginormous slice, but that's just silly. This is one indulgence worth the calories.

g5J9YxECt88jbTvcQY0eag.text: Had a birthday dinner here and I must say I was very impressed. The breads, appetizers and main course were all above par. The service here is impeccable.  The only negative was the coffee which came out tepid but of course they made it right with a fresh pot. Both the steak and lobster were cooked to perfection and the crab cake was delicious with the wasabi based sauce. I recommend this for a special dinner since you probably won't get out for less than $200 for 2. It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nx9UxYh6X3XahljQjVW3_Q.text: We went to Strip House, but we did not have a great experience. The service was slow and it took a while to get our food. We ordered the Lobster Bisque which was not very good. It lacked some flavor. For our main entree we got the Fillet Mignon which was soft and very tender. The only problem I had is that the crust had a lot of peppercorn which made the dish a bit overwhelming. We also ordered the Tuna dish. I personally enjoyed that dish a lot. The Tuna was perfectly cooked and fresh. For our side dish we ordered the sauteed mushrooms. They had a good flavor, but they were very average. For our final entree we got the Chocolate Brownie. The portion of the dish was very good for sharing. However, I was not impressed with the flavors. The brownie was a bit cold and the flavors were just ok.  Overall, I would most likely not come back to this restaurant. The strip has so many great restaurants that it's easy to find a restaurant with better service and delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate brownie
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauté mushrooms
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon

2-E5OHbxDhzSUYIIaE1S5g.text: Hello everyone. This place is easily one of my favorite steakhouses. I have always had fast and friendly service whenever I visit here. They have these French fries that are fried in duck fat that are soooo addicting!   So I am a huge fan of their rib eye steak it is sooo juicy and made very well with just the right amount of char.   My wife normally gets the filet which is well seasoned that she really likes.   We also tried the porterhouse one time which was also very flavorful. I think I still like rib eye more than the New York's strip but not by much!! Really recommend this place!  Have fun everyone!

yplZZV8e6kOMpWHO_HYxfA.text: Very nice steakhouse.  My bone in rib eye was cooked perfect.   Old school look and a friendly staff. Nice job

oYBPB7SgLweUR1t9-M_pxA.text: Cat was a phenomenal server and paid attention to ever detail. Atmosphere was as great as always, but the food was mediocre at best. What happened to this restaurant? Grass fed filet with Stilton crust was prepared perfectly but the quality of the steak was just OK...sure did not taste like prime. Surf & Turf was just OK also. Sides were also not prepared as well as expected. Charbroiled broccoli with miso sauce was not cooked enough and I love my veggies barely cooked/grilled/steamed. Goose fat potatoes had so much grease I couldn't eat this side. My son loved the French fries, our drinks were delicious and our coffee at the end of the meal was superb.

-HlJedB7SKVoauPU9JGPzA.text: First time at this restaurant and have to say very impressed! We ordered the chateaubriand for two and it was amazing! tender , flavorful  and cooked to perfection! We ordered one side to share which was more then enough. No room for dessert! Daniel our waiter was spot on!

GAo63Q359cyuui4dzr0EAA.text: This was an interesting experience for me since I do not eat steak.  I was a little caught off guard by all the naked photos on the wall - not something I'm usually accustomed to staring at while eating.  I moved to a different seat to avoid the photos actually.  I had calamari as an appetizer and I have to say it's the best calamari I've had.  Absolutely excellent.  For my "entree" I ordered side dishes since I just can't eat steak.  My aunt had the filet and enjoyed it.  I had mac and cheese (good), asparagus (good) and strip potatoes (good).  I would honestly come here again just for the calamari - it was that good!

pJbD1OI2np1qdz8EbjnDeA.text: Found this place on open table and four of us got right in with a quick reservation. The waiter was extremely helpful and nice. We ordered a couple of fillets and I had the dry aged ribeye. It literally was cooked to perfection with a wonderful pepper crust that sealed in the natural juices. My guests said the fillets were good, but once they had a taste of the ribeye they wished they had ordered that.  The bread service and wedge salad's as well as the soup were all very good. This place feels a little out-of-the-way when you're walking the strip so maybe that's why they weren't crowded Because the steak certainly rivaled anything I've had in Vegas before.

g7uXx9rGyBLTjJZlpv15LA.text: Exceptional steakhouse, such a wonderful dinning experience. Great ambience, delicious food and awesome service. We ordered salt pepper crusted filet, salmon, miso broccoli and sauteed spinach. Everything simply delicious. I'm not a dessert person but since it was my friends birthday I Ordered their 24 layer chocolate cake, Yes 24 layers!!! It was to die for. I highly Recommend this place and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 layers of chocolate heaven!!
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and perfectly cooked filet (medium)
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yeah! 8oz fillet

-j9e1e5pF_kGKTHOYZKLvA.text: I want to thank Lori and The Striphouse for being part of our wonderful and hectic wedding day! I am so incredibly happy with everything they provided. The service was amazing, room was incredibly clean, both the waiter and busboy were extremely attentive! We did ask for the lighting to be adjusted and it wasn't a problem whatsoever; but was appreciated immensely. Also to celebrate we did a shot together, although our server had to ask to confirm he even went as far to serve a shot of water to our disabled guest to insure she felt included. They food was spectacular and we all couldn't be more impressed and pleased with our time here. Thank y'all for everything you did!!!

Y619NIvHKccvGxPJ314ipg.text: First, let me start out by saying the atmosphere and decor made me like this place as soon as I walked in. They have old time models and pin-up style pictures on the walls, the restaurant is dimly lit, and the red accents pop! This is a very "sexy" and possibly romantic restaurant.   The bread on the table is actually pretty good. I have a piece of the cheese topped bread and the pretzel bread. Both very good. For dinner I had the 8oz filet Oscar style and a side of twice baked potatoes. The steak was very good but it had a strong seasoned taste to it that isn't "standard" when you order a steak. I also felt like more Bearnaise sauce could have been given since I paid $18 to make my steak Oscar style. (I didn't say anything though) Finally, the twice baked potatoes were delicious and they give you enough to share.  Even though I was so full after dinner, I wanted to try dessert so I had a couple bites of the raspberry sorbet. Delicious and a very pretty presentation.  Overall, this is a nice steakhouse, just not my favorite in town. If you're seeing a show or at Planet Hollywood to gamble, this is a good choice.

Anr1zKYGrpCOAr08wy_tZg.text: Enjoyable dinner with three friends. Pricey but Vegas typical. Waitress was efficient, overwhelming discussing specials that were actually on the menu.  Tables was handled by too many people. Steaks (Landry owns them now) were properly cooked but negligable marbling made them "hard" not all the way to tough. Sides were one good (Mac n'cheese) one bad (creamed spinach - cold and goey).  Oysters - very good as appetizer.  Highlight was the lump crab appy - truly a nice portion and good quality although obviously overchilled (icey) before tabling.  Atmosphere top notch.

irp-Cnel-n22TPWqMsXBRg.text: Walked in - no reservation- was able to find a bar table. Food and service was excellent

RMW126UDr4zsUMNWxTAfug.text: The food is very good and so is the wait service.  It loses 2 stars because the bartender (Mark?) is a total tool.  Says he has been there for 13 years, but has an attitude problem.

c5Ba5s6UHsX3Gl8thqp8ZQ.text: I know that steak houses are a dime a dozen in Vegas but Strip stood out to me.  Not sure if it was because of the dark fancy ambience or the nice smell every time I walked by the restaurant.  It was our last night in Vegas and were sick of eating your typical quick dinners so we decided to eat at Strip House which was in our hotel.  Upon arrival we were seated right away and our order was taken right away.  Waiter was super friendly and quick to serve us anything we asked for.  My steak was cooked and seasoned to perfection.  No complaints what so ever as even the sides were cooked to perfection.  Now lets talk about dessert.  We ordered the 27 layer chocolate cake that was apparently featured on the Oprah show at one time or another.  I was like whatever its chocolate cake how can you go wrong anyways.  Cake was served and for those of you that know me you know that im not a huge sweets guys but let me tell you this cake made me change that quick.  The slice of cake was HUGEEE.  We could not finish it we had to bring it back to our room.  All in all I know that the steak houses are everywhere but let me tell you this.  If you are not going to try the steak at Strip House then you MUST try the chocolate cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Rib Eye
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes

3ZC0dZjS0a29SOhj1Bidzg.text: This probably isn't a fair review because it's really only on the 21 layer chocolate mousse layer cake.  Although the food smelled Devine and I wished we had time to stop and eat.   The next time we visit Vegas we will be sure to eat here.

6vLhsv21V5ZJdRCH6K-Iqw.text: I just had an amazing dining experience with Scott this evening . His recommendations on food , cocktails , and wine pairings were no less than superb . I had the New York Strip and the black truffle spinach that paired fantastically with a full bodied  Cabernet that he suggested . The meal ended on a high note with the Baked Alaska , another one of his recommendations . I will definitely suggest this restaurant to my fellow colleagues .

FD6yBfPa9vl-AebMS-24eA.text: My husband and I booked this restaurant for our wedding anniversary dinner after our vow renewal at the Aria.   Everyone loved the food.   And we couldn't beat the price for group dining.   If you are looking for a dinner reception or a small private dinner this is definitely the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iceberg salad
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anniversary menu

Jt2AhpSXU4YhoodKgqQsPw.text: We decided to try out Strip House since we were going straight to Peep Show after.  I always forget it is there since it is upstairs.  The ambiance and decor are nice.  The service was good.  Our server was attentive and friendly.  We started with the Warm Garlic Bread.  It is long rectangular strips of fried bread.  It comes with a Gorgonzola Fondue for dipping.  The taste and texture of the bread is great.  The fondue is creamy and mild.  We all enjoyed it.  The house bread basket comes with three types of bread.  I only tried the pretzel bread, but it was excellent.  The others seemed happy with the other two options.  I chose the 8 oz. filet for my main course.  It was prepared as requested, medium rare.   The meat was tender and tasty.  The seasoned salt and pepper crust gave it added flavor and texture.  We ordered a couple sides.  The Potatoes Romanoff were tasty with nice contrasting textures.  The others tried the Steamed Asparagus and told me it was good.  They have diverse options for wine.  They also offer some unique mixed drinks.

XATQMllaxw9YXOZRCyeCQA.text: First of all, our waiter (John) was fantastic! He was very attentive and made great recommendations. We got the steak special for two, the tomahawk, that was carved table-side and melted in our mouths. An upscale dining experience that is worth every penny!!

ZSwFR-ysfhvldPCE_e6dWQ.text: Awesome service the steak cooked the way I ordered, wine was perfect, and the service beyond belief!!!! Skip the capaccino not spelled correctly but not prepared as well as everything else. I love the crust they put on the steak. Did not use a sauce. Manager visited twice unobtrusively and very friendly.  Will be back!

k3FaeDtOBhO1qMUn-mZ38g.text: This place never fails. Service is phenomenal and the food is flawless. Marc at the bar is always attentive and never lacks conversation.  The tuna tartar is my favorite in town...just the right amount of spice and texture with the cucumber wrap.  Also (and I realize this is petty but I'm particular) the pretzel rolls are ridiculously good.  Can't go wrong here.

Vc9J2bixcBT59jOIOTX6ew.text: If I had the ability to give 6 stars, I would.  What a great place.  We were on our way to Jeff Dunham next door and told them that.  I don't know if that had anything to do with the promptness, but lightning fast service. Started with some apps....the lobster bisque and the stuffed prosciutto....fantastic!  Entrees: bleu cheese crusted Wagyu ribeye and the surf and turf, (filet and lobster tail)......off the hook!  One thing that I do not order out very often, is a steak. Mainly because I can cook one better than I usually get served. However, the ribeye was well trimmed and had a great crust on it.  After my dad had removed the lobster meat from the tail, a guy was right there to grab the carcass.  As for the sides.....potatoes Romanoff and the mac and cheese. I like mac and cheese about as much as I like eggs benedict, I will get it about anywhere just because!  Well, as much as I loved the truffle mac from Gordon Ramsey's Steak.....this place was better!  (Sorry Gordo)!  Very creamy! (An adjective I don't like to use)  ....but it was!   The service needs a column of its own....  The waiter was cool yet very knowledgeable, 2 thumbs for that guy!  All of the table assistants were impeccable too.  The restaurant was elegantly dark and decorated in a roaring 20's look.    In a nutshell, if you have the scratch to go for about a buck fifty a person for supper, do it!  That was with a $100 bottle of wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes Romanoff in front and mac and cheese in back
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bleu cheese crusted Wagyu ribeye

HZdplAh7Q_BRC77zFHF5fw.text: This is the 3rd time my Wife and I have been here and have yet to be disappointed. Service is nothing shy of amazing. As for the food, Bone in Ribeye medium rare. BEYOND BUENO!!!

0JjUmXTfaCoaEyGt2pV1yg.text: Came here for a triple date with my boyfriend, parents, and brother and his girlfriend for a post Valentine's Day dinner.   We started with their special bacon appetizer, Rockefeller Oysters, and Salmon Cake. I was all about the bacon. Holy crap was it ridiculously good.   For my entree, I had the special bone in filet with black truffle and parmesean and everyone else had a variety of other dishes including the NY Strip, bone in Ribeye and Lamb Chops. So... freakin... good. We shared our sides family style which was great advice from our server because we ordered six. Figured one per person... we were gluttonous. Mac and cheese, potatoes romanoff, asparagus, creamed spinach, goose fat potatoes and the GREEN BEANS. YESSSSS. (The sides are huge by the way, you don't need to order one per person)   As if we didn't have enough ( we took dinner home), we ordered the 24 layer chocolate cake, banana tart, and creme brulee. Guess which dessert we had to box?   Fantastic meal to a post Valentine's Day triple date.   Ps. Blaze's Cosmo. Do it... do it.

Jdvrezbrk5qNnY3SSJpoPw.text: Oh my goodness, this place was amazing!! It is expensive (Think El Gaucho), but definitely worth it!   I had the 8 oz filet, my husband had the filet and lobster special, we split a salad and a potato side. The  seasonal cosmopolitan that the server recommended was excellent. My favorites were the Strip House Potatoes (twice baked potato gratin) and the Ginger Creme Brulee.   Make a reservation through Yelp, it will save you some time :-)

sNpUEVioddH-y5_v9noVNQ.text: We had a rib eye and filet, both were perfectly cooked and absolutely wonderful. The bread is to die for and the service is excellent.

m694gUdOkA6nLDBTXJ6Slw.text: Came in after superbowl just for the 24 layer cake since it was our last night in town.  Our group ended up splitting a few dinners and the food was great as usual.  The waitress on the other hand was more interested in her conversation with the bartender than to be bothered by us. We had to flag someone down to please get her for us, twice!  The food for us is 5 stars, but the service was terrible this trip.  The restaurant was not even full for us to have that kind of service.

94Is7OPnS_LJjyxEwD9GUg.text: Been here four times now each time was a great dining experience. The steaks are amazing. The service was top notch only positives here. You must try the jerky and the bacon apps. Scott is the best waiter in town bar none. And if you like scotch well they got you covered.

5wUjj7yBzPP2PD6UfoJRXw.text: Pretty good but we like Del Friscos better. The only thing that stood out as phenomenal was the gratin potatoes. We got the ahi Tuna and bone in New York. Both were pretty good but not phenomenal. Also a side of mushrooms which were also pretty good.

-bJqYvSPOEeWo-2HRa8_8A.text: Loved their side dishes but i've had a better steak. was quick to get into the lounge but it took forever to get the food. took 30 min to get wine and another 45 to get our food after we ordered. With a $300.00 bill for two people i want good food and service. both were worth $100 at most

svJ9FG5yXlWnQtp8-dEe7Q.text: Phenomenal steaks in a cool environment with vintage pinups lining the walls. Very accommodating staff that was attentive to a large group.  My 20 oz. bone-in ribeye was cooked to perfection which seems to be hard to do these days. The sides were great such as the creamed spinach and the green beans as well.

s17ZXpbKodHlszcsSXrybw.text: Went here for dinner on 3/5. This place was happening on a wednesday evening. Must have been the Nascar or other convention that brought in the troops.  Ambience: nice setup and vibe. Can be flexible with different type of dinners (ie romantic, business, etc. ). Noticed some nice private rooms. Not your typical stuffy steakhouse. A tad on the noisier side. But all in all, nice vibe.  Service: for the most part, it wad pretty good. We were seated right away when put party arrived. When another friend joined us late, a seat was quickly added. Our server came right away. However, service started slowing down as the restaurant got more business. We actually had to flag someone down for the dessert menu. Food came out at a decent pace.  Food: was pretty good. Highlights for me included the seafood combo appitizer (2 jumbo shrimp and jumbo lump crab meat). Loved the crabmeat (2oz). I got the dry aged ribeye (medium rare) and it was a tad over cooked to a medium. Still very nice flavor. Friends really enjoyed the salmon (not sure i would ever order salmon at a steakhouse). Best sides were the mac n cheese and the bacon cream of spinach. That spinach was phenomenal.  Value: typical high end steak house prices.   I would visit this place again if i was staying at PH

1E4gp1Ak2DLRXHiUPl9gFQ.text: This is a great steakhouse. I have been raving about it and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good steak.  We got the New York Strip and both agreed that it was by far one of the best steaks we've ever had. It's a little pricey, especially if you have a few drinks with dinner, but it is well worth it and I will definitely be coming back!

FaUeICBDIBQmy08J7ru_5g.text: Cool vibe: dark interiors with vintage photos of pin-ups on the wall.  We dined here with a large party (25 guests) and had an amazing dinner.  One of the guests at our table got the half order of the seafood plateau.  It's an impressive looking dish and crammed with seafood and shellfish served on crushed ice.  I was totally loving the bread basket (lots of variety, all very tasty) since I'm not a huge creepy crawly seafood person.  I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass for my main.  Seriously, one of the best fish dinners I've ever had, and I live on Maui.  I eat and serve fish for a living.  The Sea Bass was served on a bed of Jalapeno Potato Puree with a red wine sauce.  It was so delicious that I only gave my boyfriend a single bite.  I usually am much more generous in giving him tastes from my plate, but not with this dish!  He ordered one of the many specials offered: the dry aged ribeye.  It was a tad overcooked, but still incredibly juicy with a killer rub.    All steaks were served a la carte (minus the bulb of roasted garlic on the side of every steak--such a great idea and oh so delicious.  I had to school the table on how to remove the garlic cloves and spread them on each bite of steak, or eat them on their own if you're a garlic lover like me), so we ordered a few things for the table: the signature Strip House Potatoes (twice baked potato gratin), steamed asparagus with Bearnaise Sauce, and Mac & Cheese.  Do yourself a BIG, BIG favor and order those potatoes.  AH-MAY-ZING.  To die for.  Mouth watering. I wish I had some right now.

igf9Jm0s3_v2kw_SyZCVwQ.text: We had Thanksgiving dinner here last year and it was excellent. This is a very classy, fairly high end place with great food and service!

zc5SinzemLBB-xSlsMFerg.text: We went to see the Jeff Dunham show, which was at the Planet Hollywood. We decided to have an early dinner before the show. Food was delicious - steak was tender and flavorful, just prefect. Service was good. Our waiter was professional and attentive. However, it took him a long time to give us the check - we were worried about getting to the show on time and had communicated the same. But, he seemed to be taking his time.

BCDR1RrAXikqxLKzW5wFYQ.text: Been coming to Strip House for a few years now off and on when I'm in Vegas. As always, the service is great and the food is quality. Great wine and drink selection. The atmosphere is warm, yet private. I'll continue to come back here.

wLkMcgO73wt8uRi2euzomw.text: Started with the crab cake and beef jerky. Crab cake is one big portion. Nice crust on outside and served with green beans and potatoes. Not the traditional crab cake but that is what made is even better. Good flavor. The jerky was very  flavorful  and the salad goes perfect with it. The steaks are served with a char and salted crust. Loved the crust!!! Cooked perfect! Goose fat potatoes were different but very good. Mac and cheese was rich but that's what was hoping for. . Service was very good. Overall a very good experience and will return!

9JS3_N03_ekqNXiMABJ14Q.text: Came here for a Bachelor party dinner with the fellas. We had the private room reserved for our group dinner (about 20 people).  While we waited for our private room to be set up, there is a lounge bar area with couches and mini tables to hang out at while you wait or lounge and grab a drink.  The private room was great. Pros: very private room, enclosed room away from the crowd and noise. Sometimes could be too quiet if no one was talking. Cons: Away from the crowd and scene! haha The private room also had plasma mounted so you could watch any showing of your liking.    Food: - Ribeye: Perfect portion, very tasty and lots of flavor. Recommended - Cream corn (sides): mediocre. I've had better. - Mac n cheese (sides): just alright...nothing special - Fries (sides): decent...I prefer truffle style fries   Overall: Great ambiance and excellent host and customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tol2A7ycy_KESIgsJ1TiTg.text: I'm going to be on TV. Don't hate. It's only fair that one day I get my own damn sitcom. You know you'll watch it too. You ain't gotta lie to kick it. Soooo..... We took the bachelor out for a good steak dinner. What guy doesn't like a great steak? A Birkenstock wheat grass eating fool that's who. Luckily, the man of the hour isn't one. And neither am I. When we walked in we saw a film crew concentrating on a table. We sat down and the wedding party behind us told us it was for the Kendra Show on E! (the exclamation mark does not denote excitement). If you're a fan of the Kendra show on E!, you might see my big old noggin' in an episode. I won't watch it, because honestly, I don't like her. She's too Barbie-ish and annoying. Holly Madison was in the room as well, and anyone that dated Criss Angel sucks at life anways. There is only one woman that can pull the Barbie look and that woman is Pamela Anderson. But I still prefer Kirstie Alley, so I'll be watching her show instead. Besides, I'm sure the producers will edit out my B-Boy routine I did just for them. That's the last time I pop and lock for the cheering crowd. yelp.com/biz_photos/AT_x... (notice the sad face emoticons. my microsoft paint skills are off da hook!! nah mean?! geeyuuuuuhh!) So like the bunch of turd burglars we are, we all ordered the same cut of meat. The always popular filet mignon. I prefer a ribeye, but for some reason or another, I choked under the pressure of the lights and cameras (because they turned their attention to me of course). I didn't know if I wanted to flex for the camera or throw my shoe at it. So I ordered a filet. We all took turns choosing accompanying sides because we're lame. The steak is as good as you'd expect at a place like this. The only sides that stood out to me were the green beans and sauteed mushrooms. That other fancy shit failed. The crispy goosefat potatoes that I chose were not a hit at the table. That's what I get for picking something with a fancy name. So if ya catch me on your LCD holla if ya see me. Ya dig.
