Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c-B7_E48BgZ5AV5gubuYdQ.text: My wife and I visited again this past week and couldn't wait to make a trip back to Strip House. We asked for John S. again as our service on our 1st visit as I mentioned was amazing.This 2nd time was no different. We both had the NY Strip steaks again and they were excellent!! Although we ordered our steaks well-done, they still packed alot of flavor and were very juicy. The crust over the steak was perfect and the accompanying garlic cloves with each bite made for a very flavorful bite each time.  We both had caesar salads to begin with which even something as small as a salad taste great. I had the garlic herb fries and my wife a baked potato.  Of course we had the 24-layer chocolate cake again and couldn't finish it between the both of us. I'm not really a sweets or cake lover, but I always enjoy that cake.   The entire meal was great and John was on top of every detail throughout our dinner, as always. Not sure of our next trip back to Vegas, but when we do we will keep requesting for John. Thanks again and see you guys again hopefully very soon.  A definite must try and visit, well worth the money.

zWZaGieLJjPNwuIIta9rxQ.text: Too many better choices in Vegas for a steak.  Strip House disappointed on many fronts.  A few good things - the dining room is pretty cool....kinda chic but with a traditional "steakhouse" feel.  The wine list is pretty good.   There are better in Vegas for sure, but you can find a good bottle.  Tables are nicely set with pretty bread plates and butter knives.  No bread brought to table.  I looked at other tables....didn't see any bread.  I asked the server about the bread plates, butter knives and "no bread".....server said customers have to ask for bread.  I asked server how the customer was supposed to know they had to ask for bread....server said it was a new restaurant policy.  This whole bread thing makes restaurant feel cheap. I had the 8 oz filet....it was average.   Quality of meat was average.  Many better options for a great steak elsewhere in Vegas. I spoke to manager after meal.  Disappointing visit.

Dx04sK2oIF9tBtx-bjjRjw.text: Came to the strip house before seeing peep show sat 10/6, love the decor and ambiance, the service is absolutely amazing. Mini ciabata rolls are great very fresh they give you three cranberry, garlic cheese, and sourdough maybe. Strip house margarita it would have been ok but I forgot to tell them not to salt the glass (my fault, but ruined the drink for me) honestly I expected better drinks from a high end restaurant in Vegas French connection was made perfectly Caesar salad wonderful dressing anchovies were present and the croutons were delish nice cheese and garlic addition, fresh cracked pepper rounded it out  Lobster Bisque I've had better and the portion of lobster left so much to be desired and was pretty disappointing for the cost Crisply Scottish Salmon 5 stars! (The picture I've attached is of this dish) it was amazing and beautifully presented  14 oz steak, my dinner companion said it was well worth the $54 price tag     The above mentioned meal was $175 with tax and tip, we were in Vegas enjoying ourselves so why not but I think Morton's and Flemings are better (I don't eat steak so that opinion is based on seafood, drinks, and side dishes)

photos.caption: Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Scottish Salmon

EO_pVt-832OqUl_7rAwvRQ.text: I went with my fiancee and another couple, they split up our salads to share and even split up our steak as we requested without issue. Service was very good though the wait staff could be a little less attentive to be honest.   Every course was very good and though pricey, it was worth the cost. My major negatives would be the dark lighting could be improved and they pack tables in to get as many customers as possible, a pet peeve of mine.  Would definitely go back to.

AXsWkV1uu-YgY9B97Eww2Q.text: Delicious!  Was it expensive? Compare to what, Ramsay's in Paris Hotel? Not at all.  Ramsay's was good, but to me, Strip House blew them away.   I had the long bone to share with my daughter and we both love it.    The food, the service, the presentation was outstanding.

k2MN5l-zBEKfjA3PCACKMw.text: Dinner for two was an ok, decent experience but at the price and with all the other steak house options in Vegas, I wouldn't go back. Everything was a little underwhelming. Nothing was terrible but nothing was amazing either. Bloody mary's were insipid, like tomato juice with a dash of tabasco. First appetizers were Lobster bisque with  Israeli couscous and the scallops. The Bisque was very good, rich full flavor but the couscous was at best a distraction. It didn't add anything good to the soup. One scallop was amazing. It had a deep heavy char and full rich flavor. The other scallop was ok but not nearly as charred or as good as the other. Had the one not been so good, the other would have probably been fine. You could not look at the plate and not notice the glaring difference in how the two were cooked, but it was still delivered to me mis matched. We split a caesar salad. It was good but way over dressed. The croutons were seasoned with paprika and distracted more than they complimented. Too  much cheese too.  Steaks have an odd crust. It's good and tasty but not what I expect on a quality dry aged steak. Felt like camouflage.  It just wasn't for me. Also, the steak was not evenly cooked. One end was a little more done than the other.  Au Poivre sauce was rich and tasty. The NY Strip Oscar was good but a little undercooked, the crab portion generous and well executed. Sides really bothered me. Truffled creamed spinach and Potatoes Romanoff were just so over the top  that the the main ingredients were totally lost. The spinach could easily have been any leafy vegetable or even news paper. It was just a thick rich gooey overload of cream and truffle overkill. Same problem with the potatoes. Just too much cheese. It was cheese on cheese on cheese covered with melted cheese.  The famous 20some layer chocolate cake looked amazing and the very top layer of chocolate was really good. Otherwise it was dry and heavy. It's a giant slice for 2 or more people to easily share but it's not good cake at all. It's a lot like one of the giant cake monstrosities at Cheesecake Factory or a similar chain. The wine was excellent. They have a "bucket list" of wines by the glass that I plan on returning for but I'll just have that at the bar. I don't think I'd eat there again.  I do get the whole steak house experience and LOVE a decadent over the top meal but they lost track of flavor and balance along the way.

zBa7OF-iZo8QkOC62bWcug.text: I visit Las Vegas quite often both on business trips and for vacations, I've eaten at many different restaurants, and due to the outstanding service I received from my cocktail server I can now say that I will definitely be coming back every time I visit. The service was absolutely top notch, I now know why Vegas is #1 in customer service. It is because of gems (no pun intended) like Crystal that make my stay enjoyable. I had dinner at the lounge and wanted to order a steak and I didn't know what to pair it with, Crystal told me told to try the dry age rib eye and to pair it with a wente cab. Wow does she know her stuff, not only was the pairing spot on, There was never a moment where I found myself needed anything that I would have to ask for. She made sure my wine was never empty. Needless to say because of my wonderful experience I had to give the restaurant and especially Crystal a lovely review.  Thank you Crystal you are one in a million!

5h9STLcbk_J9tGUWJfZ2hA.text: My husband and I dined here Sunday evening. Strip House has a sexy classic steakhouse feel. We were seated in the corner booth with our backs to the bar. The restaurant had seven parties dining and we were all crammed toward the front of the restaurant - I never understand why that is. Service was terribly slow to start. It had us concerned, but thankfully once the large group beside us was served it improved. Our waiter was attentive the rest of the meal.  We snacked on bread while we looked over the menu. After making our selections, we were brought an amuse bouche of potato soup. It was smooth as silk, but it had the starchy potato taste. It puzzled my palette... in a good way.  We had a crab cake to start. It was nicely presented, with lots of crab - it'd better at $17. It was pretty good, but I prefer them spicy. My husband had the rack of lamb and I had the filet, we shared a side of their Romanoff potatoes. The steak and lamb were both very good, juicy and tender with a nice crust. The chops were the second best we've had. Aureole remains at the top. Frank enjoyed the potatoes, but they were too sour for my liking.  We skipped dessert. We were pleasantly full. The check came to $125 before tip. It was a fine meal, but spendy. Still, I'm glad we gave it a try.  Photos were added.

Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes Romanoff
Photo of Strip House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of Lamb

N7FqNzXOCnwLbOCtSxG9vw.text: I'm really conflicted about this place..I expected so much and left with really dry steak pieces still stuck in my teeth.  We went for dinner at 9pm on July 4th and the place was half filled..not a good sign.  Our wait service was alright.  However, we ordered goose fat fries which the waiter forgot or didn't hear my husband when he ordered it.  Nevertheless, we asked about it and it ended up coming during the last part of our meal.    Now let me get to the steak.  We ended up sharing a 28 day dry aged rib eye.  On the advice of the waiter, he said to order the steak "medium" with pink in the middle vs "medium-rare" which he said would mean that the steak would still be dark pink and cool in the middle.  BIG MISTAKE!  I don't exaggerate when I say that the steak was TOUGH as cardboard and it had to literally saw through the steak to get a piece off.  Also there is this extremely salty and peppery crust on the steak that added to the dryness to the steak.  Also, the goose fat potatoes were also very dry with a tough crust around it.  Interesting enough, that was also very salty.  The only saving grace is the truffle creamed spinach.  This dish is delicious!  My lasting memory of this place is salty tough steak that was stuck in my teeth on the way back to our hotel...not pleasant.

d6pmP35apFocpHjjVi62uw.text: My boyfriend and I had dinner here last night. The staff was amazing, food ok but the big brown water bug/cock roaches I could have done without. We watched one go completely across the dining room floor and then again in the bathroom. I couldn't eat thinking what must be back in the kitchen. I didn't say anything last night so as not to alarm any guests but EWW. They have to know these huge nasty bugs are in this restaurant as we were there only 2 hours!!

zjJHShlK15s9bnsqIqJveQ.text: We were here for the famous Thuy Nga Paris By Night 106th episode recording and show.  For those not in the know the show is the longest running Vietnamese American music variety show famous the world over...among the Vietnamese and Vietnamese diaspora. Enough of the cultural/history lesson.    My girlfriend had an excellent idea of spending our time at the Planet Hollywood early so we would not have to fight with about 7,500 other people who were going to show up at the same time crowding up the casino parking lot and valet so we went there about 3 hours prior to the show, she played some slots, I walked around scouting the place making sure we knew where the entrance to the show was.  We initially wanted French but couldn't find it on our smart phone that there was one at the Planet.  So we settled for a steak joint which I was not too excited about since I have high cholesterol but do enjoy my steaks. But as Californians recently deprived of foie gras my girlfriend was aching for some but oh well.  We should have researched it better before we left the house.  We were probably one of the first 2 couples there, we came in before it opened so we had to wait outside a bit and took pictures. Decor was very nice and elegant.  A bit dimly lit.   She ordered a black cherry martini recommended by the waiter (wasn't that good but made a great pix with the GF that is still a screen saver on my phone. Oh, check out my profile picture, that's the big ol martini being mentioned). The waiter recommended a good slightly sweet white wine (which I like since I don't like my wine dry) as I knew we were heading into a seafood meal.    We selected the full platter appetizer. It came with a spread of cold seafood and included oysters on the half shell, clams on the half shell, a couple of small pieces of king crab or something like that, very flavorful poke tuna/tuna tartar, seafood ceviche (too darn tangy) and I am sure shrimp cocktails. We also decided, wise choice by the GF, to split an order of the Chilean sea bass (I know, endanger this and that...look, it's their fault!...if Chilean Sea Bass didn't taste so darn good they would not be in danger of extinction, just kidding of course, but this is the first time I ordered it in over 4 years since my grandmother's 85th birthday so I am not arching over with guilt). Oh, we also ordered the creamed spinach with black truffles as a side...which we could in no way finish but it was great.  We managed to go to a steak house and not having to order the usual steaks so I was really happy about the alternatives.  But I think cholesterol count-wise I lost the battle to the creamed spinach because who knows how many sticks of butter was in that decadence side. It was that rich (and delicious) but after a while you couldn't eat any more.  I am rating this a bit low because I didn't like the fact that the waiter made me feel like I under spent. He was constantly trying to up sell that it would not be enough food then visibly disappointed when we did not want desert. Hey dude, we were stuffed and we had a show to catch, cholesterol to maintain and my weight to watch. =) He did manage to recommend a good white wine and the creamed spinach.

I1g4JS4l-lqkj6vC8YQvhw.text: Been here a few times and figured it was time to write a review. The filet is on point with the cream of spinach. Scott showed us a fine dining experience and we will definitely back.

sP-fhJGFqdSpxlcmsi16cA.text: This is an amazing steakhouse!! Went on a Friday night before the Britney concert, so they made sure we were out on time. It was packed and there wasn't an empty seat, yet they managed to ensure we were taken care of on time. Appreciate that. The food is divine! Steak was cooked perfectly. Sides to die for! Their version of potatoes au gratin was heavenly. Mac n cheese was good, so we're the mushrooms. A True steakhouse that delivers. Hope to return soon when I'm back in town.

fuMX9J0iXFxpWgKYcCPT_A.text: With 10 million steak houses in Vegas, this place is just ok. Nothing remarkable about the meat or accompaniments.  Its overall very heavy.  And planet hollywood sucks so ya.

RdKcBJC6qUuXWpeyEXYKUg.text: Hands down one of the best dining experiences of my life. Everything about this place was absolutely phenomenal. A must try!
